author: {'steamid': '76561198052066136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1706053411}
review: Really simple but fun digital board game. I really like the art style and love just playing a skirmish or two against the AI as a way to unwind. I haven't tried online much, when I did try a real-time match, I didn't connect to a player. Fortunately, the AI is fun enough to play against and has three different difficulty settings for a more or less chill experience (though even normal can still be a little tricky depending on how the board ends up getting laid out).

author: {'steamid': '76561198326416322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2308, 'last_played': 1704067519}
review:
A nice little puzzle game.  Good art, GREAT voice, good music, really good game design, nice and tight.  I didn't find any exploits but maybe there are some.  Of course the AI is only going to be so difficult so this game will probably shine in multiplayer.  

Like a lot of games of this type, it REALLY suffers from "first turn itis".  That is, the early game matters a hell of a lot, and if you get behind you will not catch up.  And there isn't a lot of depth to early game strat--what you need to do is almost robotic.

The depth in the gameplay will come later, but unfortunately does involve a bit of memorisation.  Also you can see things happening on your opponent's turn but in order to watch them you have to sit there for quite a while sometimes.  It'd be good if there were a way to see a quick summary of events so you don't have to memorise them or sit through the animations ever time.

A couple notes for the devs:

1. I couldn't see a way to replay the "story" bits I'd unlocked.

2. Clicking certain tiles/characters can be a little tricky when they're stacked on each other.  Maybe a grid overlay with pre-selction highlighing as an option?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993417418', 'num_games_owned': 1661, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1586274556}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975760979', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1687978831}
review:
I have to agree with all the positive reviews, this is an entertaining and interesting game.
Thinks of it as a Victorian board game based around the Dodger from Oliver Twist.
It's more about adapting your strategy than luck, think of it as more Risk than Monopoly.
It has an entertaining single player, an engaging multi player and an unusual play and wait multi player mode.
Overall it has that one more go aspect of Ticket to Ride

author: {'steamid': '76561198280864538', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 12245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8907, 'last_played': 1696795333}
review:
A brilliant board-game developed by a single person, and is maintained throughout the years. He still actively responds on Steam forums and the Discord server. The single-player campaign is very short (10 missions), but enjoyable nonetheless. AI is not very smart, so the single player random map mode is for trying out strategies and learning the maps mostly. Multiplayer mode is the fun part. There is a live and an asynchronous mode with a ranking system (casual match). Not many people play live, so your best bet is giving a shout at the Discord server if you want to play live. You can still find matches in the asynchronous mode after all these years. However, the only people who regularly play are the long time veterans, so you will definitely lose in the beginning and will be playing with a small player base. Looking on the bright side, you will learn a lot from them. Get this amazing and cute board game, and spread the love. This game definitely deserves a far wider audience.

FYI. You can also play it on your Android phone/tablet. This is very convenient for the asynchronous mode since you have to check whether your opponent played their turn etc. However, to play the game on your Android you have to purchase the game from the playstore a second time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214373645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1702213058}
review:
轻策略桌游，评论区很多人都提到大富翁，游戏核心在于每回合规划资源，如何设计策略针对对手，并且尽快获得任务点，理想情况感觉甚至是可以推出实体桌游的，策略难度不高，抽一个下午就能全通关，画风类似饥荒很可爱，个人还是非常喜欢的，而且貌似支持双人对战。

缺点：
1.可能是太冷门或者别的什么原因，线上基本找不到人进行对战
2.流程太短，不过瘾；

如果没有上述缺点，想必一定是一款十分出色的桌游

喜欢桌游类游戏的朋友可以无脑入

author: {'steamid': '76561198018568632', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1683523551}
review:
[h1]Game Review from 30 Minutes of Play[/h1]
Reminding myself if I should revisit and if you should purchase.

[b]ELEVATOR PITCH: The Seedy Underbelly of the 19th Century with cute Oliver Twist Graphics on a Board Game[/b]
LIKED: Chess-lite with simple moves yet provides some depth. A hidden gem which I only now started to get through my backlog to play. Similar "one more turn" feel. I like to burgle.
DISLIKED: If you peel away the cute graphics, it may detract from what you're really doing. Robbing, killing, exploitation, etc. I hate I'm only now discovering this game as the player base is almost nil. Multiplayer sounds fun! Still a great game to get.

[b]===== Mood After 30mins =====[/b]
☐ Addicted
☑ Afternoon delight
☐ Grindfest
☐ Frustrated

[b]===== Will I Revisit =====[/b]
☐ Yes, I aim to 100% complete
☑ Yes, but only beat the game
☐ Eventually. Until then, back to the pile
☐ No, on to other games

[b]===== Price =====[/b]
☐ Full price worthy
☑ Discount
☐ Deep discount
☐ Pass

[b]Disclaimer:[/b] [i]I'm aware 30 minutes is not enough time to properly review any game. Historically, I'm a big completionist when it comes to gaming, but my backlog will just not die and adulting obligations continue to mount. I needed to find some sense of accomplishment with my backlog other than buying them at great discount. Dedicating at least 30 minutes of play per game will be my arbitrary sense of achievement. It may not justify my gaming spending habits, but I'll suffer less buyer's remorse. Who knows, in 30 minutes I might discover a great game I want to revisit and something you want to purchase. GGs![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198056404028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1669626614}
review: Played this game already when it was published in 2017, spending hours over hours with this awesome boardgame! If you're into the Charles Dickens atmosphere, and you love intelligent, demanding boardgames, then this one is for you. After completing the campaign, which basically introduces more and more game elements, you can endlessly play the custom games. I like to play a short party in between, because Antihero's sessions are short, but always different, because of all the possibilities you have to win. Although mainly new skins for the playing figurines, I recommend the DLCs too, because playing with Oliver Twist completes the Charles Dickens experience. Full recommendation, if you like the kind of game and setting!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198959978196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1674628002}
review:
I seriously love this game so much!
I could play it all day!
The music and sound effects are great and the artstyle is so cartoony-cute for those little criminals.
Playing against friends is really fun, but sometimes playing against AI's is a bit annoying. They literally cancel your every move in games with high difficulty level. 
I'm a bit curious about online matches as I've never been able to find an opponent - although I can see (in the leader board) that many people actually play live matches, which is a bit frustrating. I've waited many times over 10mins just to find someone but nope, no luck at all:(
But on the other hand, the casual matches are great! You can play at your own pace as well as your opponent (which is a great feature for someone who doesn't have the time or doesn't want to stay on a match for 30-40mins without a break) and you can actually have a great time!
I do recommend this game for Board-game/ Strategy lovers like myself, I just wish I could finally play a live match sometime!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007328926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1681917759}
review: This is a little, fun game. The music is relaxing; the characters are cute; the difficulty level is about right; the gameplay is decent. It is a turn based strategy game that is not like anything else. It is not a card game and not a fighting game like Xcom. It is far less intense than Xcom. So, you can just relax and enjoy it. This game may look difficult at first. But the normal difficulty level isn't too difficult after a few failed missions. No, you will not lose your progress even after a failed mission. You can retry it again and again until you finish the mission and move on to a new mission. I haven't finished the game yet, but I suppose it is not a long game. However, it really doesn't matter cause it is like a board game. There is some randomness built into the game. So, each time you play the same mission, it will be some what different. You can also adjust the difficult level to reply the same mission again. It has a lot of replay value, kind of like the old Monopoly board game. Get it when it is on sale and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097599335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 631, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1538765155}
review: Отличная  игра в  жанре  настолки/стратегии,  в  которой,  как  и  гласит  название,  вы  управляете  воровской  гильдией,  получая  очки  победы за  убийства,  грабежи  и  прочие  преступные  деяния. Игра  выполнена  на  высоте  не  только в  плане  механик,  но  и  в  плане  графики,  звукового  и  музыкального сопровождения. Однако стоит  иметь  в  виду, что  игра  рассчитана именно на  мультиплеер. Хоть в  игре  и  имеется  одиночная  компания,  она  скорее  играет  роль  обучения и  сюжет  там  довольно условный,  как  и  его длина. Поначалу  часть  видов  наемников шла  в  виде  платных длс,  но на  данный  момент  все  они  доступны в  базовой  игре,  а  длс стали  наборами  скинов для  мультиплеера.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010395257', 'num_games_owned': 3330, 'num_reviews': 470, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1654226110}
review:
So I actually ended up enjoying this game, but this is far from "fast-paced."  Perhaps it's because I was super new to the game and just trying to figure it out with a bud, but there were often times were it felt like turns could take upwards of 15 minutes at a time.  I know I'm nitpicking, but it feels disingenuous to say it's fast-paced when the game feels like a slower session of Civ5.

That said, you can get THROUGH an entire session of this game quickly in that the end objectives are varied and you only need to get 5 points, so maybe that's what's meant by fast-paced, not sure.  ANYWAY...yes, I did end up enjoying it.  The prospect of running a thieves guild, pushing a bunch of gangs and street urchins to do your dirty work, assassinating targets, blackmailing, bribing, sabotaging...yeah, it's all good stuff for sure.

There's a lot of interesting strategy at work here and if anything I've said in that last sentence sounds fun, go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198839096895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1651403661}
review: It's fun, kinda, but even by the second and third missions I was noticing how quickly the AI can just steamroll your progress. A single eviction unit can remove all your resource units from a building (that just took you three turns to fill.) If you didn't use a trap unit, you're out 3 turns. If you used a trap unit, you're out 4 turns - because the eviction unit got trapped, but the AI sends a fighter unit that can ALSO evict into the same building that is no longer trapped, evicting your resource units. The AI will use assassins before you even know that's a possibility. The game will undo all your moves whenever it can, and somehow in the same turn will win 3 points towards victory. The AI has an advantage at all times, especially if you haven't learned all the games mechanics. Doesn't feel fun by the fourth mission :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198119222924', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1652127134}
review:
This game was a surprise to me. Bought it as a recommendation from a friend and got it since it was on sale and cheap, but what I found was well worth the money.

It's easy to learn, with a short campaign that introduces mechanics as you go and showcases the game's many objectives. You have a main unit that interacts with the game's tiles (that may give you money, lanterns or something else) and which returns to safety when your turn is over. Over the course of the game, you can buy units with gold (used to buy units) or lanterns (that are used to unlock more units or abilities). I don't know how to explain how it plays, but it's overall simple and straight to the point but hard to master (especially because whichever strategy you'll employ depends on the state of the map and on its mission).

The AI plays well, with a Hard difficulty that really puts you on your toes unless you're experienced with the game. Aside from that, the multiplayer lobby adds to the replayability and the game has a dedicated Discord server for matchmaking if you want to meet up and play with someone.

The presentation, cartoonesque sprites, soundtrack and goofy english-cockney-french accents in the game all contribute to the experience. 

I absolutely loved every minute playing and I wish there was more because it's such an explorable concept, but since it's an old game I really doubt there will be anything new - at the very best, maybe bug fixes or balance patches. Will definitely follow the dev for their next projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198805027874', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2155, 'last_played': 1651324216}

So, you wait an hour and play a game where you get raped by cheaters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981354175', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1643706461}
review:
So I'm writing this solely from the perspective of getting it for the singleplayer/skirmish. So if you're interested in Mplayer, maybe check another review. I'm not going to get you the right information to make an informed decision.

For a game where you would want to think a lot, there is both too much RNG and also not enough to think about. It feels like I'm supposed to be predicting where the enemy will go and what they will do, but I can't know that information (without studying the levels way too much) because of the fog of war. Of course I can see that if I focus on getting more action points and exploring, but then I gimp my other stats. The enemy gains far less benefit from exploration that I would and far too much from the others. And they will always start at an advantage so it breaks down to you exploiting the AI rather than outsmarting it. You figure out what it can do and what it's programmed to do and then just counter that specifically. That's not fun. I want a simulated human, not an overtuned AI. 

And even the game's balance is kind of bad. The concepts involved feel like they're intended to balance around economy, blocking and control, yet in practice it's so biased towards map control with so little ways to deal with being thug spammed by an AI that's been given a gold advantage. You get cut off way too easily because the AI has more money and it's not an organic experience as a result. Too much of your income and progress relies on hoping you get the right RNG to start off with even on the campaign levels. I seriously hate games that their single player campaign feels like it's just a multiplayer map because it leaves so many holes in the design. You can't 'plot' your moves for the next run, you just have to hope for the right amount of RNG or study the game to the point it becomes bland.

I'm not at all interested in multiplayer, but I like turn based board game style games usually. And I've had this game sitting my library forever. Just thought I'd dust it off to relax with. Nah, it's just too frustrating. I don't really feel like if I sit down and think about it that I'll get a lot more reward from it. I don't know where everything is from the start so I can't plan my economy too well. Yet I feel like even if everything was static that it wouldn't improve the game all that much. Because it relies way too heavily on the campaign just feeling like one giant tutorial that slowly ramps up. I made it to the three thug mission and just got so sick of playing it until finally I spawned next to a bank and several neutral npcs spawned in the right spots so the AI baited himself into the open repeatedly. Yet I STILL lost afterward because in order to land the kills on the thugs I had to develop knife technology which meant I couldn't buy the first bribe which he then did and it led to my loss.

Yet how am I supposed to predict that? Play the game until I know exactly everything the AI will do or until I hope RNG plays out in my favor so heavily I can breeze through the mission? It's really not fun and it's such a disappointment. I'd held off on playing the game because I had a feeling it would be like this. I'm sad that it turned out that I don't like the game so much. It's just not worth the advertised price. Again, if you're just getting it for singleplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247885192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1703856678}
review:
Most boards games are a physical version first before becoming a digital version, but Antihero is different, it was made to be a digital board game. It utilises game play (like hiding characters on the boards) that just wouldn't be possible in a physical version. The campaign is short but there is also a multiplayer feature.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198129894238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1641721416}
review:
剧情：盗贼行会的刺客大师，带着他的朋友们，一路学习，一路挑战，完成故事。
内容：顽童（工人）占领战略点获得资源和buff，积累资源招兵买马，炸弹人埋伏，帮派互殴清理建筑，大头给帮派回血或看门，监管人清空建筑，英雄开路探视野拿特殊奖励，刺客杀人。完成任务目标。
游戏性：全鼠标操作，类沙盒。
画面：欧美卡通风。
音乐：一个场景一个音乐无限循环，还行，能听。
音效：卡通风的既视感，参考猫和老鼠。
总评：老少皆宜的休闲桌游，不考虑手速，也不太压榨脑力。折后入小赚。

review: #8：这款桌游相当有意思！简单说三点：1、三条技能树设计得很巧妙，玩家需要根据实际情况来升级相应的技能以适应场上的实际需求，大体上没有最优策略；2、一款设计得非常简洁的游戏，却包括了探索、建造、和战斗三大元素；3、美术和画风有漫画感。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003353476', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1645595972}
review:
Great victorian-era thieves guild board game, wherein you're trying to defeat the enemy guild before they defeat you. This is one of those games I almost uninstalled out of frustration, at first, but i decided to come back for another try. There is a definite rhythm to the gameplay, and if you dont strike that groove, you can get annihilated quick.
 
  I recommend reading the player-made guide here on steam, it has some of the finer points and advice that may frustrate beginners. The aesthetic is great, and thru the scenarios you'll guide street urchins, gangs, thugs, and eventually even a sisterhood of assassins in your quest to rule the gaslit streets. 

The missions are varied enough to make you change your play style between scenarios, and a skirmish mode w/ random maps is waiting after you finish the campaign. The campaign is only 11 scenarios, and I've seen complaints on the forum about it - that doesnt bother me. By the time I rounded the corner on scenario 11, I was feeling like I'd done what I wanted to do.  
There's a randomized map skirmish mode that you can keep playing, if you want more, and I've put a couple games into it since then. The AI is smart enough to keep you on your toes, and there's a harder difficulty available if you want to ratchet up the challenge.

I picked it up for ten bucks, and I consider that a fair price, and really even full price at 15 isnt a stretch for the good time I had with it. This is one of those games, like Armello, that I can see coming back to occasionally for the weekend just to play random maps. Good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985508342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1636739992}
review:
I wish Steam had a neutral vote. I love this game's art direction, voiceovers, and overall feel. The gameplay is satisfying as well. However the enemy AI is just too irritating. Even on easy it constantly just undoes everything you do. Capture something, next round it uncaptures it. Make a thug, next round it kills your thug. Even fulfilling assassination contracts is irritating as if you don't do it exactly the perfect way the first round the enemy just steals it from you.

Maybe I just suck really bad at the game, but I find it frustrating as hell. I can't stand strategy games where I can't build my base of operations up.....the enemy AI just dismantles everything as quickly as you pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044797961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 3692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1638218606}
review: A good little board game. Graphics are cool and software runs without bugs. Mechanics is easy to learn and fast to master: player controls a thief guild and must to enhance it for reach certain victory points by different ways before his rival get them: steal gold, pay bribes, occupy buildings, kill foes. Gameplay is funny and quick, 10 to 15 turns average per session. Locations and characters look like the "Oliver Twist" book and "Gangs of New York" film. The single player main campaign, with all possible achievements offline, takes about 26 hours, strongly depends on luck and smart. Has an arcade mode with 7 maps and widely customizable rules, allowing a vast replayability; many products assures the same but very few are real: this is a truly one, specially for children, but is shorter for an adult. if it had have more maps, dices and cards would have been an instant classic. Cheap in bundles and offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072110317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1636058935}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049678707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1641651767}
review:
So... that's interesting.... cause i actually had a lot of fun playing this game.
Why giving it a thumbs down then ? There are many reasons. Let's take a look.

Like i said, the actual game is pretty fun. If you like boardgames or the Civilization kind of stuff (you know, thinking about what could be the best move, or how to spend the ressources so you will win in the future), this will absolutely be your kind of game. i would LOVE to spend more time with this.
- Most of the achievements were pretty fun and doable (more to that later)
- The difficulty is absolutely perfect (i was able to do all maps on hard difficulty in 1-2 tries, but it really costs brain power to do so, it is not a walk in the park, just perfect)

BUT

- The campaign has only 10 levels... which are pretty unique in its own way, a complete new mechanic in almost every map. so why only stop at 10 ? you can play through this in 3 hours easily. i don't get it. you wouldnt even need to add more unique maps, just .. more. It offers so much.. but kept so short...
- You can't find any active players in online mode. yeah.. they included a mode so you can play vs other players "offline"... so when the other players makes a move you will get an email... "hey now you can make your next move"... that feels so slow you dont even want to start such games.
- there are many, really hard online achievements. win 300 games online ? HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO, WHEN NO ONE PLAYS THIS GAME ONLINE. DELETE THAT GODDAMN ACHIEVEMENT (and also the other "online" achievements)
- high priced skins.... i dont need to say more...

author: {'steamid': '76561197975622745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1628989113}
review:
Alors non...

Le jeux est extremement simple, jusque au point ou il semble incomplait. Lorsque vous jouez contre la IA vous n'avez le droit a qu'une seule IA(doncs 1vs1), les villes son très petites et rapidement vous verez qu'il ne vous reste plus rien à faire. Dans mon cas j'avais 5 actions pour mon voleur et je n'en utilisait qu'une. Joué en mode difficile et gagné sans soucis.

Tros tros simple.

Cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561198054501604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1609706754}
review: Continuing along the strategy theme is Antihero, a digital board game set in a cartoon Dickensian underworld.  Each game is over in half an hour or so, but there’s enough variation (especially in the campaign mode) to keep you going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034515681', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1673395410}
review: Antihero is a fairly fast paced strategy game involving territory production. Early decisive moves can have a fast impact on game progression. Additionally the ai is relatively ok at its job if not countered early enough in the game. Some of its decisions are questionable. Its an easy game to slip in a couple of rounds in between quiet time. The campaign doesn't last long given its fast pace nature. There are skirmished you can do with the ai but likely more fun to be had from other online players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001737114', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1703514190}
review:
This game is great, but the dev is lazy and killed his own product.
We only have 10 stages in campaign, for a game this style, 10 stages should be "world 1", with 10 more worlds at least.
But no. Developer said he abandoned the game, does not care for who did support him, and went to make money on another project. You can beat the 10 stages in a couple of hours, and no more to do unless you want to repeat a duel with computer.
Ah, yes, there is a online duel match possibility. I did wait 3 hours for online match. noone came.
I was playing in family share, so i was excited about the game and bought when i was on stage 9. For my surprise, ended on stage 10. I kept waiting for online match for hours. In 3 days, i was able only to find one online match, and no more.
Dev, put this game for free if you abandoned. At least we can find online matches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360288858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1625413716}
review: Took me 6.5 hours to complete the entire game, and I'm not the type of gamer who whizzes through games. I like to take my time and figure out the nuances of the game and really enjoy it. There are online options and skirmishes where you can go back and play the same levels against an AI, but I like it when the story continues and you have more things to uncover and bosses to beat. For the $4 I paid for it, it was worth it. However, I can't recommend it at it's normal price of $15. Not enough content but the graphics are fun and the concept is novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012613219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1626056527}
review:
It's a good game, but very short and despite its brevity it gets repetitive. On heavy discount I recommend it, otherwise no. The multiplayer could be great fun as well, if there were more players.

Most of my "play time" comes for waiting in the lobby for others to make their moves. Which speaks to the core quality of the game, but also to the fact that you will never find anyone to play with. 

The single player campaign play time on hard mode is about 4 to 5 hours only. Still a decent game, with a decent amount of polish. I wish there was a little more to it still.

review:
Ein schön designtes, atmosphärisches, digitales Brettspiel für 2 Personen. Während des Spielens sorgt die zarte Musik für eine passende Untermalung. 
Das Gameplay an sich ist flüssig und abwechslungsreich. Die KI sind nicht zu lasch, sodass das Spielen der Kampagne durchaus seinen Reiz hat und auf "Normal" schon eine Herausforderung ist.
Zum Online-Mode kann ich noch nichts sagen, aber bisher würde ich das Spiel definitiv empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013135781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1670697878}
review:
Creative style for a game unlike anything I have seen. Having the freedom to purchase the units of your choice - visit aka rob the places you wish and discover and uncover each map as you wish is all exciting.

This game is a lot of fun and I continue to have hope that it will make a comeback! It was worth every penny and quite enjoyable!

Still waiting for expansions and a higher replay value; definitely want more characters to play in a sandbox mode once the story line is completed. Perhaps even an option for the size of a randomly created map and more than one AI or player to vs at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198403904091', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1680596661}
review: 因为画风入手的，因为是回合制，而且教学关有好几关，我打完教学关之后直接就后悔了，但是因为游玩时长超过两个小时了就没来得及退款。总之想入手的同学一定要去找攻略或者实况看，觉得枯燥无聊就别入手，教学关那么长多少带有些欺骗意义，别上当。这个游戏其实可以算是很枯燥，就是探图占据点哪一方胜点满了就算赢。整个游戏很长一段时间都是在谈地图，而且每一关的boss都是有设定的，而且你同一关多次的打他建筑是会变换位置的，而且这游戏想打出三星评分简直是需要开挂。我也不知道制作者怎么想的，他是觉得玩家很强吗，这种回合制的游戏还偏重策略决策，他就把boss设定特别强，boss的开局至少比多两三个回合的优势而且视野也是绝对的优势，想拿三星真就是等着boss犯傻，当然几率很低。玩到后面想刷三星评分，真的是被boss恶心得死去活来，总之没来得及退款我也是个伞兵

author: {'steamid': '76561198220195440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1621562163}

review: 桌游爱好者一定不能错过的轻策略发展向桌面游戏，跟小伙伴（匹配到认识的）玩得非常愉快，且含有一定程度的随机性（出生点附近房子的类型、野怪的点位等），虽然剧情稍微简单了一些，但是也不影响其趣味性，总之墙裂推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198134294263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1622732414}
review: Un juego de mesa con los mejores matices del Ajedrez y el Risk  llevados a PC. Muy entretenido. Ambientación mezcla entre la Londres de Jack el Destripador, La Nueva York de Gangs of New York y Fable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199075593526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1633100755}
review:
游戏挺好玩的，画面很舒适，音乐相对单调但也可以忍受。

主要糟心的点在于关卡难度不一致。AI还是相对简单无脑一些，期待和玩家对战。

剧情模式里，三种颜色帽子那一关和最后一关，这两关可玩性相对高一些。（买凶杀人，让静默姐妹出场，或者开第二gang，然后三个火枪手一起突突突，两种方式任选一个都能打通关）

我比较喜欢那个教导主任，像一只驾着马车的老猴子，可以把三个顽童一次性全抓走，好爽。还有就扔手雷陷阱的那个蒙面怪侠，开图我不是很常用，主要用来保护重要资产比如银行，或者受到对方攻击过的建筑。

有玩家想一起线上对战的嘛？感觉可能会更有趣。

review: This game is geared towards online PVP games which I'm not one to do so I'm just going to review the story mode. I enjoyed this game, you need to plan ahead because you only have a certain number of actions per turn and you can't do everything. The story mode isn't very long as you can tell from my play time but it does have replay value as you could pursue different win conditions in the level. Good game, worth a look, especially for PVP gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019658507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1619493576}
review:
I grabbed this game for a couple bucks during a sale event for a friend and I. I’ve not done the multi-player yet BUT the single player version is fun and challenging. 

You must set yourself up for success and do it quickly. The computer is ruthless and quick, once you have hit turn 10 or so, you better be setting yourself up for the win in the next 1 or 2 turns or it’s over. If you want to slow play the game and try to win using only one option, like assassination contracts or bribes, the computer will defeat you. There is only one real strategy, win and do it quickly by whatever means necessary. 

If you like turn based strategy style board games, I highly recommend AntiHero especially for the 5 dollar and under price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158938940', 'num_games_owned': 2643, 'num_reviews': 694, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1628698722}
review:
Just beat the game.

This game contains several maps to beat, each is challenging, even you can choose difficulty but later levels can still be hard.

It's not a roll-dice and become a millionaire kind of game, in each turn you earn limited money to spend on upgrades or to hire people. 
You need to use it wisely- decide when to buy and what to buy first. Then, figure out the best route to have your hero discover, which house to infiltrate first and which one to assassin first. 
I think after some 3 hrs you start to know the trick.

Game is fun but kinda limited, as in each of level the machinic is the same, even the maps are different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321641882', 'num_games_owned': 1748, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1615431138}
review:
A very nice board game.
The rules of the game are very clear. It's one of easy-to-learn and hard-to-master. Playing singleplayer is pretty challenging even in normal mode. But AI somewhat has only one strategy so if you get to know what it is, it is pretty easy to finish the campaign. Multiplayer is somewhat active but getting 300 wins is one of the achievements and probably hard to acquire. It doesn't take more than 30 mins normally to finish one game unless you think too hard. Multiplayer might become painful if your opponent takes too much time thinking. It's similar to playing chess multiplayer for that matter.
The whole design and music was really tasteful whole time.  It's so slick!
10/10 recommended.
<번역>
굉장히 재밌는 보드게임
게임 룰은 매우 명확하고 처음에 배우기는 쉽지만 마스터하긴 어려운 그런 게임이다. 싱글플레이어로 하는건 노멀모드에 해서도 충분히 어려운 편인데, ai가 전략을 하나밖에 추구를 안해서 그것만 잘 간파하면 쉽게 끝낼수 있을것이다. 멀티플레이어도 돌아가긴 돌아가는데 멀티플레이어로 300승하는게 도과인데 그건 좀 얻기 힘들어보인다. 지나치게 생각을 많이 하지만 않는다면 한 게임하는데 30분정도밖에 안걸린다. 멀티에서는 상대방이 시간 많이 쓰면 그건 좀 고통스러울수 있음. 그 부분은 체스를 멀티로 하는거랑 비슷하다고 보면 된다. 
디자인과 음악이 진짜 대단했다. 졸라 멋있음.
10/10 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561198118906044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1704352929}
review:
This game is awesome. A surprising amount of depth for what on the surface seems like another Flash-style video-game-board-game. BUT. IN THIS INSTANCE. NO 2 games are alike.  I feel like its a bit underrated due to it being turn-based and requiring a bit more patience to get into. Once you do, it is highly, highly worth it. 

Boardgame-wise: almost an exploration/worker placement/territory control game. 

Videogame-wise: fits into that lovely nook of being a highly-designed and stylized, easy-to-grasp mechanics-but difficult to master gameplay due to procedural generation and varying scenarios. 

All this provides for a fun, tight, and intriguing choice-making vg boardgame, in the same vein as Armello and Tharsis (less random chance/sucky than the latter), with more of a focus on your 'Master Thief' and their and territory conttrol.

Plus it totally embraces the 'Oliver' & 'Gangs of New York' stereotypes which makes for a hilarously giiggly, dark, comedic, 4th-wall breaking game.

"I am Here."

"HELLo CHILLdren."

10/10 would replay

10/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198026911788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1618517703}
review:
Great Fun!

After finally trying it, I find Anithero is quick, lighthearted, and strategic fun. When I first heard about the game, the crime theme turned me off and I didn't buy it until it was deeply discounted. Now I can't stop playing.

Likes:
The music is delightfully evocative; so are the accents to my American ear.
The comic book art style suits the game very well.
Quickness of play is refreshing after hours and hours of Civ 6 and XCom. I haven't timed myself, but my impression is that I win or lose  games in about 15-20 minutes and 15-20 turns.
There seem to be different routes to victory via promotion trees, at least against the AI, and a feeling of being easy to learn yet difficult to master.

Dislikes:
Random maps can make matches easier or harder. But I appreciate that this rewards exploration and requires new strategies.
I wish there was a career mode, or at least stats, beyond the single campaign.

I haven't tried PvP yet, but the AI works well enough for me so far. I am having a blast with this game and wish I had tried it years ago!

review:
Originally I bought this game because it was on sale and was curious about it. In the end I'm incredibly glad I did. 
I enjoy both the campaign and the skirmish mode as well. It has a fun little story, an interesting art style and is quite easy to learn the ropes of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067170413', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 389, 'playtime_at_review': 3912, 'last_played': 1712454490}
review:
This is a really good turn-based strategy game. Ultimately it's a 1v1 competitive online game. There is a single player campaign, but the lasting appeal is online. Playing through the story will give you a good introduction to how the mechanics work and the strategies you will be employing when you decide you're ready to face a human.

Plenty of people have described how the game works, so I won't get into that. All you need to know is that the game has a lot of strategy and the online works well. It's fun to level up your thief and guild each turn. As you uncover more of the city, your strategy might change depending on what you find. The matches can last about 45 minutes, but you can also play asynchronous games where you take your turn, then quit the game and have it email you when it's your turn again. It's pretty convenient. For the ranked matches, you have to stay online though, and your turns have a time limit.

All in all, it's a very well designed game with a decent amount of depth. Randomness isn't much of a factor and there is no pay-to-win mechanic. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys 1v1 board games or strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010835834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1607372452}
review: A beautiful game well worth the price!  This intuitive turn-based digital strategy boardgame transports you into a graphic-novel like kid's noir city, where kingpin thieves manipulate urchins and gangs for territorial control of city resources (like a board game adaptation of the Gangs of New York movie, which it seems to emulate).  It seems to cater best to the intermediate to casual level strategy gamer, offering games lasting about 20 minutes, and a campaign that carefully tutors you and ramps you up into harder levels.  The art, animation, UX and audio are wonderful, and the game itself offers a solid playing experience with some variety across the 11 city campaign, its 3 difficulty levels and asynchronous versus mode online.  Obviously this was a labor of love, as every detail is beautifully done, from snappiness of every interaction, so easy and intuitive, the cinematic effects, darkly joyful, the alignment in mood of music and art, etc.   The only criticism is that the challenge and complexity are limited/casual after you've played through the campaign once.  On the first playthrough its wonderful fun figuring out how to vary your strategy and tech-tree choices, but once you've figured out a winning strategy and learned how to adapt it to the 11 or so  play variants in the campaign, it becomes relatively straight forward to beat almost every level, even on the hardest setting (mostly by focusing on maintaining majority control of resource generating buildings while selectively killing or evicting the enemies most value resources).  Hopefully an expansion will be offered that escalates the challenge and replayability (maybe with less handicapped AI, randomly generated maps & enemy configurations more like Slay the Spire, or expansions to the tech-tree and character/building types).  I'd definitely jump to buy any of these ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013375361', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1606233715}
review:
[h1]Anti Review?[/h1]

I don't know, I try to avoid this game since they lunch many years ago, and I don't feel like I want to play it. Why? The game play trailer! You see your character move around on the grid but it is not traditional tactic style movement, you see a lot characters going in the build and out of the building. My god, it is very confusing, what going on with this game?

But then, the time is finally come. After a few years past and most review look positive, and a discount is very decent, I decide to try the game that everyone talk about (or used to) once and for all. Which is... very surprising, the tutorial is very good. The game mechanic is very clear and the story is not so shabby. I'm surprise that I can adapt to the game very well, I can plan my game and I can make that happen accordingly, I finish the campaign in a few day (and most of that time I spend on catching some achievement).

What can I say? It is a great game, one of a kind.
It's a shame that I feel anti about it at first, but at least now I don't feel that way anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072779217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2185, 'last_played': 1710521626}
review:
Excellent jeu tactique en tour par tour, qui mériterait davantage de publicité !

Le jeu est très bien équilibré (ce qui est rare) : toutes les stratégies sont viables.
J'aime l'aspect guerre de l'information: il est capital de découvrir les ressources de l'adversaire tout en l'empêchant de faire de même.
Même quand l'un des joueurs prend l'avantage, la situation peut se retourner rapidement, ce qui crée de nombreux rebondissements.
Une part d'aléatoire bien dosée permet de varier les parties (et d'éviter d'avoir l'impression de jouer aux échecs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198040729539', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1605614349}
review:
If you can get this on sale for less than $5 (as I did), go for it. But I can't really call this worth $15. 
I finished the campaign in ~5 hours. At first, it was difficult, but once I realized half the units were just a waste to resources, I got through it rather fast. The end makes it sound like more is coming, but the dev said he is done with it.
I have no personal interest in online multiplayer and it seems to be added just to flesh the game out because of the abysmally short campaign. Plus, multiplayer is d-e-a-d.
It is not necessarily a bad game, but it does not justify it's base price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124299402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1605491754}
review:
At first I was skeptical with the art style, but because I once played 'Don't Starve' games, so I guess it's an OK-ish for me. To my surprise, it's awesome and fits the 'dark humor' and story-lines that looks like a comic of some sort (if you'd like to put it that way).

Now the challenges even coming from the tutorial mode could use part of your brain to use. This game can be relaxing and also frustrating at the same time, depends on level of difficulties you wish to achieve but I like mechanism of this game. Every turns seems like matter (if you're on Normal and Hard mode) and if you fail to see the opportunity to win; you'll have a hard time (at least for me) to catch up...

Anyway I recommend this totally for its game-play wise that requires strategy (a bit for luck, because it's NOT RNG) and you can keep coming back if you wish to get all achievements and using your brain altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050804500', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1603741903}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065005468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1603986312}
review:
Um jogo simples de entender e divertido de jogar. Muito bem construído, onde todos os aspectos do jogo são complementares e em linha com suas premissas, fazendo com que ele se torne instantaneamente familiar para quem o joga. O modo campanha é muito bem balanceado, onde as dificuldades são difíceis o suficiente para não ser frustantes e ao mesmo tempo desafiadoras. O único problema, na minha opinião, é achar partidas online, que pode demorar um bocado.

Acho que se eu fosse escolher uma palavra para esse jogo seria: divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033086654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1656699682}
review:
It's a fun turn-based strategy  game where you have to use your resources wisely.  It's made more fun by levels with different win conditions where you have to steal the royal jewels, kill three roaming gangs, murder the final villain three times before he consolidates too much power, etc.
It's pretty short game too, I completed the campaign on medium in about seven hours so keep that in mind if you like that or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198968873557', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1601197865}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987731081', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1516119884}
review: Rewelacyjny turowy indyk, w którym wcielamy się, w mistrza przestępczej gildii. Gra polega na stopniowym przejmowaniu miasta oraz poszerzaniu swoich wpływów poprzez morderstwa, szantaże oraz realizację wyznaczonych celów na konkretnych mapach. Śliczna grafika, emocjonująca rozgrywka, a no i naprawdę sporo kombinowania. Kampanię przechodzimy w około 6-8 h, a potem zostaje ciśnięcie online, co oczywiście jeszcze podbija poziom trudności i sprawia, że gra jest jeszcze ciekawsza. Bardzo polecam i właściwie, to nie mam się do czego przyczepić, dlatego daję 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006486835', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1599111882}
review: Very fun. A strategy game for people who don't have time for strategy games that take 12+ hours per match. Each game takes about 30-40 mins. You can play online directly, or play online indirectly where turns are taken at leisure and you are emailed when it's your turn, similar to chess. Otherwise the game as a whole is a little on the short side, but not too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994799924', 'num_games_owned': 2408, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1598051517}
review:
Bought this at an extreme discount. Had been wanting it since it came out, and was really excited to see the price drop.

I was really happy through the first two tutorial levels, and then they introduced the mechanic that wastes your turns and can't be reasonably defended against -- the truancy officer. He goes random places, isn't visible on the map, and can remove any improvements on a tile you place unless you guessed he'd go somewhere. The one defense only lasts 2 turns, and isn't reasonably priced enough to put everywhere.

I tried to do this level three times, and found he crippled me thoroughly again and again.

So I uninstalled the game and am writing this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947616036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1597783325}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1597072271}
review:
This is an iOS/console ported 2D turn based strategy boardgame with a thief/burglar theme.   Pilfer business in an old european city and defeat your rivals. 

This isn't the worst mobile ported thing I've seen, but it suffers heavily from mobile-itis.  Fixed resolution means the game falls beneath minimum standard for PC. 

The developer has the audacity to charge $15 USD for this on Steam, AAA pricing that gets you games like Pathfinder: Kingmaker, but it's $5 USD on iOS.  Do these jerks think PC gamers are suckers ready to be price gouged?  I can't recommend anyone rewards this morally bankrupt greed and pays that much extra money so they can pretend their cutting edge gaming rig is a crappy iPhone.   Now we know who the real wanna-be thieves are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083196556', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1655604542}
review:
I am conflicted with this game- as much as i love it.. i hate it   I am just so frustrated with the fact you have to wait over 5 min easy for a random connect for the online synchronized game.  the asynchronized is fun but after waiting forever i find myself just resigning so i can move on to someone playing more often.

I will probably keep playing even though the campaign is limited and can be done in a day easy, I see a lot of fun potential in this game and i have high hopes for later on...

fix these issues and i would say i would recommend this, as it is.. looking for a fun strategic game to go against an AI.. this is fun.. .however i would stress, from what i can tell from the hours i played.. .

author: {'steamid': '76561198304690132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2356, 'last_played': 1595920317}
review:
最初は何となくルールを覚える。
イマイチ理解できなかったルールが見えてくると
ユニークなゲーム内容に感心させられた。

キャンペーンのステージモードは少なすぎる。
チュートリアルを含めて11ステージは全然物足りない。
せめて３倍のボリュームは欲しかった。

ハードモードでも理不尽に感じる要素が一切感じられず
イラっとすることもほとんどナッシング。
もっとボリュームがあれば、もっと面白かっただろうに。
ほんのチョットだけボリューム不足だった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198316748185', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1619347152}
review:
Неплохо.

Я люблю Dishonored из-за стиля.

Я люблю настольные игры.

Я люблю стильную рисовку.

Я люблю думать.

Всё это про Antihero - прекрасная инди-игра про битву двух гильдий воров. Если у вас схожи пункты сверху, то вам точно понравится эта игра. В этой игре вы должны распространить своё влияние в городе и получить пять обедных очков. Если опонент плохо играет то это будет быстро, если как вы, то это может затянуться на десятки минут. В игре есть кампания, что фактически обучение, хот-сит - с другом за одним компом и онлайн режим. Что же хорошого? А то что всё это прекрасно сочетается и создаёт может и незабываемую, но прекрасную игру.

review: Lots of fun, and a pretty quick game to play. I primarily played this as multiplayer with the SO, which probably made it more fun. I like the fact that they'll send emails that it's your turn so you don't have to be online at the same time. There is some variety in game play, with each map having a special goal to it. After 10 hours or so we did get bored and moved onto a different game. However particularly if you get this on sale it's a fun 10 hours with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024984271', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1595313024}
review:
I'm giving this a thumbs up, as I enjoyed it and I loved the graphics/asthetic. I really liked the gameplay mechanics.

BUT. 

Some of the chapters are not balanced very well. A couple were super easy while another couple were extremely hard. Chapter 3 for example was really tough to the point where even on easy it was super hard. It took me a lot of tries to get past it, and looking at the forum for the game it seems like lots of other people found this chapter hard too. But the final boss chapter was pretty easy to do even on non-easy difficulties. I think one or two may have been a bit buggy as well. One map it told me I should get my thugs to infiltrate a palace using a mask feature that was only available on that map, but I completed the map without doing so making the mask feature pretty useless. 

Also, for multiplayer/online I have so far not been able to find a match at all. It's possible I am just looking at the wrong time of the day, but even if that is true, I would expect there to be the occasional available match. But no, nothing. So if you are buying this game for the online matches, you may want to reconsider. 

Lastly, the game was relatively short. I think the game would have more longevity if there was an element of maps being procedurally generated. I mean, there is a degree of RNG with some building locations but the maps are essentially the same each time you play them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017436046', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1613802371}

author: {'steamid': '76561199040109316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1594072845}
review: Un petit jeu au tour à tour, très apprécié et plaisant à jouer. Chaque chapitre, un nouveau défi, une nouvelle difficulté sous différentes conditions qui se rajoutes. Ce qui nous poussent donc à réfléchir pour effectuer la bonne stratégie à poser nos "pions" qui nous permettra d'arriver à nos fins. Un beau design bien cute, plusieurs méchants. Sans grosse prise de tête, mais un jeu qui vous challengera.

review:
Nice art atyle, fun game. The campaign is 3-5 hours long, depending on the difficulty and simply how fast you play. 
The only point I can complain about is the missing counter play in certain situations (fully leveled gang getting obliberated, can't be guarded except for putting tons of thugs around them - I'd like to tap them the same way I can trap buildings).
While I think the price tag of 15€ is a bit too high (at least if you don't plan to play it in multiplayer) I can fully recommend getting it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048707492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1590856183}
review: Honestly, it isn't a bad game, but I've beat the entire campaign in 4 hours, and don't really enjoy it enough to deal with playing online. If you like board game like strategy and don't mind having to deal with people online then it might be worth the price, but if, like me, you like to play your games alone - don't bother. The art style is cute, the music and sound fx are okay but repeat often. The game is heavily influenced the RNG of the map. If the campaign were a little more developed it could be a 6 or 7 - but I just can't recommend a game this short that then relies on multiplayer or just random matches against the AI.

review: ผมไม่ขอแนะนำเกมนี้เพราะมันไม่สนุก เกมนี้เป็นเกมแนวturn-base ที่ไช้เวลาเล่นนานมากนานจนต้องนอนรอหรือรอเป็นชั่วโมง(มั้ง)กว่าจะจบ และที่เหันมันขื้นเล่นออนลายนี่มันก็ออนลายแหละแต่ลองคิดดูเกมนี้เป็นเกมที่ไม่คอยจะมีคนเล่นบวกกับเกมแนวturn-base ที่ไซ้เวลาเล่นนานมาก แน่นอนไม่สนุก เล่นเกม free to play หยังจะดีสะกว่า. ผมพูดมาขณาดนี้แล้วพวคุณก็คงจะเหันว่าเกมนี้มันแย่แค่ไหน แค่ถ้าไครที่คิดว่าจะเอาไว้เล่นกับเพื่อนกับน้องในหน้าจอเดียวกันก็แนะนำให้ชื้อเกมอื่นนะ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111290703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1591440975}
review:
Antihero is a fun and quite simple strategy game, that gives you more than just one way to win.
It doesn't take long to understand the way to success and is easy adjustable for you level of difficulty.
All in all it is a good game for in between and for the smaller challenges, regarding strategy games.
If on sale, totally worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198176881799', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 421, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1589636265}
review:
画风很有意思的对战类桌游。游戏的中文设置在进去之后的左上角。

画风独特鲜明，线条硬朗，有浓郁的漫画风。整体画质比较可爱，人物立绘生动。游戏拥有相当多的动画，招募小孩，刺杀敌人，角色死亡画面，都有相应的动作表现。小品游戏，也是很用心的。BGM空灵动感，充满节奏感。

游戏玩法有点类似于棋盘策略对战游戏。游戏节奏为回合制，每回合进行自己的行动，通过占领，拦截，刺杀，雇佣，贿赂等多种手段来达成自己的盗贼工会目标。游戏上手简单，通过对三种资源的决策，需要一定的思考和判断。游戏有多重建筑，教堂，交易所，收藏馆，占领之后都有不同的效果。游戏达成胜利的方法很多，玩家可以自由地决定自己的玩法方向，比较有策略性。

游戏的核心应该是联机对战玩法。但是目前只支持双人对战，趣味性和深度有一定的限制。可能是游戏小众的原因，匹配对手是需要一定时间的。游戏联机的话，基本对挂机没有惩罚，所以经常会出现对手莫名其妙就挂机的情况。


【优点】
1、鬼灵精怪，线条硬朗的漫画风
2、手段独特，很有创意的盗贼棋盘玩法

【缺点】
1、故事线流程短。
2、联机功能不太方便

author: {'steamid': '76561198136250191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1594110239}
review:
[h1]棋盘上的义贼———《Antihero》[/h1]
[h1]————————————[/h1]

[h1]义贼：劫富济贫[/h1]
很多人小时候看过了各种侠义、英雄的影视作品，都会有这样一个梦想：将来也能当个行走在黑夜中的人，专门劫富济贫、行侠仗义。尽管随着年龄逐渐变大，发现现实并不能让我们原模原样的去还原这个梦想，但惩恶扬善的初心永远不会改变。

《Antihero》就是这样一款关于义贼的游戏，故事发生在维多利亚时期的伦敦，玩家将扮演“义贼公会”中的成员，去各个地区完成一系列的任务，利用黄金雇佣各种伙伴，与敌对势力盗贼作斗争。

[h1]画风：古灵精怪[/h1]
一进游戏，就能看到《Antihero》那荒诞、夸张的卡通美术风格，和《饥荒》类似，地图场景整体暗色调为主，既是对应了故事设定的夜晚时间点，又体现了玩家逐步探索地区解锁更多可视区域的感觉。二头身的“大头娃娃”人物造型可爱有趣，老少咸宜，诸如专门搞刺杀的黑帮和杀手，长着最萌的外表却干着最凶狠的事。

[h1]桌游：步步为营[/h1]
《Antihero》的玩法，表面上看上去像是回合制的战棋游戏，但实际上更像是双人甚至多人的策略桌游（比传统战棋更多的养成发展玩法）。

玩家总共有着行动点，金币，油灯三种资源。行动点每局自动恢复，消耗行动点可以进行探索（未探索的道路和建筑都有着迷雾遮挡，需要玩家先探索，道路上还会显示对手的足迹，细心观察可以推测对手的轨迹）或者行窃，习得匕首后主角也可以进行刺杀；金币可以通过行窃或者资源点占领获取，雇佣帮手都需要消耗金币，需要有可持续发展观；油灯便是科技点，同样可以通过资源点占领和行窃获取，主要用来解锁不同的能力和伙伴。

《Antihero》的主角和对手没有血量的概念，想要获取游戏胜利就要优先收集胜利点。获取胜利点的方法很多，击杀头目（每次头目会逐渐变强），占领交易所（占领失败也会使已经获得的胜利点再次丢失），盗取指定物品（先到先得，但往往要较高科技），数种获胜手法要根据局势选择，及时调整战术。

[h1]策略：千层博弈[/h1]
《Antihero》的策略，主要围绕了利用伙伴对地图建筑（资源点）的占领。

每个地区都有数种多种建筑，可以产生金币的银行，可以提供油灯（科技点）的教堂，既能提供油灯又能提供胜利点的交易所，藏着珠宝名画的收藏馆等等，不同建筑功能不同，合理的抢占不同的资源点是游戏胜利的关键。

伙伴顽童是个基本单位，本身没有什么战斗力，但是占领建筑全靠它。匪帮则是专门的打手，既可以消灭其他单位，又可以驱逐建筑里的顽童。猛汉可以充当拦路虎封住敌人行动，也可以加入匪帮强化其血量。可恶的高级军官专门用来一口气摧毁被敌人顽童占领的建筑，昂贵的姐妹花杀手则能一次性造成巨额伤害……

一个小小的城市，每个夜晚都是千层博弈。

[h1]————————————[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198103120112', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1589612284}
review:
[h1]《Antihero》——电子化桌游就该这样[/h1]

故事背景在维多利亚时代的混乱的底层街区，玩家控制各自的盗贼行会，
在不超过12*12格子的小镇中进行争夺，通过盗贼大师每回合的行动分配，
招募各种能力的下属，争夺资源点，
压制对手，根据每关不同的任务目标（暗杀、贿赂、勒索），
先于对手公会完成任务，获得胜利。

剧情流程并不长，3小时左右，
作为新手教程设计，循序渐进，逐渐增加新的人物和目标，
难度曲线相当合理，可以一步步熟悉游戏内容。
整体玩法和内容并不复杂，流程也相对比较快，
5回合之前探索、升级科技，5-10回合的争夺资源，20-30回合的胜利资源争夺。

 关于《Antihero》如何分类我一直存在疑惑，你可以说它是一部轻量级的策略战棋游戏；
但是玩法的许多部分：数据设计、资源分配、工人放置等等，都有着明显的桌游的影子。
尽管体量有限，但是却在小格局中玩出了精巧，成为了一款优秀的电子化桌游。

电子化桌游和传统桌游相比，
最为显著的优势是布置方便在于流程、结算的方便和音画表现更出色；
而这两点《Antihero》非常讨巧；
手绘的画风，卡通的维多利亚街区相当可爱，音效音乐中规中矩，和游戏契合程度尚可，基本及格。因为游戏数字系统设计相对简单，结算也直观明了，也更容易让玩家容易理解（这点比口头讲最后还自己算错的实体桌游不知道方便多少）。特别值得一提的是提供线上联机，毕竟玩桌游的都知道时间和场地的困难，每场线下活动都要有几个鸽友不是？
目前来看，《Antihero》作为电子化桌游产品来看，中等重量的玩法成熟，表现力出色，新手引导合理，提供线上联机对抗，无疑是成功的；但是玩过桌游的人都知道，最贵的部分不是盒子多贵，场地多难找，而是一起玩的陪伴者们；《Antihero》目前线上玩家并不多，和电脑对抗难度又相对有限，单机部分的深度不足以留住玩家，如果作为游戏产品来看，短板明显。推荐给喜欢对抗类桌游，并且自带稳定小伙伴的玩家们尝试。

review: As a nerd that owns over 200 or so strategy board games, I'm really digging "Antihero".  It really does capture the feel of a good strategy board game and the campaigns all have unique win conditions.  I haven't played it verses another player, but the solo campaign is a ton of fun.  If this were a traditional board game, I would definitely add it to my collection.  As a video game, it definitely deserves a place in my game library.  If you are a tabletop board game enthusiast or just like planning out your strategies multiple turns ahead then this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071850049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1589746956}
review: This is a fun, simple strategy game with lots of style. It could be a tabletop game. Interaction is strictly turn-based. Early in playing, it felt like a lot of random good and bad luck. But after I understood the rules better, strategies to defend against and limit the AI's opportunities became clear. You can play through the game in maybe 8 hours on "easy", and after that replay value could come from higher difficulty levels, skirmishes, DLC. I understand there's an online mode, which might be great, but I haven't tried it yet. Voice acting and artwork really give the game an enjoyable feel.
developer_response:
Hey Erik, thanks for posting a review! 

The bug that won't let you create an account: I haven't heard reports of this. 

If you're still interested in playing online (that's where the action is!), do you mind emailing me at tim@antihero-game.com and I can help you sort it out?

Thanks!
Tim

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198166957222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1589045131}
review:
Al principio vas a probar una estrategia funcional, te enamorarás de ese estilo, intentaras reproducirlo hasta el final... pero ouch! el juego te plantea enemigos que jugaran de una manera totalmente nueva, destruyendo por completo tu confianza, hay que volver a reeplantearse el juego de nuevo ( rayos, al parecer rushear agresivamente la banda rival ahora no funciona, tendré que aprender a jugar más diplomático y estratega ) y esto te va a suceder a lo largo de toda la campaña, lo cual muestra un equilibrio y una inteligencia muy bien hecha a la hora de crear todo el sistema de juego. 

Hablamos de una campaña desafiante, que si bien es un tutorial... una bienvenida a lo que es el juego realmente, vas a disfrutar mucho ese viaje, y es que... ( luego de leer otras reseñas ) me di cuenta que todos llegamos al mismo punto, la campaña es muy entretenida y enviciante!

Pero no todo es alegría y felicidad, actualmente en la fecha debo advertirles que el online está bastante abandonado, si tu meta es encontrar un juego el cual ser competitivo estarás hasta 15 minutos buscando match para jugar... pero HEY! también el juego te da alternativas como el juego local ( juega en la misma PC de forma local contra un amigo, hermano, etc ) y luego un modo que no experimente de un online pausado en el que cada turno se juega a la hora que uno quiera...

Me encantó el juego! y hasta me da por fantasear que en algún momento nos sorprendan con contenido nuevo, como nuevas unidades o mapas, 8/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970354467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1587843128}
review: Im Sale allemal ein Kauf wert.  Spielkonzept macht soweit Spass und ist recht einfach gehalten.  Erreiche schneller als dein Gegner die Siegespunkte, welche je nach Map aus Meuchelmordaufträgen, Kirchenbesetzung, Maskenballbesuchen, Gegner verletzen, Schiff besetzen oder mehreren der genannten Möglichkeit erhalten werden können.  Leider fehlt es dem Grundspiel ein wenig an Vielfalt, daher könnte es auch ein normales Tabletop-Spielkonzept sein .  Das Spiel macht zwar sicher Spass gegen Freunde, allerdings könnten die Maps da auch ein wenig grösser sein. Ist kein must have aber kurzzeitig hat es mich unterhalten und um mal ein wenig Beef zwischen Zockerfreunden abzubauen ist es allemal geeignet :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080961817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3968, 'last_played': 1589478829}
review:
[h3]Первые впечатления от игры:[/h3]
- хорошая рисовка
- дуэльная настолка в которой надо знать, что делать, чтобы выиграть. Типо шахмат на бандитскую (воровскую) тематику
- сюжетная компания (призванная обучить игре, в основном, чтобы потом пойти в онлайн)
- по скольку в игре онлайн не высокий (дальше поймете почему), в игре есть асинхронный режим (ходите по очереди, на почту сообщение приходит, что настал ваш ход). Вполне годный режим.
- множество карт, на которых свои условия для набора победных очков
- разные направления прокачки навыков

Однако, наиграв 80+ часов, я окончательно убедился в том, что в это играть незачем.
[h3]Карты[/h3] 
Есть такие карты, как "Верфь" и "Большой город", где тот, кто ходит первым выигрывает. Я выиграл у топ 1 игрока, у которого около 2500+- побед в асинхронном режиме, просто потому что я ХОДИЛ первый. Эти две карты сделаны таким образом, что тот, кто ходит первый, берет со старта бандита, убивает нпс на проходе, и на след ходу насилует базу оппонента и GG. 
Нельзя забанить карты, нельзя выбрать на каких вы хотите играть, а на каких нет, все рандомно.
[h3]Здания и рандом[/h3] 
Здания на карте распределяются рандомно. К примеру, назовем это районами (N зданий в кучке). Посещая любое здание, вы узнаете что в этом районе есть за ДОМ для захвата "работниками".
Во-первых, ДОМ может заспавниться в максимально неудобном для вас месте (и максимально удобном для оппонента). 
Во-вторых, вы можете обыскать первое здание района и сразу же найти ДОМ для захвата, таким образом сэкономите драгоценный ход вором, которые очень ограничены. 
В-третьих, не все ДОМа равноценны, если у оппонета со старта есть БАНК, и он его максимально быстро захватывает, то уменьшает ваши шансы на победу, примерно до 0,00001%. Аналогично, если у него есть под базой второй Торговый ДОМ (который приносит фонари, которые нужны для прокачки навыков).
В-четвертых, банк присутствует на карте в количестве одна штука, и он обычно находится не где-то посередине, а прямо на базе у одного из игроков. 
В-пятых, при обыске здания происходит одно из двух событий: либо вы находите 2 монеты либо 1 фонарь. Это определяется тоже рандомом. Тебе очень нужны монеты? Держи +1 фонарь. Тебе нужны фонари? Держи +2 монеты. Что мешало сделать так: за обыск обычного здания - монеты, за первый заход в ДОМ (обнаружение для захвата) +1 фонарь?
[h3]Прокачка навыков[/h3]
На первый взгляд казалось, что в игре имеют место несколько тактик, в зависимости от ваших предпочтений в прокачке. На деле же, все качают навыки +- одинаково. Нет взаимоисключающих веток, например, либо вы выбираете повышенный урон вором, либо две банды, нет. Вы можете прокачать вообще все. От чего геймплей сводится просто к захваты ресурсов и войне на подавление, когда соперник просядет по ресурсам и вы выиграете. Соответственно, если кому-то больше повезло с зданиями, у того больше преимущество.

[h3]Онлайн[/h3]
Он как бы есть, но он небольшой. Чтобы поиграть с кем-то в онлайне надо подождать какое-то время (по разному), пока появится желающий. А поскольку людей играет не так и много, вы можете натыкаться на одних и тех же старожилов, которые вас изобьют как младенца, а уж если у них есть Банк со старта, то GG WP.

В игре присутствуют достижения по типу, выиграть 100/300 матчей по сети. Ну и на кой хрен делать такие достижения? Они мотивируют играть в эту рандомную помойку? Вот уж вряд ли. У игры слишком много положительных отзывов, при этом в нее почти никто не играет. Я напомню, что игра позиционирует себя как онлайн, а не одиночная, ибо сюжетка проходится довольно быстро. А в обычных схватках боты не блещут интеллектом. 

Можно играть хоть 10 асинхронных матчей сразу, НО вряд ли вы запомните, что там происходит в каждом матче, поэтому это не эффективно для победы. Лучше всего играть в живую, но т.к. людей почти нет, то будете натыкаться на старожилов, против которых шансов мало. А поскольку в игре нет реплеев, то посмотреть как ходил твой оппонент в открытую нельзя, чтобы чему-то научиться у него. 

[h3]Баги???[/h3]
А еще я заметил странный баг с отображением передвижения вора оппонента. Когда вор оппонента ходит, на земле остается красный след, по нему вы можете судить до куда он добрался и что он мог открыть. Однако, этот след багует. Мне не отображает, что оппонент дошел до башни, при этом он в нее засунул ловушку (станящую). Каким образом? Если он до туда не дошел, сквозь туман телепортировал? 
Так же бываю странные перемещения после стана и атак, должно откидывает на ближайшую свободную клетку, а телепортирует хрен знает куда.

[h3]Итог[/h3]
Если бы игра позиционировала себя как тактические шахматы, то может онлайн и был бы выше. Но сюда зачем-то напихали блядского рандома, чем собственно и похоронили игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259781414', 'num_games_owned': 2587, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1585525864}
review: Eu sou particularmente grande fã de jogos de estratégia em turnos, especialmente os parecidos com tabuleiros estilo "tabletop" .... esse jogo não é exatamente isso uma vez que cada cenário é feito muito bem pensado e detalhado para cada missão da campanha. As regras são imensamente claras e praticamente não há espaço para sorte e sim para o planejamento (existe sim uma pequena, mas bem pequena parte de sorte que se trata da posição onde o prédio principal de um quarteirão vai estar, fazendo com que você dê a sorte de chegar nele em um turno ou demore três, e isso pode fazer muita diferença no jogo) mas fora isso o resto é estratégia pura. .... e não é fácil .... eu estou acostumado com esse tipo de jogo .... não sou o melhor jogador do mundo, mas creia, cada missão eu precisei fazer umas tres a quatro vezes (fora as primeiras claro) --- isso pois você precisa saber onde as construções podem estar, analisar a estratégia do inimigo, e apenas após muita reflexão conseguir criar aquela estratégia perfeita .... Para quem quer algo casual esse não é o seu jogo (nem no nível mais fácil) mas para quem gosta de desafios e de um jogo imersivo .... é uma pedida excelente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055352678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1605101085}
review:
Super fun strategy game with limited replay value.

The story is short, but the aesthetic is fantastic. Polished art and concise flavor text sets a great tone without asking much of the player. Levels are challenging, but not often frustrating, and there are a variety of ways to build your thieves guild. I only wish the campaign ran longer! Maybe a sequel or expansion will offer some more content at some point.

It's a short and sweet ride that's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077398527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1708698374}
review:
Excellent game, real little gem. Easy to learn, simple rules, but the result is quite complex strategic interaction. The challenge level is enough to keep your absorbed – but without undue stress. Elegant graphics, very functional interface – the game doesn't waste your time. Very atmospheric. In short, fun to play. 
The team of game developers seem to have great potential – I am looking forward either to further enhancement of "Antihero" (obviously bigger maps; longer research tree; opponents with new strategies) or new games of their manufacture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099376429', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1578936606}
review:
这是一款是非好玩的小游戏，讲述了小偷与盗贼间的较量~~类似大富翁风格。

优点：
只要缺点你能接受，就放心入手吧，不会后悔的~~

缺点：
1、故事线太短，关卡数量也很少，整体游玩时间在几小时内即可通关。
2、只能跟电脑打，你想在线上匹配到真人，是不可能的~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198433508792', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1577721223}
review:
这是一篇很啰嗦的游戏测评，简单来说核心玩法很有吸引力，游戏内容还不是很丰富但是联机部分弥补了这点不足，推荐策略游戏玩家、战棋玩家入手。下面的内容比较长，希望能帮助没有玩过的玩家了解游戏内容

[b] 玩法新颖的轻量级策略游戏 [/b]
       在资源有限的情况下，率先获得足够的胜利点即可获胜，一个胜利点至少有三种获取方式，获胜条件的多样化给游戏带来了不少乐趣
       游戏分为活动(剧情关卡兼教学关卡)、在线(线上对战)、冲突(自选场景，可以人机对战或者本地多人)三种模式，其中冲突模式类似于其他游戏中的开房间，可以自定义规则。很有趣的一点是不同的场景会增加获胜条件，但也很可惜，这游戏目前的场景比较少
       每局游戏的资源量是固定的，但是资源位置随机分配，同一种棋子可以有多种用法(比如暴徒可以加入匪帮也可以守卫街道)，棋子的功能设定也很有趣:驱逐其他棋子、设置陷阱、刺杀等等，游戏玩法新颖
       由于棋盘比较小、资源有限、技能树较简单，一局游戏大概耗时20-40分钟

[b] 画风独特，细节生动 [/b]
       最先吸引我的是这款游戏的画风，进入游戏后慢慢发现手绘风的游戏在细节上的表现力并不逊色于高画质游戏。暴徒加入匪帮后，匪帮老大身后会多一个人；没有探索过的建筑会比其他建筑暗一些；棋子死亡时还会捂胸一脸惊讶……诸如此类的细节数不胜数

[b] 游戏性十足但游戏内容尚有欠缺 [/b]      
       游戏中有多个可供选择的人物，但是不同的人物并没有特殊技能或者特殊的棋子，虽然这样不影响游戏平衡性，但是也减少了一些游戏乐趣
       游戏的单人部分内容比较少。联机部分我匹配到的几个对手都挂机了，对手挂机了也依然每回合要等他几分钟，希望开发商能增加个“三回合没有操作默认为弃权”的功能，或者为暂时不在电脑前的玩家提供AI代打的功能。在冲突模式中可以进行本地多人对战，不过由于这个游戏敌我双方的视野不共享，如果两个人共用一台电脑进行游戏，大概需要玩家一行动时玩家二闭眼，玩家二行动时玩家一闭眼，可能分屏或者远程同乐的体验要好一些
       另外一点就是除去联机部分的游戏内容太少了，虽然游戏性价比很高，但是这么好玩的游戏真的不考虑再更新一些剧情关卡或者游戏场景吗

review: 玩法非常新颖的桌游，将角色扮演、地图探索、科技树、圈地等元素融合在了一起。胜利手段的多样化使得玩家的选择更加自由。学习成本较低，容易上手，对抗高难度的AI也非常具有挑战性，当然更适合邀请朋友一起玩耍。近日已更新官中。

review: Alright game: didn't knock my socks off, but got m e hooked. Cool premise (Victorian gang competition) and different strategies are needed for different opponents. Only took a few game sessions to beat (on normal difficulty), but a bit of fun if you can get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044653396', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1574937000}
review:
I have beaten the Campaign.
7.5/10

Not worth the full price but under $5 usd and it's a fair deal.

I like the unique style of game play.
It reminds me of a board game but with 'flash' graphics.
Each time you replay, the game feels slightly different, adding replayability (somewhat).
I was fairly entertained for about 10 hours and then my interest started declining.
I can see myself coming back to this game on rare occasions when I get bored and want to jump in and waste some time.
Each time I play a round it takes about 15-30 minutes.
The sound effects are as expected, graphics are fair.

*This review just states the basics of my impression of the game. Read other reviews if you want to know more about the actual game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153241333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1568501994}
review:
[b] 6/10: Good [/b]

A fun game, but not exceptional. I like the concept, and the art style and animations are well done, but it’s not a game that would keep me coming back too long even if I was one to play games like this online. In terms of the single-player campaign, it’s pretty good. It effectively increases your knowledge of how to play the game, however it really is just an introduction to the game so you can get started with online play. Be aware of that before buying. However, there is nothing massively engaging or gripping with the game, for me at least. It’s fun for a while, but I have no desire to download it again

author: {'steamid': '76561198984535422', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1570233420}
review:
5 контрактов на убийство из 5!!!
Великолепно! Браво!В эту игру должен поиграть каждый.
Я большой фанат необычных инди игр, и знаете эта та самая игра которая не имеет срока годности, это огромная редкость приобрел я игру не в стиме а ключиком по скидке , но считаю что она заслуживает свою полную стоимость.
 В средне партия длится 40-50 минут, разнообразия  в игре не так много но это не коем разе не делает ее плохой, просто тут нету нечего лишнего. Два вора, один город и 6 неписей которые мы покупаем за монеты, каждые выполняют свою роль в этой небольшой стратегии. Тактика проста - подомни под себя ресурсные точки а далее ,ты или забиваешь 5 контрактов на убийство или сливаешься на взятки главное в начале получить экономическое превосходство и не щадить "головорезов" противника они могут вам подпортить всю стратегию. 

PS. Я вижу что последнее обновление было 24 сентября 2018 ,  как я понимаю разработчик решил нечего в ней не менять и я с ним согласен ,надеюсь что будет вторая часть с большими возможностями и количеством персонажей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015798245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1572441577}
review: Most fun two player with a friend. Its not a bad game although I might pick it up on sale rather than for twelve quid.

review:
Great board strategy game!
The best thing about this game is "casual" multiplayer  mode, it allows you to play multiple matches at your own pace.
Charming artwork and  simple mechanics  makes this game enjoyable  and , on the other hand, very challenging in multiplayer.
