review: A very cute game with a very cute story and the multiplayer mode is actually really refreshing. Basically you take a turn and leave. Your friend takes a turn and leaves. It can go on for months. Amazing. I really love the art style as well! 100% worth the price! =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984211717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1569435049}
review:
ก็เหมือนดังเช่นที่ผมมักจะเอ่ยให้กับคุณได้อ่านอยู่บ่อยครั้ง  ตัวผมเองนั้นออกจะชอบอังกฤษในยุควิกตอเรียเป็นพิเศษและรู้สึกหลงใหลในวรรณกรรมที่ถูกเขียนขึ้นในช่วงยุคนั้นเป็นอย่างมาก  ดังนั้นฉากหลังของเมืองซึ่งถูกฉาบไล้ด้วยแสงของตะเกียงแก๊สใน Antihero จึงออกจะสะดุดตาผมเป็นอย่างมากและนั่นก็คือเหตุผลที่ทำให้ผมตัดสินใจที่จะลองซื้อมันมาลองแต่แรก (ในขณะที่กำลังลดราคา)

“Antihero” เป็นเกมที่ให้อารมณ์คล้ายกันกับเกมกระดานอยู่ไม่น้อย  ซึ่งคุณจะได้รับบทเป็นหัวหน้าแก๊งค์หัวขโมยที่จะต้องคอยควบคุมสมาชิกของกลุ่ม (อันประกอบไปด้วยพวกเด็กเร่ร่อน มือระเบิด นักเลง ไล่ไปจนถึงมือสังหาร) เพื่อที่จะรับมือกับศัตรูจากต่างแก๊งค์ (หรือก็คือผู้เล่นอีกฝ่าย) เพื่อที่จะยึดครองเมือง (หรือก็คือกระดาน) ด้วยการกระทำภารกิจต่าง ๆ ให้สำเร็จ (ตัวอย่างของภารกิจก็เช่น สังหารเป้าหมาย ค้นหาความลับ หรือขโมยของล้ำค่า)

จุดเด่นที่ผมชอบที่สุดของเกมก็คงจะเป็นงานออกแบบที่แม้จะเป็นตัวการ์ตูนแต่ก็เข้ากันกับเนื้อหาและฉากหลังแบบวิกตอเรียนเอามาก ๆ  และถ้าคุณชอบวรรณกรรมจากยุคนั้นอย่าง Oliver Twist, Sherlock Holmes และ Alice ฯลฯ  ตัวเกมก็จะมี Skins เป็น DLCs ให้คุณซื้อมาใช้ได้ด้วย (แต่ผมต้องขอเตือน  มันเป็นเพียง Skins และไม่มีผลใด ๆ กับการเล่น)

ตัวเกมนั้นเข้าใจและเข้าถึงได้ไม่ยาก  ขอเพียงแค่คุณมีทักษะด้านภาษาพอประมาณและลองเล่น Story Mode ของเกมแบบผ่าน ๆ  คุณก็พร้อมที่จะออกปล้นและยึดเมืองมาเป็นของคุณแล้ว  แต่ถึงแม้เกมจะเข้าใจได้ไม่ยาก  กระนั้นมันก็เป็นเกมที่เน้นการวางแผนค่อนข้างมาก  เพราะในแต่ละกระดานจะมีเงื่อนไขในการชนะที่แตกต่างกันและอาคารส่วนใหญ่ก็มักที่จะถูกสุ่มใหม่ในทุกครั้งเมื่อเริ่มเกม (ผังเมืองเหมือนเดิมแต่ชนิดของอาคารที่คุณพบจะเปลี่ยนไป)  คุณจึงไม่อาจที่จะใช้แผนเดิม ๆ เพื่อเอาชนะและจำเป็นที่จะต้องคอยปรับแผนตามสถานการณ์และศัตรูที่พบอยู่เสมอ

ส่วนตัวผมเองออกจะชอบรูปแบบการเล่นของเกมอยู่มากพอสมควร  แต่น่าเสียดายที่ตัวละครซึ่งคุณสามารถจะเลือกใช้นั้นเป็นเพียงแค่ Skins และไม่มีผลใด ๆ ต่อการเล่น  มองในแง่หนึ่งมันก็ออกจะแฟร์เพราะทำให้ผู้เล่นต้องวัดกันด้วยฝีมือการวางแผนแบบเน้น ๆ  แต่เมื่อเล่นไปหลายกระดาน  คุณก็อาจจะรู้สึกว่าตัวเกมนั้นออกจะซ้ำซากและอาจจะทำให้คุณรู้สึกเบื่อได้  นับเป็นเรื่องน่าเสียดาย  เพราะถ้าตัวละครมีความสามารถที่ต่างกัน  มันก็น่าจะสร้างอรรถรสในการเล่นได้มาก

ปัญหาอีกจุดของเกมก็คือตัวเกมไม่มีรางวัลใด ๆ ตอบแทนเมื่อคุณเล่นชนะ  นอกจาก Skins ของตัวละครที่ได้มาจาก Story Mode แล้ว  ตัวเกมก็แทบจะไม่มีอะไรเลยให้ได้ปลดล็อก  ตัวเกมจึงไม่มีแรงจูงใจให้คุณเล่นต่อมากนัก  กระนั้น Multiplayer ของเกมก็นับได้ว่าสนุกและมีฐานผู้เล่นอยู่มากพอใช้  คุณไม่จำเป็นที่จะต้องรอห้องนานสักเท่าไหร่ (ตัวเกมมีแบบ Live Mode และ Casual Mode ซึ่งโหมดแรกก็คือ MP แบบปกติ  ส่วน Casual Mode ทั้งสองฝ่ายสามารถที่จะเดินหมากทิ้งไว้และ Offline ไปได้  ตัวเกมจะแจ้งเตือนให้คุณรู้ทุกครั้งเมื่อเข้าเกมว่าอีกฝ่ายได้เล่น Turn ของตนหรือยัง)

ตัวเกมออกจะมีจุดตำหนิให้ได้พบอยู่ไม่น้อยและออกจะน่าผิดหวังถ้าคุณจะต้องจ่ายราคาเต็ม  กระนั้นถ้าตัวเกมกำลังลดราคา  “Antihero” ก็นับได้ตัวเลือกที่ดีสำหรับผู้ที่ชอบเกมกระดานและกำลังมองหาเกมที่เล่นง่ายและสนุกเพื่อฆ่าเวลา

author: {'steamid': '76561198047315462', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1565837442}
review: Bom jogo para jogar singleplayer. Se estiver numa promoção vale a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185330410', 'num_games_owned': 1640, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1520591278}
review:
Das Spiel ist herzallerliebst und erfüllt alle Kriterien.
Man kann stehlen, sammeln, skillen, Fallen aufstellen und natürlich morden!
Ich mag den Charme, die die Grafik ausstrahlt und das man selbst der Antihero ist.

Es ist ein teilweise knackiges Strategie-Spiel (rundenbasiert). Die Kampagne bietet genügend Abwechslung und ein Repertoire an unterhaltsamen Charakteren. Online kann man sich dann gegen richtige Spieler beweisen und an seiner Spielweise feilen.

Die meisten Errungenschaften gibt es auf dem Weg durch die Story, Online gibt es dann die Letzten....Kann man machen, muss man aber nicht. xD

Leider gibt es keine Sammelkarten! Hier wünsche ich mir echt mal ein paar Marktgegenstände!!!

Fazit: Ein rundherum gelungenes "Brettspiel"!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064276828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1688309314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1556339077}
review:
I would agree with other reviewers who say this game is fun but extremely poorly balanced.

Playing through the campaign, there was almost no challenge until there was suddenly too much of a challenge. In addition, whether you do well is too much randomly determined by what resources are nearby your starting position.

Could have been a good game with further refinement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971785163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1637273978}
review:
Valido gioco da tavolo. L'atmosfera è gran parte del divertimento.

In competitiva è parecchio lento, inoltre le strategie non sono bilanciate e si è creato un meta. Pertanto consigliato per giocatori casual su multiplayer locale.

Multiplayer tramite internet ovviamente defunto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032420046', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1552255818}
review:
Pretty good little turned based game similar to "gangsters" from 100 years ago only with working mechanics.

It is a little bit annoying that some story-driven missions the CPU have an unfair advantage; they can turn up at your doorstep by turn 2 when it would take you around 5 turns to do the same to them.

I just signed up to play online but I can't find a game; I imagine the player base is very low; so if you have a friend it may be better to play with them rather then against randoms.  It has a good skirmish mode where you can vs CPU; it's a good pick up and play mode to kill 20 minutes or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076093453', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1509973485}
review:
I wish there was a yeah, kinda, maybe response.

I found this game addicting, funny. Really enjoyable.
The art style is good, unfortunately its difficulty is a bad one for me.
It's really hard. Like, on NORMAL play, its STILL really hard.
I had trouble beating a few levels, and then I got to the point where I'd have to do it over and over and oveeer.
You get it.

It sucks because I enjoyed it, but I haven't been able to really play it freely since.
It's kinda stressful. If you like games like that, totally go for it! Its a good game, not broken at all.
Just...difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076328268', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1547, 'last_played': 1549229169}
review:
Dość prosta w zasadach gra planszowa, której niewątpliwą zaletą jest brak rzutów kostką, więc z mocno ograniczoną losowością (co na ogół trochę jednak upośledza tego typu gry).

Gramy tu złodziejaszkiem na planszy z kwartałami kamienic, Poprzedzielane są one ulicami po których się poruszamy. Te kwartały mają swoje główne budynki (umieszczane wśród paru innych) dające określone korzyści co turę, pod warunkiem że je obsadzimy łobuzami. 
Narzędziem do zdobywania przewagi jest zbieranie golda i lamp. Za to pierwsze kupujemy sobie jednostki (typu łobuzy, gangi itp.), a to drugie służy głównie do wykupywania elementów drzewka. To drzewko jest elementem strategii - odblokowuje nam jakieś cechy/buffy czy konkretne jednostki o których mowa jest wyżej. 
Celem gry jest, jak to często w planszówkach, zdobycie określonej liczby punktów zwycięstwa szybciej niż nasz rywal. Punkty zwycięstwa można zdobywać na 3 podstawowe sposoby (zabicie jakiejś określonej persony, wykupienie łapówki za lampy i obsadzenie kościoła trzema łobuzami) i do tego na kilku różnych planszach dochodzą jeszcze inne obiekty które mogą dawać te punkty (nie wiem czy aby na niektórych z nich nie ma warunku zdobywania wyłącznie punktów na bazie jakiegoś specjalnego obiektu, w singlowej kampanii na pewno tak jest).
Ogólnie fajna rzecz, aczkolwiek singiel jest dość szybki do przejścia, ale multi może potencjalnie dać co najmniej kilkadziesiąt godzin rozrywki. 

Strona audio-wizualna jest w porządku. Grafika może wygląda skromnie, ale jest estetyczna w rysunkowym stylu (jak widać na screenach). Interfejs jest prawie bez zastrzeżeń, aczkolwiek czasami rzut izometryczny może odrobinę przeszkadzać przy klikaniu na odpowiednią jednostkę na planszy (gdy jest ich kilka koło siebie). Poza tym żadnych crashy, gra pracuje stabilnie. Technicznie jest zatem wszystko ok.

Co jest wadą? 
Niestety, ale słaba frekwencja w multi (początek 2019r.). Wieczorem można kogoś złapać (zwłaszcza w łykendy), ale może to być skillowy gracz, który wykorzysta każdy nasz błąd (więc wygrać jest bardzo trudno). Dopiero przy trzecim pojedynku udało mi się trafić na kogoś mniej doświadczonego, czyli odpowiadającego moim umiejętnościom. Próbą ratowania tego trybu jest opcja swobodnej gry (oczywiście obok typowego online), która pozwala grać „na mejla”, co polega chyba na tym, że mamy nieograniczony czas na wykonanie tury, a gdy ją wykonamy przychodzi do rywala wiadomość, że teraz jego kolej. Gdy on wykona ruch, wtedy my otrzymujemy stosowną informację i tak w kółko. Gra z racji braku limitu czasu może więc trwać… kilka, kilkanaście dni (jeśliby tylko wykonywać jeden ruch na dzień). Jeżeli da się w ten sposób symultanicznie grać w dziesięć partyjek jednocześnie to może ma to sens, ale jeśli naraz tylko w jedną, to nie bardzo, ponieważ w tej grze raczej nie trzeba się dłużej zastanawiać (i wykonywać ruchy) niż 1-2 minuty, może czasem w trudniejszej sytuacji 3-4. Logowanie się zatem do gry tylko po to by wykonać przez minutę, dwie jakieś posunięcie wydaje mi się mało atrakcyjne. Piszę o tym trybie przypuszczająco, bo go osobiście nie testowałem, ale raczej nie mylę się w jego opisie (już się z tym spotykałem w innych turówkach). 
Ten tryb zapewne jest powodem dla którego chcąc zagrać w multi trzeba się zarejestrować (tj. podać swój adres mejlowy). Jest to mała niedogodność, ale że nie wymaga to żadnego potwierdzania (więc niby można podać fejkowy adres), stąd nie należy tego traktować jako wadę.

Plusik należy się za spolszczenie, choć gra ma niewiele treści, ale zawsze to ciut szybciej można się wgryźć w zasady rozgrywki (jakaś prościutka fabułka też jest).

Podsumowując, bardzo dobra komputerowa planszówka (w realu niemożliwa do wykonania ze względu na „mgłę wojny”), która jest ofiarą klęski urodzaju na współczesnym rynku gier i przez to ma niewielką frekwencję (może jak dadzą do jakiegoś bundla to się przez chwilę poprawi). Czasy takie, że ludzie wolą bardziej efekciarskie wizualnie tytuły, z trochę większą złożonością, nawet jeśli kosztem gorszego balansu i znacznie większej losowości (piję do Talizmana czy Armello).

author: {'steamid': '76561197988257417', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1543808332}
review:
Cute little game, plagued with a horrible difficulty curve.

Pros: Cute art, nice tabletop feel to it, some rudimentary tactics but the whole has a relaxing vibe
Cons : Levels jump from being wayyyy too easy, to wayyyy to difficult, never striking a good balance. The campaign is way too short, might explain the sudden difficulty curve. And this is clearly one of those games that relies on multiplayer for replayability, but of which the community dies super quickly and you find nobody to play with. 

My experience with the game was that all levels were WAY easy. Easy in the sens the AI doesn't seem to know what it is doing most of the times and acts randomly, like wasting gold to post thugs at random spots instead of reinforcing their gang. 

That was until the point i got into a mission where i start from scratch, while the AI starts with 4 gangs, unlocked techs (being able to steal art on turn 1-2 for massive gold and snowballed economy), and multiple urchins on buildings maxing multiple research buildings after only a 3-4 turns. The issue is that it's not a smart AI, just a cheating AI by a wide overkill through gaining a lot of ressources that just breaks the balance between players in an extreme way... at that moment any strategy went out the window and I had zero motivation to continue. I am sure there is a way to win and I could spend the time to figure it out, I just don't see what would motivate me to do so with so many more interesting games out there. 

Glad I grabbed this on a big sale, I recommend you either skip it or get it at a big discount.

To be fair, if you're the kind of person who only buys one game at a time and play it to completion, this might work for you for a little bit while there are still people doing multiplayer. But if you are like many of today's players with a huge collection of games waiting for you, because you buy multiples on sale and always have a long to-play list of games competing for your attention, then this is the kind of game that you'll only play for a few hours then uninstall. This is because the game is barely OK, while many others are meatier and have a lot more stimulation / fun to offer for your time.

review: Decent little board game. Not too complicated, but not too easy either. Several maps with different quirks for variety. Fun London street gang theme. Single player campaign is a little short and easy, but the game really shines in multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988483267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 6116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2999, 'last_played': 1541991705}
review: The art style in this game is very charming, and the gameplay is engaging and interesting. Running your thieves guild requires careful consideration, as your actions each turn are limited. It is very rewarding to improve your playstyle as you figure out what works and what does not, and the levels have enough variety that it never gets boring. Beware, however, as the hard mode will often throw (literally) impossible levels at you. You can look for online guides but mostly they are the typically useless "git gud" responses, and you will find yourself repeatedly restarting levels until the RNG builds the map in your favor enough to overcome the AI's unfair advantages. However, the other difficulties are well balanced and the game is otherwise a treat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078741545', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1643663824}
review:
Really enjoyable game. Played on easy level. At first really challenging..but when you start to know the basics rather too easy. A lot depends of luck as well. If you are lucky you get the right shops beside you. If not your enemy will. I had one game in which I lost in two to three turns which is a bit ridiculous.
Fun game to play... really enjoyed it but after a while you get the basics and nothing really new happens.
The replayability is also really low. I did not play the multiplayer mode.
All in all it sounds I am very negative about it but in contrary I really recommend it but only if you can buy it for example on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148873174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1637721566}
review:
I have completed the campaign and I've just finished my first live match. So, I think I can review this game as it deserves to be. Antihero was a great game at its very beginning. However, its multiplayer was a disaster, because not too many people were able to play at the same time at any hour of the day. Nevertheless, I've just discovered a few days ago that they solved this problem by adding the turn-wait match or casual match and they even send you emails to let you know that is your turn. This is truly a smart move to keep the multiplayer alive. Although the campaign is short with a good story, its multiplayer can really make this game more enjoyable than it was.

If you don't want to read my review, here's a score for you (I don't know if these scores will be fair, so do not trust them at all):

Story: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Multiplayer: 8.5/10
Graphics: 10/10
Characters: 10/10


Many languages to pick: YES
Fanbase: not too many people
Replayable: YES
Multiplayer discord server: YES

author: {'steamid': '76561198090084538', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1540822863}
review:
Antihero is an okay turn based board-type game that I can only recommend to hardcore fans of turn based strategy who will use multiplayer. I reluctantly cannot recommend it to the average PC gamer due to the limited engaging replayability and certain gameplay deficiencies.
Here is what you need to know:
+Art and music are very well done.
?Skirmish mode provides many custom options, but those custom options are not so different that I'm motivated to play it much.
+All levels in any mode are procedurally generated within the confines of whatever "scenario" is picked. Scenario dictates the broad shape of the map, an additional unique way to get victory points, and/or the tendencies of the AI (attacks your gangs ASAP, recruits thugs often, etc).
+Gameplay is interesting, different, and balanced, but ...
-I have completed all but the last campaign mission in just ~8 hours on the normal difficulty. Whether in a bundle or at historic low price, this game is not a great value unless you are hardcore and play multiplayer.
-The gap between AI Normal and Hard difficulty is huge. I only managed to beat one scenario on Hard, and gave up Hard on after failing and retrying a few other scenarios.
-If a building or character obstructs a tile behind it, there is no way to "hide" the obstructing thing so you can see the tile contents. This is very important if you want to see where the enemy has scouted and thus where they can move to.
-If you recruit a thug and do nothing with them, there is no warning that they disappear and are wasted if you do not make them join a gang or guard a spot. When ending each turn, you are warned if any characters have an unused action, but in this case there is an undocumented consequence for doing this with the thug.
-The game resolution could've been better. For my GTX680, windowed mode only allowed for up to 1024x768, implying that the full screen res may have been limited to that as well.
+DLCs appear to be cosmetic only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010905211', 'num_games_owned': 2164, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 35783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9399, 'last_played': 1581643398}
review: Changed how I view digital board games as a genre. Deeper than one would think. I can only think of one map in multiplayer that can make the game feel unbalaced if one is able to kill the oponents gang. Charm thru and thru. Bravo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035576780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1524274242}
review:
It's rather simple and reminds me of a board game, but with a few random elements to keep it from being too heady like chess. 

If you are the type to enjoy cutthroat multiplayer, this game is pretty fun. I enjoyed both live multiplayer and the option to play your turns whenever you get around to it (like Words with Friends).

The campaign is fun, and not too long. I would pay for a DLC with more single-player content. 

Love the art. I wish the game let you skip some of the sitting around you have to do between turns. Between that, and the fact that it's really short and simple, that's really all there is for me to complain about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012311486', 'num_games_owned': 2782, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1567608644}
review:
「悪党が不当な手段で私腹を肥やすってなら、俺たちもちょっとぐらい分け前を頂いたっていいじゃねぇか。」～『笛響けば』(1978年・日本)

ガス灯瞬くヴィクトリア朝時代。都市は繁栄し、貴族が高笑いする発展の時代。
しかし人々は苦しんでいた。寒さに、飢えに、貧困に。
そんな中、老若男女の食い詰め者は盗賊ギルドに集った。今日の飯を食むために。
だいたい『オリバー・ツイスト』。

金とランタンを盗み、ギルドをデカくしてライバルを殴るデジタルボードゲーム。
運の要素は小さく、戦略が占める割合が大きい感じ。
計画的かつ臨機応変に対応しよう。
ルールはシングルキャンペーンの最初の面をプレイすればだいたい把握できます。全11面のステージをすべてクリアしたらマルチの猛者とも殴り合える実力がつくはず。

マルチプレイは1ゲーム30分くらいで終わります。
フレンドを言葉巧みに誘って、ボコボコにしたりされたりしよう。
スキンは特殊効果とかないので注意だ。

ボードゲームとかが好きなひとにオススメ。
プレイに支障がないレベルで日本語に対応しているから外国語が分からなくても大丈夫。
安心して盗みに入ったり盗まれたりしよう。買い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198129145082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1538916061}
review:
스토리모드에서 게임을 시작할 때마다 새로운 룰이 추가/변경되어 하나씩 배우면서 진행하는데요. 스토리가 끝날 때 쯤에 적응해 사람들하고 룰을 바꿔가며 해보게끔 되어있는 것 같네요. 저는 스토리모드만 했는데도 재밌게 플레이했어요. 영어를 잘 모르더라도 (내용이 적어서 해석할게 별로 없음) 어느정도 눈치로 플레이가 가능하며, 귀여운 캐릭터와 사운드를 보고 들을 수 있습니다.
보드게임 좋아한다면 추천.
사람들과 대전하면서 논다면 원가에 사도 아깝지 않을 것 같아요, 스토리(캠페인)만 보고 끝낼거라면 짧게 느껴질 수 있기 때문에 꼭 할인할 때 구매하세요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013764121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1538770280}
review:
Great atmospere, straightforward yet interesting mechanics, and a basic design that holds great promise with even just a few add-ons or alterations.

To start, I feel I should express how much I would truly love to love this game.
If/when this Tim Conkling fellow plans to continue building upon the intriguing premise that is this current gaming experience, I shal do just that.

I've found that while games designed specifically with the computer in mind tend to skew a bit more (and more) towards the "graphics/action over all else" mentality, board game designers have been forced by the constraints of their inescapably more tangible genre to hold to a greater emphasis on creativity,  siplicity, and perhaps even a touch of depth.
Conveniently enough, taking a board game style design to a computer format is far easier than the opposite, and it makes the end result much lighter to carry. Opens up closet space too...

Were I to enumerate one major downside to this game, it would be the strictly 1-on-1 gameplay.
It would certainly seem like simply* having more sides at play would do quite a bit to ameliorate the other significant issues that I've seen raised by several other reviewers (impact of sheer luck involved, "snowballing", relatively singular gameplay trajectory, etc...). Nothing quite evens things up like two losers teaming up against the loser who's winning.

*While conceptually simple, I realize this may be somewhat less simple in execution...

Please Mister Conkling, may I have anuva bowl??? I'm so terribly hungry, really I am...

author: {'steamid': '76561198825010795', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1603880809}
review:
Entertaining multi-platform board game!

Antihero is one of those games that you'll keep playing with your friends for weeks. You can play online from your phone , tablet or your computer and probably other platforms too. It's a turn-based board game so you don't need to be online all the time!

+ Basic but really important tech-tree
+ You need diffrent strategies against different game types, rules and players (= long playing time)
+ Differents ways to earn victory points
+ Simple but also really tactical
+ Great soundtrack and sounds (You'll love that British accent!)
+ Great graphics

- Campain is a bit short, would be better if it was longer

There's nothing else to say about this awesome game. All you need is to get it and start challenging your friends

author: {'steamid': '76561198074295871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1643370308}
review: Отличная игра. Удивлен что раньше не слышал  о ней ! Игра жуть как не дооцененная. За свои деньги , игра дает все и даже больше. author: {'steamid': '76561198095349885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1538228319}
review:
This is actually a neat little board game; definitely worth it in a sale!

There is a campaign, sandbox and online multiplier available to play. There aren't any horrendously unbalanced mechanics, at least that I've discovered. There are several ways to win a game, and as a consequence several ways to lose one too. The asthetics of it are pleasing too; in reality the "skin" of the game could have been from any theme or time you can think of, but the darker streets of Victorian England are quite fitting. Surprising amounts of strategy are involved too, which does invariably ensure no two playthroughs will ever quite mimic each other.

It's like someone looked at chess and thought, "This is ok, but it could be better if it were interesting and fun" and then they made Antihero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962046803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1538016541}
review: At 5 hours I don't see myself playing more. Much of the campaign is psudo-tutorial and there is not enough depth or variety in strategy. The game itself revolves around snowballing and does not have much "theif-y" feel to the mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998917970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6023, 'last_played': 1691276945}
review:
I have over 100 hours played on Antihero so I feel like I am qualified to make a reasonably accurate reveiw on it. That being said I have never written a reveiw on Steam before so bare with me :)

I am seeing a lot of reveiws already that appear to have pretty much explained what Antihero is, but I have not seen to many go into depth on the Multiplayer which is the only real reason to come back to Antihero. 

Therefore I am giving this a Negative reveiw honestly not becuase it particularly deserves a negative reveiw but becuase on the overall or "All Reveiws" it says very positive, which in my opnion is a misnomer, its a decent game, that I enjoy, however it only ever takes me a few games to remember what I hate about Antihero. The Luck. Although skill absolutley plays a part in Antihero it is not nearly as important as luck. Luck is 60% of your wins hands down if not more. 90% of every game hinges on luck, will you randomly get coins when you need coins and lanterns when you need lanterns... who knows? Will the opponent get all the buildings he needs right next to him... who knows? Will the thugs spawn and box you in or save your opponent... who knows? 

Now some people may say that can happen to ethier player with just as much chance so its not really unfair. Sure this is true, but why would you want to play a game that hinges so much on luck one way or the other. I can't even fathom how annoying it must be if you were going to play this in any tournament, becuase while sure the top 10-20 most skilled people would probably end up at the top, after that its almost for sure down to the luck of the map, and thats just not interesting, or competitive. 

Im at the point, top 20-30ish of the leader boards, where it has become clear 90% of the time when I face someone at my level, it is not about whos the better strategist, its about who has the most useful buildings, and who got the better start luck wise with lanterns and gold. Its dumb. I don't know how specifically the developer could fix this but I am writing this reveiw for any people who enjoy playing a chess game esque video game. This is a fun game, I have lost 100 hours in it, I am not saying don't buy it.. I am saying understand that after you play this for while and become good at it, you won't really be testing your skills versus someone, youll be testing how lucky you are with RNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1538141676}
review:
I picked this game up on sale for a little less than $6, so keep that in mind in terms of my recommendation. Right now I'd say its worth $10, but I still need to try out local multiplayer hotseat, and I also doubt I'll be someone using the online multiplayer, so that's the perspective I'm coming from.

EDIT: This game only supports two player versus multiplayer. Thought that was worth noting.

The singleplayer campaign quickly gets you up to speed on the mechanics of the game, and in less than an hour you will have a solid sense of the game mechanics. Some little things may pop up, or at least did for me, that throw you for a loop, but I feel that's part of any game to a degree, and particularly happens in board games. So far it strikes me as a classic "easy to learn, harder to master" situation. 

The game stops holding your hand toward victory (in the single player campaign) as of part way through the second level, but really starts to throw you into the deep end in the third level of the campaign, where all the potential features seem to unlock. I found that pacing to be just right. I lost my first time playing the third level, and had to change strategies. Something nice I noticed is that when you retry a level, many features are randomized, making it feel like a bit less of a drag to retry a level, as it stays fresh. It also has different difficulty settings, and on normal the computer is a light challenge sometimes, but hardly unbeatable. 

I'm giving it a thumbs up, but I'll try to update my review once I've tried out the hotseat multiplayer and progressed further in the campaign.

For those who want to hear a bit more about the mechanics, I'll do my best to sum it up briefly.

You play as a master thief of your own little thieves' guild, and you are trying to pilfer, burglarize, bully, extort and even out right murder your way to victory. 

There are effectively three 'currencies' - coins, lanterns and victory points. 

You earn coins by completing burglaries with your thief, infiltrating coin-generating organizations and businesses with street urchins, by killing certain characters or through end of turn 'charity,' taken instead of getting an upgrade. You can use coins on your turn to recruit more (sometimes to a limit) of the characters you've unlocked (you'll be replacing some often, as they may get evicted or murdered) through upgrades purchased with lanterns. 

You earn lanterns by infiltrating certain buildings, burglarizing certain venues, or as an alternative to coins through that same end of turn 'charity.' You use lanterns to purchase upgrades (you may not receive charity if you get an upgrade) or to buy 'bribes,' one source of victory points.

Victory points come in three varieties: bribes (bought with lanterns, as above, instead of getting an upgrade or charity), assasination contracts (incrementally stronger characters will spawn, one at a time, on the map, with large health pools - last hit gets the credit, so one must be careful when 'wittling away' !), or blackmail (earned by placing enough urchins in churches to 'upgrade' that building). 

So you want to make choices on how to use your coins and lanterns, and which units to focus on. Will you go primarily for upgrades to your master thief, to make them as effective as possible? Or will you focus on gangs and thugs, the attackers and defenders acting on behalf of your guild? Or perhaps you'll go for super units, like the Truant Officer (who can evict whole groups of urchins in one go) or the Assasin (one use characters that are expensive but lethal)? The only other unit I haven't mentioned is the saboteur, a bomb toting fellow that hides in buildings that your urchins infiltrate, and explode would be evicters, leaving them stunned and vulnerable and foiling their attack. So all in all, its a relatively small cast of characters, but together with your thief and the assorted upgrades, the options are varied and replayability is relatively high. 

Its a clever little game, and I'm quite happy with it for the price tag I've dropped. I'll likely continue through the campaign, as its already started to get a little challenging. Hopefully this review will give you some sense of what you might be signing up for, since as of buying it there were no listed user reviews for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010490081', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1538330456}
review:
I dont think its nessary a bad game, or a waste of the $5 sale price i spent. But in know way can i see it being worth $15.

Iv logged 3 hours and Im burnt out. At first its alot of fun, but then you realize the same forumal is used over and over. With just new paint on what a victory point is (Not even new paint on the same buildings used over and over.) . The A.I. isnt good engough to make you play defensively in these Scenarios, so it dosnt change how you play at all. While there capable of the standered 3 ways to obtain points, youll be locked into only one speacial way, that requires looting a certain bulding or infiltrating one. looting and infiltrating is what you normal do, not much changed. These victory condions just become a hassale all the way to making the game too easy. The only other thing the game does to change it up is give the A.I. a clear starting advantage. This tends to be more annoying than anything, put once the playing feild is leveled its just like any other match.

I was just to tired of the game already to play multiplayer. Theres no variation in anything, even the art gets old after staring at the same exact models over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121898484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1589047562}
review:
Refleja muy bien las mecánicas de un juego de mesa de tipo "eurogame", donde tienes que planificar tus acciones con tus ladroncillos sin quitarle ojo a tu rival. 

Es un juego por turnos donde vas adquiriendo más habilidades aumentando los tipos de acciones que tienes, y donde el vencedor es aquel que consiga antes los puntos de victoria que pide la misión. 

El modo campaña es muy útil para aprender las mecánicas del juego, y además adictivo.

Si eres jugón (de los que se sientan a la mesa), merece la pena ampliar tu colección con él desde luego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977484071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1534021120}
review:
It's a pleasant enough diversion.  I haven't explored every nook and cranny, but I completed the campaign and have skirmished a bit against the AI.  The AI is far too easy to beat, even on hard.  I'm also not particularly interested in playing this online vs. other humans.  As such, the game doesn't have much longevity for me.

I still recommend it as a board-game like experience that's easy to learn and play.  A game takes around 15-20 min, and sometimes you need a game like that in your library. Don't pay more than $5-$10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033270694', 'num_games_owned': 1112, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1530136446}
review: Fun, but the campaing in hard difficulty lasts 5 hours at most. After that you've already devised the winning strategy for any fair game and it's more a matter of randomly having the upper hand (ie being the one who discovers the other gang in his turn) than anything else. After that, there's very little you can do to stop the snowballing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985934380', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1533227045}
review:
A great game, with great art style and simple mechanics.

Single player is a bit short and not particularly interesting. Which, at the point of writing this review is where I spent most of my time getting all SP achivments.
The key is in the online mode, where you face another person.
Which, for 1v1 there are a few different maps with different game winning mechanics, is ok.
But it is enjoyable to play aganst someone when you are of similar skill and attitude. Though, might be a bit rare.

It's a bit of a niéce game that many might not enjoy.
And a little more polish and actuall content would be nice, since the game does feel a little lackluster for it's asknig price, aswell as the DLC that only affects your main charachter.

Here is a list of things that would have made this game a must own:
Skins that affect ALL your charachters:
Currently, only skins for the main charachter exists. This is especialy hurtful on the DLC which, is artisticaly nice, but limited in it's content.
More maps with more players:
Having maps with more players would make for some RIDICULOUS moments. A couple of 3 player Free For All maps, some 4 player FFA and 2v2 maps, would help this game a LOT!

So, that sounds like a lot of negativity, right?
Well... in it's most basic components, it is a solid and fun game, with a feeling that some extra content would make the game feel more fullfiling, and some more maps for more players to make it much more diversive.

Extreamly hard to put this on either recommended, or not recommended.
But, I think I will end up putting it as "Recommended", as long as you can overlook the flaws that it has.

Now, if they keep a fairly similar price point, and have more skins for your gang, and more maps - that game would be a 10/10 must buy. So I am looking forward to the idea of an improved sequel! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994438091', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2618, 'last_played': 1709671119}
review:
Awesome!

This is the best thing since sliced bread! And I don't even LIKE digital borad games. I tried it out after watching a TotalBiscuit episode (may he play in gaming heaven) and I got hooked instantly. I just finished my hard campaign run and I wonder why the multiplayer queue is literally empty.
Is is simple enough to pick up quickly, yet complex enough to make a variety of strategies viable. If you like board games like Catan, Carcassonne or Monopoly (digitally or otherwise) you should love the sh!t out of this.

I just purchased the phone version of the game just to support the studio. I sincerely hope there is more of this coming our way.

One note of caution though, since Multiplayer is pretty much dead/empty, it is going to be hard for most players to milk more than 20 or 30 hours of enjoyment out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052284021', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 3349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1649060386}
review: I found Antihero really caught me off guard. I honestly wasn't expecting much when I started it, but it immediately grabbed my attention and held it until I completed it. It also has a multiplayer, which if it is anything like the single player, should be buckets of fun. It has that addictive element that games relied on back before intense graphics and/or epic writing no longer made it essential for a game's survival. A definite must try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017487615', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1577741827}
review:
If you liked Gangs of New York and always wanted to cut people like Bill the Butcher, in the decadent streets of a Victorian wild scenary, this is the game for you! :D

Antihero is a great PC boardgame with interesting level designs and a cross-platform multiplayer, so you can butch your friends from the living room or the bedroom. Better appreciated on crazy solo skirmish or in the wild parties you hold with your drunk friends! Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972089994', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1579395444}
review:
This is a great turn based game that deserves more exposure. If you want to play strategy games with other people (which is the only way to actually play a strategy game -- AI simply isn't good enough yet), you can either go for an RTS game or a game like Antihero. But most RTS games will force you to focus on speed and clicking rather than strategy and decision-making. And as for turn-based games such as Civ and other 4Xs, they're too long and isolated to play with other people, and their AI isn't there to challenge you as much as to provide you with a story.

Antihero fits very well into the niche of relatively quick strategy-based games. As you play, many interesting choices come up. Calling this game 'casual' is a misnomer -- this is the only way to have real, challenging strategy ie. against another player. The game *can* drag a bit, which is why I recommend playing asynchronously rather than live -- unless both players are experts, turns can take longer than is advisable for this kind of multiplayer game.

Graphics-wise, Antihero won't blow you away, but the graphics look professional and stylistic. Music and voicework is decent, and the theme of Victorian England is both consistent and enjoyable.

In terms of the mechanics, the game employs some interesting ideas that I haven't seen before. You scout out the city with your thief, displacing bits of the fog of war. As you do so, you need to infiltrate businesses with your urchins to get resources. You can also set traps for your opponent and block pathways in the city. Most interestingly, unlike most computer games, characters aren't limited to a certain number of tiles. Instead, they can move as far as they want within the area you have scoped out with your thief and so long as they don't bump into enemies.

I place this game firmly within the 'Real Strategy with Low APM' sub-genre, which I think is crucially important for video games. Pick this game up and play with a friend for maximum enjoyment.

EDIT: After playing a bunch of Antihero games online (on mobile), I've found out that this game is even deeper than it seems at first. It's a really intricate strategy game, with a lot of ways to mess with your opponent, and very subtle strategies that take time to learn. Async is the best way to play this game IMO - you can have 10 or more games going on at once - but a live game will let you focus on the nuances your opponent communicates even more. This game is a treasure and if you're at all into strategy, you *need* to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241944142', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1529842864}
review:
Ein strategisches Spiel wofür man doch einiges an Köpfchen braucht um es zu meistern        
( außer man spielt auf Leicht -.-)
Ich persönlich hatte die Story in 4 Stunden auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad Normal durchgespielt ohne dabei ein einziges mal zu verlieren :D

Jedoch besitzt das spiel auch einen Mehrspieler Modus und erlaubt es auch eine schnelle partie auf einer ausgewählten map gegen die KI zu spielen. 

Auch wenn das spiel an sich simple wirkt, gibt es verschiedene Herangehensweisen wie man ein Duel für sich entscheiden kann.

Jedoch gibt es eine negative Sache zu berichten und zwar dass das Spiel nicht unbedingt für Langzeit gedacht ist sondern eher etwas für zwischendurch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004409202', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1575323402}
review:
If you like the decision-making of Civilization or other randomly generated turn-based strategy games but would prefer matches that don't take hours, then Antihero is right up your alley.

The balancing act of scouting, acquiring researching/tech, and developing military is all present. Antihero also features a campaign which functions as a great tutorial. The campaign starts off holding your hand for a turn or two to establish a game mechanic, then lets you play on your own to experiment with various victory conditions. Within 2 or 3 levels the game no longer dictates your opening moves for you and begins testing your ability to deal with certain strategy archetypes, such as a scout heavy archetype. Games will very likely end within 20 turns making matches long enough for compelling strategy and decision making, while also quick enough to make you want to jump into another match.

Also, the art style has a lot of charm to it. The music and little soundbytes from the characters and units help to complement the Victorian-era theme.

Plainly, it's a lovely game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036808281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1676595578}

author: {'steamid': '76561198373167609', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1582820356}
review:
This game likes chess (but unfortunately the chess is not my thing), in which with time one can always generate his own fixed/rigid strategies. The local game content is pretty small, which could be past in several hours. However, the awkward thing is there are not enough active users for opening a online match... a really bad experience.

It's not a bad game, but it does NOT match its high price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171812350', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1573896975}
review:
Antihero照著字面翻就是反派英雄，這是一款雙方在一座城市裡面，使盡各種骯髒的手段去取得勝利，比如：派小弟去佔領地盤、寄黑函、暗殺目標、偷珠寶或藝術品等。

遊戲類型：回合制桌遊，每回合可以做的事情和拿的資源都是有限的，端看玩家如何在收集資源和攻擊對方間取得平衡。
遊戲時間：一局大約半小時

全破一輪大約6~8小時，但我全破後也就懶得再開來玩，建議真心喜歡美術風格+桌遊的人再買，另外，這款遊戲可以上大廳找人連線玩，配對成功後，雙方並不需要持續待在線上，它的方式是你有空就上線把你的回合玩完，系統會自動寄信給對手，提醒對手可以再有空時登入完成他的回合，雖然方便，步調卻也慢得令人覺得不可思議，或許有朋友可以本機多人一起玩會是比較好的選吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198171314658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1596449649}
review: A good game having alot of fun playing it. Provides a good challenge and difficulty curve. Multiplayer is always good as well apart from in casual mode if people refuse to take thier turn you cant win as the game does not make them forfeit after a certain period of time. Apart from that i have no complaints for an game that can be very quickly is stimulating and sets a challege.
developer_response: Hey, thanks for the kind words! Re: no auto-forfeit in casual mode -- there was a server bug that prevented this for a little while, but it's been fixed, so your slow opponents should now get the losses they deserve :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967685936', 'num_games_owned': 1981, 'num_reviews': 757, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1630247716}
review:
This is a brilliant game. It's not that easy to make something this small fun. 

Nice art style, cool concept.

However, once you figure out the 1 and only working strategy this becomes very easy. 

Balance is really messed up, last mission is easier than mission number 2 and 3...makes no sense...was this ever play tested? 

If you are not into multiplayer games there is enough content for 3-4 hours only, at this price its a bit meh.

Also paid lame DLC's - major no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009351603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1521616052}
review:
Great 40 hours played. Wouldn't replay it though.

This game does some nice things in that every level is different and by that I mean don't expect to have one strat that will work every level like you generally do with most of these games. When I finished it though, I felt well and truly done with it - possibly because my interest was tied to the storyline more than the game mechanics, so when the story ended there wasn't any reason to keep playing.  Good for what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204008557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1597286951}
review:
Buen juego de mesa con un buen toque de estrategia y diversas formas de adquirir puntos de victoria para ganar las partidas.

Veo muchos que se quejan por la poca rejugabilidad y que no hay mucha variedad. Yo lo veo diferente, muchos juegos de mesa son grandes clásicos que no necesitan constante evolución (para muestra basta el Ajedrez).

Es un juego que te mantiene pensando y divertido un buen rato, el arte fue lo que me atrajo pero las mecánicas me ganaron,

author: {'steamid': '76561198127423416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1523196042}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110650531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1522396743}
review:
A great game so far.  You really know when you make a mistake, and the single player campaign can be quite hard.  Each level requires a different strategy, but i'm sure there are multiple ways to win.  It definitely feels like a board game.  

Each opponent of yours deserves a smiting.  And then a smithing.    

Payed for the premium tier in a bundle for this but no regrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001614017', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1522278437}
review:
The game is pretty fun to play through, but the campaign is rather short. BUt the levels are randomly generated, so games against the AI can indeed stay fresh. 

And there's the online play. I'll be honest, I'm generally not a fan of any multiplayer stuff, so I avoided it. But that's probably the way to go to keep things fresh and interesting. 

I don't think I'd feel it was worth full price, but if you got it in a bundle or on a good sale, it's probably worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016988057', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1522281651}
review: This is a fun little puzzle game that may have more strategy than my limited playing time has presented.  In this game, you play as a master thief leading a guild of thieves on a small Victorian-era city map against a rival master thief/ guild of thieves. The game is a turn based race to collect the required objectives before your opponent using a variety of units each filling a special niche action.  There is a simple unlock system for each game to unlock more ways to influence the map and acquire resources/objectives.  The art style is cute the game is polished looking.  I'm not sure as the longevity of this game but I'd recommend it at a lower price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139226932', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1581058946}
review:

有没有哪个善良的小哥哥或者小姐姐解答下啊~

author: {'steamid': '76561198318426480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1574030538}
review:
As much as I love the game; the campaign isn't long enough i don't feel like I've got my money worth.
 I've played through the campaign, played multiplayer a few times and.. that's about it really.

If you're competitive like me and want this to be a "fun" competitive game to grind ladders or become good at, you're going to be VERY bored after the first two games.

The campaign is fun lasts about 4 hours, multiplayer is pretty lack-luster once you've played it again it's not a super in-depth game it just becomes the same thing over and over and no-body plays the multiplayer now, it's pretty dead.

I can only recommend you getting this game on sale, I think 4-5 hours of witty campaign gameplay would be worth like 50% off?

I mean if you look at everyones gameplay who's recommended it's between 2-5 hours, some with a few extra hours like me

Is 4 hours really worth £11.99? to you?

You'll love it that case.

TL;DR
Great concept, poor execution too streamlined and basic for repetitive play only about 4 hours of good content, not worth price get on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024795725', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1585489448}
review:
"Бандитские шахматы".

 Перед вами игра пошагового типа, где в необычных условиях сразятся за территорию две главы шаек разбойников, грабителей и убийц. К вашим услугам все бесчестные методы войны, от вышибал-охранников, до яда, грабежей, шантажей и наемных киллеров! 
 
 Для начала стоит подавить крик, нет не крик в духе: "да игре с таким графоном место максимум на телефоне или планшете! Как такое не на Андроид, а на Стим попало!?". А восклик восторга, после долгих и скучных партий в уже устаревшие игры подобного типа. Есть, конечно неприкосновенная классика, вроде первых или третьих "Героев (меча и магии)", но даже "верность может стереться в порошок, если ей слишком много пользоваться сверх меры". И так поиск приводит вас сюда. В игре есть как обучающе-сюжетный режим, который познакомит вас с основными тактиками и приемами ведения разборок. Так и полноценные онлайн-баталии. Да и не просто баталии, я ведь не зря в оглавлении упомянул шахматы. Интернет игра делится на "мгновенный бой", где вы и ваш соперник сойдетесь в режиме реального времени до полной победы или поражения. И на  "казуальную игру" позволющую начать несколько партий с другими игроками, но ходить пошагово, тогда, когда ход сделает ваш противник. Без строгих ограничений в возможностях. Потому заядлый игрок ведет пару партеек "в настоящем" и, как великий комбинатор, несколько "затянутых" партий с игрокам, которым так же удобнее играть в подходящее им время. 

 Конечно у игры есть свои минусы, как например русская локализация присутствует только со стороны и часто так тормозит или крашит происходящее, что волей-неволей, а проще играть на оригинале. Не говоря уж о том, что немилосердный рандом может забросить к более опытному игроку, котрый в несколько ходов "запрет" вас бугаями прямо на выходе с логова и тем даст жуткий минус по темпу игры. Или не могу не упомянуть о том, что новички часто сильно втапливаются в сюжет против ботов, а потом выходят с затуманенной головой в сетевой режим и начинают сдавать, ведь живые люди играют немного иначе. От того и жалобы и скулеж про скуку, среди играющих не первые 3 часа.

 Но да хватит вокруг да около - игра не так дорога, а шанс сыграть в приятную пошаговую стратегию выпадает не так часто, чтобы сильно жаловаться на локализацию или игроков. Просто не пожалейте времени глянуть летсплей или демку в сети, апосле присоединяйтесь к плотным рядам разбойников пост-викторианской эпохи!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060165922', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1612244212}
review:
Anyone who loves board games will enjoy this game. 

If you like a bit of strategy & thinking 3 turns ahead but want to do 30-minute games that dont go on forever, this game is perfect for that.

Great art and systems that are robust enough to be fun without being tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982658491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1520382418}
review:
It's good! 7/10 ign 

The gameplay reminds me a lot of Desktop Dungeons.

A little bit different than what I expected from the game description, but I wasn't paying much attention.
(I glossed over the bit that mentioned 'digital board game' and was expecting a more typical RPG experience)

Definitely a nice way to kill a half an hour at a sitting.
Unfortunately, I didn't feel very compelled to continue playing past the 5th level when it seemed like I'd seen everything the game had to offer, but maybe other people would enjoy it for its 'puzzle like' nature.

Worth picking up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1520605912}
review:
Very well done PC board game. Anti-hero looks good and it also has some depth for strategy management gameplay and style. Easy to learn hard to adapt. Problem is... this game is only for 1vs1 (they try to do FFA someday) meanwhile board games are mostly for party-ing and fun. So there is one reason that people will be relucant to buy that and encourage others for that.

Other than that I like it. Pretty fast to play as it is and with small story campaign I believe it is worth a try. Without a friend to play it might be hard though. You will need a discord to catch up with some community as I see.

review:
一款桌面对战小游戏，游戏性相当好，很有创意，回合制有些策略性。

玩了几个小时，单机关卡设计的不错，但联机就太坑了，玩了几把对方都不行动，退出之后上次的联机游戏还可以续玩，但没什么用，也不知道怎么取消对战，还不如设计成即时的，对方退出就自动取消的呢。

和Ai战斗遭遇战感觉不过瘾，能多几个敌人一起战斗吗？地图再大点！！


We need Chinese！

author: {'steamid': '76561198026037871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1518307407}
review:
I feel that the boardgame style is underrated and under represented, and antihero does a lot to fill the niche. It is visually tight and is balanced in terms of difficulty.

Still, I waqs able to beat the campaign in 4 hours of play and once you've done that the game doesn't have much replay value. I think the name could be better. It doesn't seem like the multiplayer has much activity. Dispite this it is worth the $15 asking price. If you like these kind of games then it's worth picking up in a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138213224', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1516926811}
review:
[h1]Antihero[/h1]
[i]Curadoria [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32110520/]Simetria League[/url][/b], as melhores experiências para você.[/i]

Antihero é uma daquelas gratas surpresas, tanto que fui em busca de sua versão para mobiles também. Este título chegou ao Steam de forma tímida, mas parece que muitas pessoas já caíram em sua graça - eu também - confesso que sua jogabilidade "tabuleiro" me agrada muito! tenho uma quedinha por jogos simples, mas que apresentam qualidade, como é o caso deste.

A história não é aprofundada, arrisco dizer que é bem convencional e lembra bastante os contos/filmes de Robin Hood - acredito ser a melhor comparação - já que você vai assumir o papel de um ladrão, mas que trabalha em benefício do povo por achar que a forma como são tratados é injusta. Como o jogo tem menus e legendas em português, fica fácil de acompanhar os desdobramentos do enredo conforme você avança na campanha, mesmo que isso passe longe de ser o foco.

O título não é complexo, é bem fácil de entender como funciona sua mecânica, é estilo tabuleiro "convencional", com limite de ações e trocas de turnos. As primeiras fases/cenários são como "tutoriais" para deixa-lo afiado com as possibilidades das funções, então você vai aprender como recrutar jovens para serem informantes, brutamontes para entrar na gangue, atacar, roubar e mais algumas funções básicas de cada turno, se não está acostumado com jogos neste estilo, não tem problema algum, Antihero é bem intuitivo e com toda à certeza, é uma bela maneira de começar sua experiência neste gênero.

Já enfatizei que o jogo é "básico" porém isso não atrapalha em nenhum momento seu gameplay, pelo contrário, por ser básico é que ele agrada bastante, o mesmo é visto em sua arte - visual - e sons, por mais simples que sejam, eles são valorizados e se encaixam perfeitamente na proposta minimalista vista in-game. 

O seu verdadeiro papel não é ser um grande ladrão, talvez você já tenha entendido, mas de qualquer forma é bom avisar, aqui o seu papel principal é ser um administrador, fazer essa parte de recrutamento, investigar, escolher alvos e tomar todas as decisões pela guild, por mais que tenha "seu" personagem, é muito importante cuidar de todos os demais e calcular as perdas e ganhos, já que também existem meios de elevar os níveis de algumas habilidades que vão facilitar sua vida.

Talvez à grande "sacada", talvez não, é a grande sacada de Antihero, seu modo online que abre possibilidades de jogar em tempo real, mas também por correio... Sim, por CORREIO! quem diria, um recurso que antigamente era bem usado em jogos de xadrez e aos poucos foi sendo esquecido, hoje é "revivido" por este game, mas claro que os mais jovens talvez não conheçam como isso funciona, mas é basicamente você fazer um movimento agora, seu adversário recebe uma notificação e quando ele entrar no jogo, ele pode fazer o movimento dele e lhe avisar, seguindo assim com o game.

Depois disso tudo, é claro que vou recomendar, aliás, recomendar MUITO Antihero para os amantes de jogos de tabuleiro e para aqueles que desejam ter sua primeira experiência com games desse estilo.

[h1]Destaques:[/h1]

- Ótimo visual;
- Jogabilidade simplificada;
- Multiplayer online;
- Português

[h1]Poderia ser melhor:[/h1]

- Prolongar à campanha;

[h1]Quer saber mais de outros jogos?[/h1]
Conheça nosso projeto.
[quote][b]+ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/SimetriaLeague]Simetria League[/url]
+ [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32110520/]Nossa curadoria[/url]
+ [url=http://www.simetrialeague.com]Nosso site[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198142103361', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1508780498}
review:
That's what it is, A really good digital board game that wouldn't really work if it was a real board game. The game is simple but mechanically deep, also it has enough map variation. And is extremely polished. The game is a 1v1 turn-based tactical game. you play as master thief and you control this group with 2 kind of recources, gold and research. You can buy mercenaries, urchins, etc and they all do different things. The map at first mostly isn't visible so you can't see what the other player is doing, there is this slow build up before the intense showdown for every game, kinda like what happen in most rts. But then when you kinda know where your enemy is and what they've been up to, the mind games starts to ramp up. There are a lot of way you can take to outwit your opponent and that's when the game really shines. 

Two minor problem i have, the campaign is a bit short, and the queue for online game is a bit too long (because there's no players) thankfully they have this other mode where you play your turn then you leave the game until the other player play their turn, and then you play your turn and so on. But it's obviously isn't as fun as the live mode. Plus it's in mobile now so i can see that being more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069439929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1517029743}
review:
[b] Ein überraschend gutes Brettspiel mit einzigartiger Spielmechanik. Es hat mich nach einiger Spielzeit sowie einem einfühlsamen Tutorial in seinen Bann gezogen und bis morgens in der Früh nicht mehr losgelassen. [/b]


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Antihero ist ein strategisches  rundenbasierendes Brettspiel mit innovativen Gameplay.

Ihr Spielt einen Meisterdieb, welcher eine Diebesgilde leitet, und diese weiter ausbauen muss, damit ihr schritchenweise zu den Siegpunkten im Spiel kommt. Wer eine gewisse Anzahl an Siegpunkten erreicht hat, derjenige gewinnt. Das ganze spielt auf einer Art Brettspiel Stadt und erinnert ein wenig an den Film Gangs of New York, zumal man auch seine Gilde, Gangs, Straßenkinder, Assassinen, und Saboteure aufbauen muss um das Spiel zu gewinnen.

Die Siegespunkte kriegt ihr indem ihr gewisse Aufträge bzw. Vorgaben erfüllt. So könnt ihr z.b. Mordaufträge erledigen, die Kirche Infiltrieren, Kunstmuseen oder Königshäuser überfallen

Das Spiel hat zudem ein 2 Ressourcen System was euch immer auf Trab hält mehr Ressourcen anzuschaffen, indem ihr Handelshäuser, Boote, Kirchen oder Banken infiltriert. Auch könnt ihr Geld verdienen indem ihr fleißig neutrale Charaktere mordet. Mit den verdienten Ressourcen könnt ihr Fähigkeiten in eurer Diebesgilde freischalten oder neue Gehilfen anheuern.

Wer als erster die vorgegebene Siegespunktzahl erreicht derjenige gewinnt. Hervorzuheben ist das wirklich fantastische Tutorial, und die nette Grafik. Da kommt hoher aber kein langer Spielspaß auf. Die Kampagne umfasst 11 Missionen und ist auf dem schwersten Schwierigkeitsgrad ca. 6 Stunden lang. Es gibt aber noch einen Geplänkel sowie einen Mutiplayer-Modus.


[h1]Pro:[/h1] [list]

[*] Innovatives beinah fesselndes Gameplay
[*] Sehr gutes Tutorial
[*] Der Multiplayer ist immer wieder ganz nett
[*] Splitscreenoption für den MP
[*] Bugfrei und keine Glitches
[*] Steamerrungenschaften
[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1] [list]

[*] Der Preis ist "ok" aber nicht gut. Es ist zwar ein gutes Spiel aber irgendwie kann ich 15 Euro nicht nachvollziehen, zumal es eher ein Spiel für zwischendurch ist und auch die Kampagne eher kurz gehalten wurde.
[/list]

[h1]Kontra:[/h1] [list]

[*] Es könnte mehr Karten im Geplänkel oder Multiplayer geben
[*] Kein Langzeitspielspaß. Es ist eher was für zwischendurch.
[*] Kein Wiederspielwert der Kampagne
[/list]


[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Antihero wir d mit Sicherheit nicht jedem gefallen aber wer ein taktisches rundenbasierendes Brettspiel mit innovativen Gameplay sucht, derjenige sollte hier definitiv einen Blick reinwerfen. Antihero ist eine volle Kaufempfehlung aber eher zu einem reduzierten Preis. 


Diese Bewertung wurde als Bewertung innerhalb des eigenen Genres geschrieben.


[b]Gesammtbewertung 6,8/10[/b]



[i]Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/8049466-German_Gamer_Community]Reviewprogramm[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030554225', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1515987450}
review:
As much as I like(d) the game, I don't feel like I got my money's worth from it.

It's a good game but lightweight in many aspects of the strategies employed and the PBM-system it uses does solve a lot of "I am just going to spam a whole load of matches and finish none of 'em", in many ways what you do with the game is boot it up and then close it more or less immediately because you do your turn and then you can't start another game so you got more than a few that you are waiting for.
(You can only start a new game if the last game you began, a player has taken a turn in it; meaning you get first turn, you can start another game. Your opponent starts and you have to just close the game and come back later.)

The game is decent without a shadow of a doubt and I do recommend it if you like the far slower PBM-system it uses but... for me; I kinda wished I would've played less of the game so I could have gotten a refund unfortunately. It's singleplayer campaign didn't really get me the way that other singleplayer campaigns with sideobjectives and extra difficulties that makes it that extra special to play because... unfortunately, I was able to guess where the plot would go at one point immediately and that made it really dull to continue once it was revealed.

Other than that, its a glorified tutorial unfortunately.
Not very interesting unfortunately and I don't think I got my money's worth in the roughly 5 hours I played the game for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108608676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1644909789}
review:
Absolutely brilliant game! Hooks you from the first moment. Wonderful art style, animation, characters, sound and dialogue. Really captures that Industrial era England feel. But ofcourse the best part is the game play. It's much like a board game, in that you have a board of so many tiles, there's a complicated economy system, combat and many different ways to achieve victory. It's challenging, fun, will just put a smile on your face. Two things i especially love about this game. 1)  the variety if decisions you have to make are huge and really make you think. It's not like there's one victory condition, there's many and each ahs a lot of ways to get there. And 2) every turn you're getting a big upgrade that will make this turn totally unlike the last. So you need to plan each new ability ahead of time and do them in a beneficial order. 12 hours in now and only stopped playing to sleep. Excellent work. Also the developer is very active in the forum and that's great to see. 

10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035659532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1517154477}
review:
I wish there was a maybe, or a conditional button for reviews. Since while this is a pretty good game, it has some pretty rough drawbacks as well.  So it's best to think caarefully if it is for you before buying, i will do my best to illustrate the major pros and cons below, but first I will summarize it a bit. This ia  a board game style worker placement game, and it's actually pretty simple, easy to learn and quick enough to play that it stays interesting.  It has a short campaign mode, (and i do mean SHORT, as in finishable in a couple hours and leaves you wondering where the rest is.) and a larger multiplayer mode, which is where the meaht of the game seems focused. I repeat the main focus of the game is on the multiplayer, not the single player campaign, so if you are looking for a single player game or something with much story, this is NOT what you are looking for. However if you know a friend who is into board games, worker placement, and creepy little kids that say OY all the time, this might be your game.

PROS-
Good if cutesy graphics
Fast games, easy to pick up and play
Interesting and somewhat fun if simeple gameplay 
Pretty well balanced multiplayer, 
Decent Sountrack

CONS-
Single player game is very short and somewhat unsatisfying. More levels would help massively.
Comp AI is pretty bad, Even on hard mode i was never in danger of losing a single battle against the AI. (often winning before they could get more then 1 or 2 victory points easily)
Very simple formula... more skill branches, or more options or buildings or random events would help keep things intereiting. 


To summarize, I reccommend this for what it is good at, a fun multiplayer game to play with a friend who also likes this kind of game. I can't really reccommend this right now for people just looking for a single player experience, it's not long, it's not challenging, and without someone to taunt or tease when they hit your sabotuer, it can get old quickly.  Hopefully this helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022966154', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 6963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4557, 'last_played': 1587648778}
review:
I've only scratched the surface on the gameplay but it's kinda like Armello with a Don't Starve skin and without the rpg elements, mindgames are real. 

I really enjoy it. Best game yet this year!

Update 13 hours in: It's still really fun!

2nd update: 29 hours in: My sleeping cycle is ruined. Nothing like the thrill of outsmarting a complete stranger to a nice tune.

Final thoughts: The game is a casual boardgame masterpiece. There is definetly depth there but there is very little you need to know to get started and that is amazing to me. Aestetics are on point I really like how the game looks, sounds, feels and plays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043385216', 'num_games_owned': 1690, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1516216980}
review:

Por menos de 15 euros me parece un juego muy aprovechable, y si esta de oferta aun mas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031988893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1538136487}
review:
Boardgame characterized by placement and accumulation of resources.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077015', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1515906668}
review:
The premise of this game is fine. It's a fairly effective short-term turn-based strategy game with a few good mechanics to make it function. But that's it. It has all the basic parts needed and not a single bit more.

There needs to be at least one more skill tree line / unit type to really give the game something above the most shallow level of mechanics. There also needs to be something that makes different games more varied than just map types. Unique units/upgrades/buffs/debuffs tied to different thief types would go a long way to improving the non-existent replayability (i had assumed there was some sort of bonus to the different thieves i was playing as through the campaign but, it's all the same). As is one game isnt really any different from the next, so it gets old quickly.

If this game was in alpha I could see it becoming good. As is, I can't recommend it unless it's on sale for 5 bucks and you've got 5 hours to kill.
