author: {'steamid': '76561198049018800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1513999233}
review:
[i]Antihero[/i] is a light worker placement game where you play the head of a thief guild set in a world echoing Oliver Twist.

I bought the game with fairly high expectations, having earlier played a demo of it.
It's a competent game, with good artwork, some gameplay variance, clearly explained mechanics, and a reasonable length.
However, the game is too simplistic and fails to offer anything novel.

I played through the campaign on Normal difficulty in a little under 6 hours.

Overall, I give it a slight thumbs up.  I paid 50% off ($7.50) and think I got my money's worth. Although at full price ($15.00), I would've probably given a thumbs down.

I have not played Online at all.


[h1]Gameplay overview[/h1]
Each stage your guild competes against another organization on a grid map of several city blocks.
The goal of most stages is to earn some number of points. Whichever team first earns that many points is the winner. 

There are two forms of currency: Coins and Lanterns.
Coins are used to hire henchman into your guild.  
Lanterns are used to expand your tech tree.

At the beginning of each stage, you begin with just yourself and can take 2 actions (which you can increase via the tech tree). As the master thief, your player character is responsible for clearing fog of war, robbing buildings, and killing enemies.

There are several kinds of henchmen you can hire, though each must be unlocked via the tech tree:
- Urchin: sent to control key buildings. Different buildings give different benefits depending on the number of Urchins. For example, a Bank gives 1 Gold for 1 Urchin and 3 Gold for 3 Urchins.
- Thug: Can block a space for 2 turns
- Gang: Can attack other units or evict enemy Urchins. Starts with 2 hearts, which you can increase by 1 for each Thug you add to it.
- Saboteur: Places a trap in one of the buildings you control that lasts for 2 turns. Any enemy character attempting to infiltrate the building will get stunned.
- Truant Officer: Can evict all Urchins at a single location.
- Assassin: one-time use. Does 6 damage

Points are earned several ways:
- Assassination Contracts:  Kill some character that spawns on the map. After each target, the next target has 1 more heart. 
- Blackmail:  Placing (and keeping) 3 Urchins in a Church
- Bribe: paying 5 lanterns, an amount that increases by 1 after each Bribe
- Other: Some stages have alternative ways to score points.


[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Good artwork.

+ Some variance across stages
Several of the stages have special rules or features, which keeps the game fresher.

+ Game explains mechanics well

+ Three difficulty levels (Easy, Normal, Hard)
I've only played Normal so far. Normal may be a little too easy? I only lost once throughout the campaign and that was when first starting out.

+ Appropriate campaign length
Any longer and the game would have started to really drag


[h1]Mixed[/h1]
* Gameplay is straightforward and offers a few different strategies, but is probably a little too simple.



[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Unremarkable story, setting, and characters
I'm happy there's a story. The setting successfully invokes an Oliver Twist-ian feel.
But, there's nothing new or interesting.
Characters are never really developed.

- Watching the enemy's turn takes too long. You can skip it entirely, but you then lose potentially important information about what the enemy had done.  I wish they had a speed-up option.

- Emma seems too young to fulfill her role. Or maybe the artwork just makes her look too young?

author: {'steamid': '76561198057931819', 'num_games_owned': 1095, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1561667907}
review:
シーフギルドの頭領になって勢力を伸ばすのが目標の内政型ボードゲーム
キャンペーンモードを３つ目くらいまで進めればだいたいは把握できるお手軽ルール

資源は２種類のみ　コインとランタン
コインはユニットを購入する、ランタンはスキルツリーの開放に使う
スキルツリーはユニットのアンロック、プレイヤーの探索能力強化、戦闘能力強化の3種類
リソースをどこに寄せるかで違ったプレイが楽しめそう

ゲーム終了条件　既定数(３から６)の勝利点を稼いだ人が勝利
ＭＡＰを探索して教会に3人働かせて１点　教会はＭＡＰに2か所ある
暗殺対象ＮＰＣを倒す1点　倒せば次の暗殺対象がわく
ランタンで直接勝利点を購入する　ＭＡＸ３点


ボードゲーム好きだけど運ゲー嫌いっていう層向け
現状キャンペーンは短くマルチは人がいないので身内みんなで買ってやる分にはおすすめできる
DLCはキャラクターのガワしか変わらないので注意

author: {'steamid': '76561198346041967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1521664998}
review:
ซื่อ Deluxe Edition จะได้ OST. แถมมาด้วย ไม่ต้องซื้อ DLC Soundtrack นะครับ เปลือง 5555
ส่วน DLC ตัวอื่นเปลี่ยนแค่อวตาร ชอบไรคิกคุก็ซื้อมาเล่นได้.

หลังจากได้เล่นครบ 10 ชั่วโมง สรุปว่า เกมนี้เป็นเกมวางแผนเชิงกลยุทธ์ คล้ายๆเกมกระดาน ผลัดกันเล่นเป็นเทิร์น ขึ้นอยู่กับ action point ของหัวหน้าโจร (มีหน้าที่Scoutอย่างเดียวกับตีได้ครั้งนึง) + เงิน + คบไฟ ใช้ได้เท่าไหร่ก็ได้จนกว่าเงินหรือคบไฟจะหมดในเทิร์นนั้น ดังนั้นจุดสำคัญจึงขึ้นอยู่กับแหล่งเงินกับแหล่งเพิ่มคบไฟที่เป็น passive ที่เราต้องสร้างโดยการเอา Urchin (เด็กงาน) ไปใส่ในสถานที่ต่างๆ  

โบสถ์ (Urchin+1 = ตัง1เหรียญ/เทิร์น Urchin+3 = Blackmail 1 ฉบับ)
ธนาคาร มี 1 ที่ในแมพ (Urchin+1 = ตัง1เหรียญ/เทิร์น Urchin+3 = ตัง3เหรียญ/เทิร์น)
โรงรับจำนำ ((Urchin+1 = คบไฟ1อัน/เทิร์น Urchin+3 = คบไฟ2อัน/เทิร์น)

ดังนั้นวิธีการชนะที่ง่ายที่สุด คือ ตัดวงจรเงินกับคบไฟ ที่เป็น passive (ได้ทุกเทิร์น) ของอีกฝ่ายออก อีกฝ่ายจะตกอยู่ในกำมือเรา 5555

เงินใช้ซื้อตัวละคร - คบไฟใช้อัพเกรดกิล เมื่อกดใช้1ครั้ง การอัพเกรดครั้งต่อไปจะ+1 เช่น Urchin ตัวแรก 3 เหรียญ หลังจากกดซื้อ ตัวต่อไปจะ 4 เหรียญ กดอีก ตัวต่อไปก็จะ 5 เหรียญไปเรื่อยๆ 

ซึ่งแมพก็จะแบ่งออกเป็นอีก 5 แมพใหญ่ๆ วิธีการเล่นเหมือนเดิม แต่การบริหารกิลจะต้องปรับไปตามแมพ เช่น แมพ Palace ที่ต้องให้ Guard ไปป้องกันป้อมคบไฟ แมพนี้เราต้องอัพเลือดให้ Guard เราถึกขึ้น เป็นต้น 

แต่เหนือสิ่งอื่นใด จงอย่าลืมภารกิจหลักของเราเป็นอันขาด ถึงแม้คุณจะบริหารกิลดีแค่ไหน แต่ภารกิจคุณสำเร็จช้า(ครบ)กว่าอีกฝ่าย ก็แพ้อยู่ดี โดยปกติ จะมี Victory Points ต่อการล่น 1 เกม ประมาณ 6 คะแนน ซึ่งได้มาจาก การฆ่า Contact + ทำ Blackmail + ติดสินบน (เป็นรูปซองจดหมาย) ในแต่ภารกิจจะมี 1 คะแนน ซึ่งคุณสามารถจัดการได้เลยว่าจะใช้วิธีไหน อาจจะใช้หลายวิธีหรือวิธีเดียวก็ได้ แต่คะแนนต้องครบ แต่จะมีบางแมพที่มีภารกิจพิเศษ ในการสร้าง Victory Points ด้วย เช่นด่านท่าเรือ จะมีเรือมาจอดทุกเทิร์น ให้เราเอา Urchin 2 คนใส่ลงในเรือให้สำเร็จ เทิร์นต่อไปเมื่อเรือออก เราจะได้เสบียง ซึ่งเป็นคะแนนพิเศษ เป็นต้น

นอกจากนี้ ตัวเกมจะมีโหมดใหญ่ๆ อยู่ 3 โหมด คือโหมด Campaign (โหมดเนื้อเรื่อง ใช้ปลดล็อคตัวละครลับ)
โหมด Online (ใช้เล่นออนไลน์กับคนอื่น ซึ่ง Archivement ส่วนใหญ่อยู่ในโหมดนี้) และโหมด Skirmish (เป็นโหมดใช้เล่นกับ AI มีระดับความยากง่าย 3 ระดับ + ใช้เล่นกับเพื่อน) 

และด้วยความที่เป็นเกมที่เล่นจบเป็นตาๆ ไม่มีเวล มีไรให้เก็บ จึงเป็นเกมที่ใช้ฆ่าเวลาได้ดี เกมนึงยากๆ อาจใช้เวลาสูงสุดแค่ครึ่ง ชม จบ เป็นเกมใช้ความคิด วางแผน แต่ไม่เครียดมาก ก็น่าจะเป็น1ในทางเลือกการเล่นเกมเบาๆก่อนไปเล่นเกมหนักๆเนอะ 5555

ขอให้สนุกกับการเล่นเกมนะครับ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141201304', 'num_games_owned': 4366, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1515507192}
review:
간단해 보이는 턴제 전략게임 같지만
그 깊이를 알면 한턴 한턴에 승패를 좌우 해버리는 게임
그리고 각각의 맵들로 다양한 전략게임을 할수 있다.
단, 사람대 사람으로서 하는 멀티게임 한해서 말이다.

멀티게임에서는 Live Match / Casual Match 두 가지 방식이 있다.
말 그대로 Live Match는 실시간으로 행해지는 게임
Casual Match는 실시간이 아닌 턴제를 주고 받고하는 응답형 게임

원래 게임은 이겨야 재밌다.
하지만 1승 14패라는 패배의 향연으로 놀라운 전적을 보유하고 있지만
재밌다...져도 재밌다....

author: {'steamid': '76561198005391568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1601754032}
review:
Vous avez aimé "Armello"? Et puis "Gremelins inc"? Alors vous adorerez "Antihero"!

"Antihero" est un jeu de plateau en tour par tour où vous incarnez un voleur d'une guilde, votre guilde, qui évolue au coeur de l'Angleterre de l'époque victorienne, et avez comme adversaire un autre voleur d'une guilde rivale (ou plusieurs voleurs et guildes en escarmouche).

Il vous faudra dans ce jeu ateindre le premier un nombre de points de victoire acquis de manière différentes, tout en paralysant les actions de votre rival par différents moyens tous plus fourbes les uns que les autres afin de l'empêcher d'acquérir ces points de victoires.
.
Vous gagnerez ainsi de l'or et des lanternes, les 2 ressources du jeu, l'or servant à acquérir des personnages pour mener vos actions, et les lanternes pour débloquer des compétences et de nouveaux personnages.

L'interface ainsi que le plateau de jeu sont tous deux parfaits, la campagne, qui fait en réalité office de tutoriel, est évolutive et fonctionnelle et la traduction du jeu est impeccable.

Le jeu quant à lui se comprend vite et est très addictif, d'autant qu'il vous faudra souvent recommencer certaines missions avant de les gagner tant l'IA ne vous fait pas de cadeaux.

Je n'ai pas encore fini la campagne qui ne cesse de s'étoffer, mais j'imagine déjà ce que pourront donner les parties sur internet entre plusieurs joueurs.

Amis voleurs et malandrins, à bientôt au détour d'une ruelle sombre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086345313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1539145415}
review: Great indie strategy game. Holds a lot of potential. I love the concept of 2 criminals battling for power over a town. Great story mode that I found engaging. Multiplayer isn't very active considering that this game isn't that popular. Instead of making cosmetic things, this game should work to add more gameplay and more strategies. This game doesn't seem to have a diverse enough ecosystem in terms of strategy. Although this game has its faults, I would reccomend it. It's a fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007571913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1554146763}
review: Bon petit jeu de stratégie. On retrouve les sensation d'un jeu de plateau. On peu faire des partie de moin d'une heure. En plus le jeu est plein de charme et les accents des personnages improbable!

review: So I was expecting far less than what this game is. This is a fun way to spend several hours as you play a thief, assassin and guild master all in one. The campaign is a delight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067962007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4894, 'last_played': 1590121693}
review: Simple to learn yet easily addicting, Antihero is a 1v1 table-top esque game that while only has a small range of maps offers up new and interesting routes and playstlyes that change due to the random generation of landmark properties. The upgrade tree is adaptative on the fly and each round will hold familiarity yet be new and unique due to the moves of each player and the strategies they bring to the game. Cheap and defintely a hidden gem amongst the slog of indie games that are released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014059061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1509820645}
review:
The idea of the game was intriguing enough to make me buy it in sale but after a fairly short time game falls flat. The digitalised board game just went to ... boring. The Antihero is full of humor that would keep you entertained for a couple of hours but sadly that's it. Is that enough?
Gameplay rules are easy to understand and you will explore game features in tutorial/campaign over like 3 - 5 hours. Multiplayer should be the main thing yet it feel mostly dead for me and I really hope the whole "mail a turn" mode was meant as a joke.

+ Artwork and graphic
+ Board game digitalised
+ Gameplay rules are clear, easy to grasp
- Game is basically an abstract resource collector with less meaning to it
- Lacks of more depth, content
- Boredom comes faster than expected
- Multiplayer is dead. Sad. I did even encounter some glitches along the path of playing it 
- Mail a turn as one of the multiplayer modes. I don't find it useful or at least funny as a joke from developers. I tried it and maybe it bring 90's nostalgia but other than that, nothing else.

4/10 [i]"If you really like the boardgame strategy version and you have friends to play this with, go for it. Otherwise I doubt you will find your money/fun ratio interesting enough to get it .."[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967421581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1685828222}
review:
This is a fun little game for a quick distraction. However, because it is a strategy game, most of the steps you take are always the same. Only the randomness of the building placements offers a little change to the order you do things. 

Ultimately, it's a cute little game, and it's worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028931964', 'num_games_owned': 5385, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1510165857}
review:
Great, yet very short, gaming experience. Antihero manages to prefectly transpose the spirit of a board game into digital form. Although the rules are simple and straightforward, it offers a variety of ways to beat your opponent. Kill the marks, collect lanterns for bribes, swarm the churches with urchins... it's all up to you. Additional victory points at each of the maps are pretty smart and fun.

Sadly, you can finish the singleplayer campaign on normal difficulty in two or three hours. Multiplayer is pretty much dead at the moment (been searching for live games for couple minutes in the afternoons, but to no avail), so unless you have a friend that has a game and is willing to play with you that's all Antihero has to offer in its current state. However, the last mission hints that there could be more adventures of this bunch of victorian rascals...

author: {'steamid': '76561198274588121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1530123561}
review: Great game but the format of the game can support more than 1v1. Add a larger map with multiple players and more people would buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991177319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1509941666}
review:
The concept is interesting, but the game falls flat. The game is humerous and interesting, but the games' lack of polish gets in the way of its design. 

Some gameplay concepts are confusing and unclear, and sometimes it is difficult to see the map underneath the giant heads of the characters. 

Multiplayer also seems dead - and the games local play just feels weak.

Points for style, but overall the game is just not worth it unless it's drastically on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028086778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1509737374}
review:
Jolis graphismes, mais jeu trop limité. A chaque chapitre, on perd parce que le jeu est fait comme cela. La fois suivante on gagne car on sait ce que le scénario a prévu. Bref, lassant, pas palpitant, ennuyeux au possible.

 Ca fait une heure que je joue et chaque partie est la même, on joue on se fait avoir et on gagne la suivante. 

 Nuuul et limité. Dommage bon principe et bonne ambiance, gâchés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089787791', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1509734321}
review:
非常有趣的回合制桌游类游戏
比起100%橙汁还是比较考验策略战术，运气成分相对较少
游戏中的智斗有视野，卡位，升级，资源，科技，抢点等。虽然主要目标不是杀光对面，但这个回合游戏玩起来就像魔兽争霸这样的即时战略，策略性很强。
虽然没有中文，但游戏英文要求不高，战役中教程和游戏中的图标还是很贴心的，会一点英语的上手完全没问题。
缺点的话就是一个回合时间比较长(有限时)，而且和炉石一样，在对手回合你什么都干不了，只能看着，更尴尬的是有时你还只能看着一片雾（没视野），如果只想打打电脑玩玩或是有基友一起玩（边玩边聊聊天）倒是没什么问题，自己一个人想玩多人还是比较费时间,非常考验耐心（这里是说live match）。如果选择casual match则是每次玩一回合，轮到你的时候给你发email提醒，不用呆等在电脑面前。。。。。（感觉还不如live match呢）
还有就是虽然游戏标签标的是多人，但其实只能两个人玩。
总的来说如果是喜欢策略类桌游的并且有好基友，好耐心或只想和电脑玩玩的现在买了绝对不亏。不喜欢策略的话还是玩100%橙汁更好。没有基友的话。。。。。还是买个单机游戏划得来吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007182557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 9877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1578654523}
review:
At the time of this review I have played through the campaign and played a single match online. Based on those two experiences, I can easily say that this is one of the best games I have played this year.

At its core, you control a Thieves Guild, along with its main character: The Master Thief.
The Master Thief is primarily used to scout the city and burgle neighbourhoods in order to steal coins. You'll also get to upgrade your Guild so as to get access to other types of units, which include, for example, the Thug, the Gang and Urchins. These are hired with said stolen coins and are sent into the city to infiltrate businesses, block your opponent from doing any infiltrating, and to attack your opponent's units.
Your opponent is - of course - doing the exact same thing during his or her round.

The game thus becomes a sort of chessgame during which you both try to get the upper hand, althewhile trying to block the other. Resources are necessary not only for getting more units in the field, but also for pursuing those tasks that grant you victory points. These tasks vary from using urchins to take control of a church, assassinating wandering targets, spending resources on bribes, etc.
Whoever accumulates the necessary victory points first (which vary depending on the map) wins the game.

If you enjoy tactical thinking, set in a Dickens-setting, then you'll enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009397141', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1614236475}
review:
I am a very big fan of boardgames in real life and was wonderfully surprised once I read and saw videos about this game.
A fantastic online boardgame that is quite easy to learn and has enough depth to be competitive, low player counts should not scare you away from this game as the amazing one turn asymmetrical multiplayer helps players connect and continue games through days and even weeks.

If this game ever goes on a sale then definitely buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383794231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3579, 'last_played': 1512957159}
review:
Pretty great game, awsome theme and aesthetic. The game itself is easy to get into and once you master the mechanics its fairly simple to beat the AI on hard. It truly shines in the multiplayer, especially if you have a friend to play with, but if not the queue for matchmaking is usually fairly short. There are some elements of RNG involved, and you certainly can get screwed from time to time, but its not as bad as many other board games and a game never feels unsalvageable. For its price its a great value proposition, especially if you get it on a sale.

 Recommended if you like boardgames!

author: {'steamid': '76561198401868324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1703595800}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist gut geeignet wenn man mal Abschalten will um einfach etwas zu spielen. Es erfordert keine lange Eingewöhnungzeit, es bringt Kurzweiligen Spaß in Rundenbasierenden Matches. Man ist ein Dieb der die Stadt nach und nach ausraubt und kontrolliert. Werde selbst Pate *grinst* kleiner Spaß. Man hat zwar nur eine kurze Kampange, dafür im Skirmish Modus viele Avatar zur Verfügung um selbst die einzelnen Szenarien nochmal nach herzenslust zu spielen. 
Alles im Allem bringt es Anfängern und Experten Spaß um die Langeweile zu vertreiben. Euer Riku Melodie

author: {'steamid': '76561197991728980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1572885526}
review:
It's a very entertaining indie game. Sure, the campaign is short but one has to also keep in mind that the game was developed by a very small team. 

The true strength of this game is in its asynchronous multiplayer. Once again I have time to play the game with friends and at my pace. It's great. 

Art is readable, gameplay is deep enough to give me weeks of fun and the game is being updated with tweaks and bugfixes (haven't found a bug yet). 

All in all one of my better game purchases this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999578415', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1525117471}
review: Пошаговое развлечение на пару часов, вся механика и развитие раскрывается за первые полчаса, далее игра всеми силами старается задержать игрока. Все главные персонажи одинаковые, развития и получения новых перков по мере прохождения кампании нет, а потому многие могут заскучать через пару часов (как, например, я). Визуально выглядит добротно, собрана качественно, лично мне быстро наскучила, но несколько часов удовольствия принесла.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063990714', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1517708229}
review:
i liked the look of this game  it its really good tactical board game 
actually keeps you on your toes 
tactics  well stealing is the key and using urchins to takeover buildings thugs to kill people and gangs to mess other gangs up or evict people...plenty to like lol
the feeling when you lay boobie traps (using the bomber) and they get set off is great payback and fun also gives great tension to what would be a generic turn based game
so there you go a great game not overpriced and kills time better than most games

author: {'steamid': '76561198050300019', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1591433052}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992368957', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1502715189}
review:
Antihero is a nice turn-based strategy board game. Perfect for people who want to chill out from other complex or action-heavy games.

[h1]About the game:[/h1]
You control your hero - a thief - and summon other NPCs in order to capture points of interest on the map and fight one opponent for set amount of victory points. There are multiple ways of achieving victory and some maps add special objectives for a twist. Each turn you manage your resources - gold and lanterns - by entering house squares, placing NPCs into buildings and attacking neutral/enemy NPCs on the map. Your hero also has a talent tree, where you can choose between learning a new skill or earning free gold/lanterns. Maps for each game are randomized - buildings of interest spawn at different squares and NPC movements are also random, which is a plus.

This game has three game modes:
- Campaign (also doubles as a Tutorial)
- Skirmish, where you can play against AI or against another player at your PC
- Multiplayer, where you can play against other people online through Steam

I finished the campaign on hard difficulty under 6 hours of game time, so it felt rather short. However, if you enjoy the game during the short campaign, skirmishes and online play can last you for a while. The game is quite easy to learn and offers enough depth to keep you invested. Finally, the graphics, animations, sounds and music are great and they perfectly match the theme of the game.

If you like board games and you want to play this game against other players online, get it. If you're not interested in online play, the price tag 14,99€ feels a little too high for the play time this game offers, so you're better off waiting for a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004646918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1502300173}
review:
One word - awesome.
Let's start with things that I didn't like:
Campaing seems to be short. I am almost done with it, and it only took a few hours on normal.
There is quite a lot of handholding in the beginning. In first two-three missions - many of your moves will be predetirmend. Not my favorite way of learning, to be honest.
Okay, that was a short list.
Now things I do like:
Art style - chraming an hilarious.
Depth that comes with multiple playstyles, objectives, and, ultimately - human opponents.
Awesome selection of multiplayer modes - hotseat, asycnchronous and synchronous online modes. Love it. 
Making house rules - genious. If you feel like game is poorly balanced - you have tools to make it how you think it should be. You can tweak a lot of things related to  victory points and prices. This is generally is such a great and rare thing to see - despite that I don't think I would change anything. Maybe I will experiment with reduction of price on Thugs and increase in price of Bands, but game is enjoyable as it is.
Dynamic gameplay - I am no game designer, but it seems that many mecahnics (increasing price on multiple units, upgrades, high cost of thugs) were made in a way that facilitates easier catch-ups and combacks, which is great for a multiplayer game. Overall, it seems that game is balanced in a way that favors not establishing dominance and gaining more and more agvantage over your opponent, but in a way that favors leveraging advantages you have at the moment into earning victory points.
In conclusion - try this game. It is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065978902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1615818578}
review:
This is a digital board game. I think the price of $15 USD is a great price, since physical board games are regularly $50, but this saves you from all the set-up and clean-up of a physical board game. The campgain has 11 stages, I think two of which are showing you how to play. I enjoyed the campaign a lot. The light story was fun and had me interested in the avatars/characters.

I like to play multiplayer casual, which allows you to walk away after your turn and come back to it later. It's nice to do my turns before work and then come back to them at the end of the day.

If you like board games but can't get people together to play one at your house, then this is perfect for you. It was for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971846930', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1500996961}
review:
Antihero é um jogo de tabuleiro digital/estratégia por turnos que faz muito bem o que um bom jogo do gênero exige: utiliza bem a sua temática. Cada unidade tem um propósito, nenhuma é redundante, as estratégias exigem adaptação de partida para partida e isso mantém a qualidade de replay dele. O sistema online permite que você jogue no seu ritmo, seja live ou casual, no qual você joga seus turnos quando puder, e acaba sendo um jogo perfeito para ocupar um espaço livre em que você precisa esperar alguma coisa ou simplesmente não tem tempo suficiente pra jogar uma partida completa de algo mais longo. Com certeza é um jogo que se encaixa perfeitamente em mobile, mas até sua versão para celulares chegar, a versão do steam vale o seu preço para quem gosta do gênero. Se você não gosta de jogos competitivos, o custo dele ainda vale a pena em promoção graças as partidas contra a AI e a campanha de mais ou menos 3 horas. De bônus, ele traz cheat codes para quem quiser jogar como dois youtubers que apoiaram a idéia desde o início: TotalBiscuit e Jesse Cox.

Pros: Excelente temática, estratégias diversificadas, cada mapa tem seus próprios objetivos, Leaderboards baseados em habilidade, Partidas Casuais
Contra: Versão mobile ainda indisponível

Se quiser conferir mais, segue review em vídeo:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JtRwPEh9iSk

author: {'steamid': '76561198014194256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1501724944}
review:
How the game works:
1.) Map
The map consists of rectangular tiles which are covered in fog of war. These tiles can be either streets or houseblocks. Streets can be used to move units. Houseblocks can be burgled for money and research currency (lamps).
Houseblock also contain one of several infiltratable buildings which give different bonuses like more money, lamps or discounts on units.

2.) Exploration
Each turn, the active player gets a character which has a certain number of actions per turn. The number of actions depends on certain skills in the research trees.
An action can be:
- Get rid of up to 3 tiles fog of war at streets
- Attack an NPC / enemy player unit
- Scout a houseblock und burgle the building you entered the housblock through.
- Burgle a building of an already discovered houseblock
After all your actions with this character are used, you can't explore further. (with one excpetion)

3.) Builder Placement
Each turn the active player can spend gold to hire henchman. These are:
-Urchin (can infiltrate buildings to give the player boni)
-Thug (can block streets and disappear after 2 turn(doesn't count for gangs))
-Gang (can attack NPC / enemy player units, gets an upgrade for each kill(8 total), gets life by "devour" Thugs)
-Saboteur (places traps in buildings for 2 turns. Unit which attacks a trapped building is stunned for 1 turn and loses all actionpoints. Also scouts buildings)
-Officer (clears an entire building from urchins. Disappears after 1 use)
-Assassin (Deals massive damage. Disappears after 1 use)

4.) Research
Each turn, the active player can buy upgrades from 3 tech trees for lamps. these upgrades give several bonuses like more advanced henchman or more action points for the temporary character.


Campaign:
The campaign consists of 11 levels with different objectives.
The first 3 levels are more or less the tutorial, where the game guides you through its mechanics. But, the third level is by far the most difficult one in the entire game.
The rest plays like a normal skirmish with some cool ideas to change the objectives (don't wanna spoiler something here).
In my opinion its the strongest part of the game, despite its length.
I still have to criticise the 3rd level as to hard, not just in terms of an normal level, but also as an follow up, to the first 2 really easy and guided missions.

Skirmish:
Skirmish games are games for victory points against the AI.
You can choose to play on 4 different maps. 3 of them already known through the campaign.
You can also choose the difficulty of the bots from 3 different difficulties.
To make a long story short, you play through the above mentioned steps (How the game works) and fight for victorypoints.
After some matches you get a spin on how things work and this mode brings you no challenge anymore.

Multiplayer:
The Multiplayer is split into 2 options, which play out like skirmish matches, but against a real opponent.
1.) Live Match
The are literally skirmish matches against a human player.
The big downside is, you can't choose a map (its random) and you just can see the scenario info in loadscreens

2.) Casual
Casual matches play out as skirmishes too, but not synchronous like a live match. The match is hosted on a server, so you can actually leave the game for your opponents turn.
You get an email when your turn begins.
The problem with this is, even, when you stay ingame, everytime your turn starts, you get an email. It is possible to disable this in the options. But i would prefer a simple
query if the player is still taking part in the actual game. If not send a email, if he is, dont send one.
In this mode you're actualy able to use the scenario info outside of the loading screen.


And now the criticism:
These are mostly aimed on the multiplayer part of the game

1. First turn advantage
After a developer answered to this post, that they took measurements to prevent this, I played some more games against a friend.
Every time, the player, who started first won the map. You really get some extra lamp on your first turn, and our experience may be just unlucky, but at least for me, this is a thing.

2. Maps aren't randomized itself, but how the ressources are distributed is.
This is a big problem. Especially in the early game. A fairly legit tactic is to rush to the enemy base, research thugs and spam his base. This forces the player to develop gangs and let them stay out in the open, so they can be killed.
If you also have no gold generating buildings, you have to kill the Thugs with your main character, which costs you an action and also the only attack for a round. On the other side, the other player still has his freedom,
 can expand faster and snowball out of this.
I dont wanna have a mirrored map or something like this, but I think a money generating building at the start area should be added.

3. Victory points are randomized over the map.
I.)Churches spawn in different locations with different distances to the player
II.)assasinationtargets / NPC targets spawn random through all of the map (despite buildings)
It can happen, that a Target is spawning in front of a playerbase, which means the other player has some big problems, like:
- the other player hasn't lifted the fog of war yet.
- the "lucky player" will kill the other players gang for getting the target (which brings the other player into a hughe disadvantage)
- the "lucky player" can train his gangs with addspawn from the target.
-the "lucky player" also can have some disadvantages by this spawn too.
This targets block paths, so one player can trap the enemy inside of his spawn very easy and also spawnkilling new gangs without having any risk.

4. Insufficient Visibility for Victorycontions
Victoryconditions are just visible through a button in the menu (through the gear symbol) or the loadscreen before a match.
In live matches the button in the menu is not clickable.
I would like to see a button in the actual game (in the UI, not in the menu) which shows you the victorycondition of the current map when pressed.


After playing some more games and also played the campaign, i can understand why many people recommend this game. But I still have my concerns especially
on the PVP side of the game and can't change my decision with good conscience.
I will look into later patches and update this review if neccessary.

I hope the team behind this will keep it up and take this as its meant to be, constructive criticism from someone, who appreciates and likes the idea behind the game.

Reviewchangelog:
-Reworked the "How the game works" part. Made it more detailed, to reflect to flow of the game better
-Added the part "Campaign"
-Added the part "Skirmish"
-Added the part "Multiplayer"
-Added the title "Criticism"
-Reworked "First turn advantage"
-Reworked "Maps aren't randomized itself, but how the ressources are distributed is."
-Reworked "Insufficient Visibility for Victorycontions"
-Reworked the last paragraph
developer_response:
Hi G4rviel - thanks for your comments! Some clarifications:

- Player 2 gets an additional lantern on their first turn. This allows them to get an additional guild upgrade on turn 1. Our playtesting shows that this balances out the turn-1 advantage quite well.

- If you forget a map's special rules, you can click the "Scenario Info" button in the options dialog (accessed with the Gear icon in the top left of the game screen). This will show the scenario intro screen, with the map's special rules.

- Re: RNG - this is, of course, a matter of preference. Some players want no randomness at all, which I totally respect! Antihero is not RNG-heavy, but we feel its few random elements are really important to the game, especially in regards to making each match feel unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131260100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1501592212}
review:
好游戏，光是玩战役和AI对战就挺有意思。
游戏背景是开膛手杰克，你和你的对手都是大盗，在伦敦进行1V1回合制游戏。胜利方式是一人一回合，比谁先获得足够的胜利点数，包括刺杀，贿赂，教堂，以及一些特殊地图点。需要合理利用资源，升级科技树，召唤不同类型的小弟，控制地图。一局游戏在20分钟左右吧。
本人绝大部分英语游戏都无压力，此游戏属于不怎么要翻译的，战役打个3关，单词规则就能明白个大概了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030064821', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1514417162}
review:
At first, this game may seem enjoyable and the art style is nice. Playing on normal difficulty where the AI uses questionable strategies, you'll enjoy it for a few hours.
However - against hard difficulty AI or any competent player, the game becomes a long and grating war of attrition. This is not fun at all. To add to that, there is an element of RNG involved - if one of the players spawns near better resources, that player is clearly going to have an advantage.
So in all, the game doesn't have much replay value once you've completed the story. It works much better as a short, single player game instead of a long, grindy multiplayer where both players come to a stalemate after gathering the map's resources.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001072155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1646591258}
review:
If you like board games with a strong focus on action/resource management then you'll probably like Antihero because at it's core that's what it is. While this is a video game in reality it's much closer to a board game than a more traditional turn based strategy game.

My only real complaint is that the single player isn't great. The compaign is mostly a glorified tutorial which is fine but the AI in the skirmish mode isn't great, even on the hardest setting you can beat it pretty easily with a little practice.

The upside is that there's a good multi-player mode including a casual mode that is basically play-by-email to allow for more extended play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155945288', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1583472008}
review:
The main focuses of AntiHero are tactics and map domination. Each map is different and neighborhoods seem to be randomly assigned. I love the variety of characters and play styles that the game allows, and how the characters and upgrades fit into the theme of the game. The only one I'd say might not fit as well as the others is the assassin, but it's obvious once you start making headway through the campaign that a character like this is needed to keep other character advantages balanced.

There are so many possibilities and potential strategies and I absolutely love that. It's not a typical tactics game where you calculate your move radius and go after the enemies. It's also not a typical map domination game where you move units and battle your opponents units for territory. Every house can be burgled, every establishment infiltrated. How you play is truly and entirely up to you. This is what makes the online play, in particular, so exciting.

After seeing the gameplay trailer I knew I wanted to try this game. After trying the game, I knew I wanted to 100% it, something that very rarely happens. After beating the campaign on regular difficulty, and now being one level away from completing it on hard, I want everybody else to play it. The graphics are charming, the characters are memorable, and the structure feels right.

I look forward to seeing what else is done with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130858509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1501030118}
review: Good game, fun to play. The only real downside it can get repetitve pretty fast, as I got really bored with 6 matches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035482521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1550182345}
review:
Antihero jest grą ciekawą. Jest kilka kwestii, które trzeba omówić, mówiąc o tej grze:

Tryb fabularny- Krótki i ciekawy. Do przejscia w 4 godziny. Dla wielu pewnie będzie to minus, ale ja potraktowałem go w roli dużego wprowadzenia do gry i zdaje to egzamin. W trybie fabularnym poznajemy wszystkie mechaniki występujące w grze, a przejście całego trybu fabularnego jest dobrym początkiem.

Tryb multiplayer- Istna wisienka na torcie. Cały urok tej gry polega na rozgrywkach multiplayerowych rozgrywanych pomiędzy dwoma graczami. Za każdym razem na mapie budynki losują się inaczej, a każdy z graczy ma na zwycięstwo inną taktykę, dzięki czemu zwycięstwa cieszą, a porażki uczą.

Grafika i muzyka- Bardzo interesująca oprawa graficzna przynosząca na myśl świat bardziej komiksowy. W tej tematyce nadaje grze uroku, i klimatu, który przyciąga graczy. I wygląda dość profesjonalnie, co jak na grę indie jest kolejnym walorem :) Muzyka również nie odstaje i pasuje do realiów gry.

Mechanika - Zastosowane w grze mechaniki niezwykle ciekawe. Każdy może znaleść swój sposób na zwycięstwo, a sama rozgrywka wciąga mimo pozornego skomplikowania

Ogólnie grę oceniam bardzo pozytywnie. Wszystko ładnie współgra, a komiksowa grafika nadaje ciekawego uroku. Grze nie można odmówić klimatyczności i tego, że jest po prostu bardzo dobrą produkcją. Jeżeli miałbym zawrzeć ocenę w liczbie  od 1-10, to dałbym tej grze 8/9, z powodu kilku niedoskonałości, które jednak nie przeszkadzają w rozgrywce, a są jedynie efektem lekkiego czepialstwa do szczegółów.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159554014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1524425388}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015833515', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1500922312}
review:
Obecnie chyba najładniejsza planszówka w 2d na Steamie. Widać że twórcy rozumieją obydwa światy (planszowy i komputerowy) i udaje im się zrobić grę, która dowozi w obydwu aspektach. Pełna recenzja tutaj: 

https://youtu.be/SYZ47pxN4LQ

na PLUS: 
+ ładna rysowana grafika i przejrzyste UI 
+ dobre udźwiękowienie 
+ podstawowe zasady łatwe do opanowania 
+ z żywym przeciwnikiem stanowi wyzwanie
+ sporo możliwości 
+ asynchroniczne multi 
+ własne ustawienia gry przy skirmishu 
+ dobrze wyważona rozgrywka
+ zróżnicowane mapy

na MINUS: 
- dla graczy tylko single może się szybko znudzić
- gang wydaje się jednostką, którą trudno "odrobić" w trakcie gry jeśli zostanie zabita 
- AI na HARD powinno być trudniejsze

Ogólnie polecam na pojedyncze wieczorne sesje z piwkiem, kiedy bardziej macie ochotę pokombinować niż np. postrzelać.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350494668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1500895923}
review:
Antihero doesn't feel all that fast-paced. I'm writing this review after playing for 1.8 hours, but it feels like I've been playing much longer. The game is a slog to play through. Most of the game is resource management. Even though each game only took about 20 minutes or less, it felt like I was sitting there for an hour just waiting to get enough resources to actually do something. You have multiple ways to gain victory points, but none of them feel satisfying. None of them feel like I actually accomplished something.

The character designs are very cute. The field design, however, is cluttered, The perspective makes it hard to tell where where buildings are, precisely. Sometimes it's really hard to click on the right square because you have a sign, building, or character in the way. Everything on the screen is ovelapped on top of eachother. It made the experience really disorienting. I felt confused most of the time, even though the gameplay mechanics are really simple.

There's a couple things to like about the game. As it says up above, I like the character design, and the voice acting is pretty good. But, for the most part, I found the game boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103358395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1500861196}
review:
8/10 fun, short, quirky indie turn based strategy/board -lite game
++ Art is stellar and quite different
++ Game mechanics come naturally and the tutorials introduce mechanics well
++ Very fun to play, game style makes you smile
+ Characters are unique and memorable
+ The 10 mission map (+Tutorial) is varied with each mission having new mechanics/victory conditions
+ Could be fun from a multiplayer POV/additional replay value

- Very short game (~6.5 hours on normal)
- Novelty stops towards the end which shows limitation of assets

author: {'steamid': '76561197990347787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 2104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1657221404}
review:
Un excellent jeu de plateau
Pas mal de mécaniques disponibles pour marquer des points, on peut s'adapter aux coups de l'adversaire et le tout est bien équilibré
La campagne solo est bien fichue, proposant des niveaux aux gimmicks variés et des IA aux stratégies différentes (3 Corners on hard, c'est un peu coton)
Pour le multi, on a le choix entre des parties en live ou en chacun son tour sans contrainte de temps, c'est fort pratique

Ces petits orphelins sont trop mignons
quand ils se font assassiner

author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1500569055}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OcN1D6LIAoQ
[h1][b]Jedna z najlepszych gierek indie jakie grałem w tym roku[/b][/h1]
[b]Więcej - http://broda.tv/[/b]
Po pierwsze bardzo fajnie zaprojektowany styl graficzny - lekki komiks, lekki mrok, lekka wycinanka. Z jajcem, z humorem, z klimatem. Po drugie odwrotnosć tego, co najczęściej spotykamy - nie jesteśmy superbohaterem, a właśnie liderem gangu. Będziemy okradać, napadać, rabować i zabijać. Po trzecie - ciekawie zaprojektowana mechanika planszowa, gdzie mamy kilka rodzajów jednostek do wykorzystania i każda z nich ma inne zadania na całej planszy. Urwisy kontrolują specjalne budynki generują nam to, co te budynki dają. Bandyci strzegą skrzyżowań, by wróg nie mógł przez nie przejść, gangi napadają na budynki wroga albo mordują NPC. Sabotażyści zakładają pułapki lub odkrywają dzielnice. Zabawa jest bardzo przyjemna plus do tego jest tryb skirmish oraz multi. Mimo tego produkcja ma jedną dużą wadę - bardzo krótki tryb jednego gracza i krótka kampania, zaledwie 10 map, które zaliczymy w ciagu paru godzin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038785130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1515608863}
review:
I have enjoyed this game for the majority of the time i played it. Which implies it is not perfect.

I started this game up after watching a bit of gameplay and finding the art style quite nice which is very personal preference regarding art style.

Like many others i decided to play the campaign first which does a good job of showing you the ropes and providing 10 varied levels but none of them (aside from lvl 6 which was a pain) gave me a huge challenge even though i played on hard difficulty.

But the meat of the game is not the campaign despite telling a nice little story. The meat of the game is the multiplayer which is a very different experience from the single player.

So what makes the meat of the game worth your money?

- The different maps you have seen throughout the campaign make each map feel unique.
- The very varied strategies people use online compared to offline means you have to adapt to the situation you are given every single game.

-  Online also has 2 ways for you to play
1. Active game which essentially is the normal way to play the game
2. play by email which means every time you have done your turn you can exit the match and come back a day later if you want assuming your opponent has taken his turn by then.

- Randomized location for every special building in each map so even if you get the same map twice, it won't have the exact same special buildings in the exact same spot. 

- Almost chess like strategy which means you will learn to think multiple moves ahead

So overall, i enjoy the game and the devs seem to be eager to improve on the game to add features and balance the game which is greatly appreciated.

Pros:
- Solid multiplayer with ongoing balance changes and features planned to be added
- Art style (very personal)
- Story
- Variation in levels
- Campaign has easy, normal and hard difficulty
- Fitting soundtrack (may seem weird but to me this is important)

Cons:
- Campaign is more of a story / tutorial than a challenge to keep you busy for hours
- Balance issues
- Uncertain but i believe there are only 5 maps in the multiplayer and i have had multiple games in a row end up on the exact same map.
- Some animations are very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063878961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1501314441}
review:
Antihero is a great little turn-based tactical strategy game where you manage various unsavoury character in a thieve's guild to take over city districts before your rivals can do the same. At first it seems simple but it gets very complex and challenging very quickly, and it is tonnes of fun.

Highly recommended if you like turn-based tactical games or boardgames.

Full Review:
https://youtu.be/FXUDtIpEfSQ

Check out some gameplay footage:
https://youtu.be/cogwZAnMVMM

author: {'steamid': '76561198141962562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1500848647}
review:
Güzel vakit geçirebileceğiniz, eğlenceli bir tur bazlı strateji oyunu. Tur bazlı strateji oyunundan ziyade kutu oyunlarını anımsattı bana ilk bakışta.
"Campaign" modu çok uzun değil ve nerdeyse tüm bölümler tutorial kıvamında geçiyor. Anladığım üzere asıl üzerinde durmaya çalıştıkları mod online modu. 
Henüz online modunu çok oynamamış olsamda, denemek için bir iki kez girdim ve sanıyorum ki oynayan oyuncu azlığından dolayı maç bulması biraz uzun sürüyor.
Oynanışı bana kalırsa gayet basit, sadece bazen "campaign" modunda yapay zeka'nın size kıyak geçtiğini düşünüyorsunuz, bazense alakasız bir noktadan hızlıca oyunu kaybedebiliyorsunuz. 

Satın almadan önce oyunun oynanışını merak edenler ; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CgQTVA7Q8SU linkinden 1080p-60fps kalitesinde FACE-CAM'li izleyebilirler.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999184630', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1500457692}
review:
Antihero est un titre qui puise son inspiration dans les jeux de plateau, ce qui est plutôt à la mode en ce moment. Bien réalisé, avec une bonne direction artistique, le gameplay est simple à comprendre. Pour autant, il faudra un peu de temps avant de maîtriser le jeu et de comprendre comment gagner. J'explique plus en détails le gameplay dans cette vidéo de présentation : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PAuDjN59-HY

La partie solo est intéressante pour se faire la main, l'IA présentant un challenge suffisant. Cela vous permettra d'aller vous frotter aux autres voleurs en ligne, avec un système multi de type PBEM.

Mon principal reproche au jeu est l'absence d'aléatoire dans la partie. Il aurait été intéressant d'avoir des cartes, des événements, des choses qui apportent plus de variété au cours d'une partie. Et pourtant je ne suis pas fan de l'aléas ;)

Pas mauvais, c'est un petit jeu que je recommande quand même, bien que sa durée de vie soit limitée je pense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000402623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1499770338}
review: Strip away the victorian setting, the thieves theme, all you have is a very shallow and watered-down board game of resource management. It's a race to fulfill certain resource requirements, while bumbling your way around a map filled with fog of wall where progression is mostly hit-or-miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041592479', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1564857868}
review:
This game is a good way to spend an afternoon when you're looking for a challenge without frustration.
The game has many aspects that make it seem simple at first, but more complex as you learn the game. With one of the best features being that there are many different ways to choose how to play without feeling forced to do something.
I'm looking forward to the future of this game, because there is also a lot of potential for DLC. They could add new content easily and it would fit perfectly into this already polished game.
Though I will warn, if you do not play through the campaign, you will find yourself lost when playing online. And the game isn't meant for long sessions of play, as the content is still rather thin when compared to other games.
Overall a great game with a lot of potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975982686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1500771547}
review:
I've only played a couple hours, and only single player Campaign mode.

Pros
Graphics are well done.  Enjoy the character they've put into the characters and maps
The Campaign mode has enough diversity between stages to keep me engaged
Each stage feels satisfying, and I never felt it was "I've already won, I just have to grind for 5 more turns."
Good price point for a nice casual game
Offline works fine

Cons
The skill trees are relatively diverse, but I sometimes question if there's any real benefit or consequence to picking X vs Y first.

Overall, happy with the spend and eager to get more time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291387212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1501644879}
review:
这是一个桌面游戏，玩家扮演盗贼在城市里一边试图建立工会，一边和其它盗贼竞争。用孤儿渗透城市获得资源，用恶棍阻碍对方发展，建立帮派来帮自己抢夺地盘，雇佣炸弹手来守护建筑或者探索地图，雇佣孤儿院长来驱逐对方的孤儿，雇佣姐妹会的刺客来消灭目标。获得胜利的方法是集攒数量不定的胜利点，贿赂官员，暗杀权贵，或让孤儿偷听他人的忏悔来勒索她们都是赢取胜利点的方法。部分地图还有特殊的胜利方法。游戏难度上手不高，过了教程就能会个大半。
画风方面相当不错，可爱的画风带着些精致，好比在恶棍加入帮派后人数的添加，或是驱逐敌方孤儿时的动画都很精致。
看了谜之声直播的举起你们的双手(。・`ω´・)/

author: {'steamid': '76561197985305325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1500279105}
review:
STEAMCHART 13 PLAYER 24 HOUR PEAK...RIP SHOULDA BEEN OPEN TO FEEDBACK

This is a 1v1 "competitive" board game. With no real online community to play with. As of now only about 10% of players who played the game have won an online match only 1% stuck around long enough to win 10.

The strategy and gameplay lack any real depth. Its a very simple game and one that is not balanced or adjusted for competitive play. The biggest problem is this game has very few options for "strategies" and even fewer instances of weighing pros and cons and making decisions.


It seems like "rank" is just flat wins so 10W 100L is the same same as 10W 0L 

The only guide on the game reads regarding one of the limited maps in the matchmaking pool:

"The first guard should spawn on the first players second turn. Giving them the gang advantage and the ability to bully from the start, because of the close proximity of the guilds. First turn player also has the benefit of spawning and naturally scouting tiles that gives access to 2-3 blocks without going out of their way. "

Here we see just one of the many examples of bizarre game design decisions for a competive 1v1 board game.

To start you should balance the maps, in a stalemate dont let random event decide the winner, rank needs to be + for wins - for losses not just how many wins. 

Balance random maps like having some special buildings not start right next to either player but instead tend toward the neutral zone. 

You need to think hard and come up with a way to make the game fun to play. The cascade of who gets the first slay that sorta just keeps playing out in an endless exchange is anathema to fun. A stop gap fix is to reduce animation time and then look at fundemental design choices and see what you can do.

Another option would be to up the number of players and pitch it less as a competitive game and more as a party and political board game. Id still shorten animations if you went this route and fix the endgame but it could be a quick way to solve many of the other issues the game has.
developer_response:
On July 17 (the day this review was written), we had 450 "Live Match" games between 921 players. We had 240 "Casual Match" (our asynchronous, play-by-mail multiplayer mode) games between 490 players.

Regardless of playtime, we welcome player opinions on game design, balance, aesthetics, etc. But - while there's not much we can do about comments like "there's no online community to speak of" -  it's frustrating and confusing to read stuff like this when it's quite obviously not the case.

Antihero isn't a gigantic game; we'll never have Call of Duty multiplayer numbers. But in the 10 days we've been live, we've had thousands of players in multiplayer, and thousands more playing singleplayer.

In case this was a misunderstanding, and you simply had trouble getting online, please feel free to post here, or email me directly at bugs@antihero-game.com and I can help you out.

Thanks,
Tim

author: {'steamid': '76561198024989991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1500614980}
review: Great atmosphere and clever gameplay. Looking forward to the board game version :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002374329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1565973510}
review:
The game really resembles a board game in it's mechanics. 
The Campaign itself can be finished in 4 hours easily and is quite nice, but rather simplistic in it's story.
If you want it purely for singleplayer I would say there are games out there with more value for that price (€ 15,-). 

If you enjoy board games in general and the theme of this game in particular it shines though.
Great entertainment and well worth the asking price if you are going to play it's online multiplayer.
There is matchmaking, so no manual server select is necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982800561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1503881250}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987658658', 'num_games_owned': 1431, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1500114362}
review:
https://youtu.be/iJftOerMuI8

Bonjour les voleurs de placenta dégeulasse et immoraux, aujourd’hui, on va parler de AntiHero, le nouveau jeu de société sur PC. C’est la dernière mode en ce moment, faire des jeux de société uniquement sur PC.
On joue donc une bande de voleur sur un plateau qui représente un quartier de la ville de nuit.

Heureusement, l’ambiance musicale compense un peu la sombritude du plateau de jeu.
Pour le jeu, les équipes doivent remplir certaines conditions pour recevoir des points de victoires (tuer certaines cibles, occuper les Eglises, occuper les lieux spéciaux, acheter des pots de vins). Pour réussir, il va falloir utiliser différents personnages aux compétences totalement différentes et complémentaires : le voleur cambriole pour l’or, scan les cases inconnues, les orphelins occupent les bâtiments qui vous rapportent des ressources, les gangs s’occupent des adversaires,…
Oui, effectivement, expliquer un jeu de société c’est chaud mais retenez que ce jeu se base sur les points de mouvements, sur la tactique et sur la compétition, il faut empêcher l’adversaire de remplir les points de victoire, tout en remplissant les siens. 
Bloquer l’entrée des bâtiments importants grâce aux saboteurs, cambrioler un lieu important avant son adversaire,…, c’est vraiment un jeu de pute.

Je regrette que le jeu manque d’événements aléatoires, si ce n’est les cibles d’assassinats qui apparaissent en random, il n’y a aucun élément « surprise » qui apparait pendant la partie, c’est donc un jeu de société qui laisse toute la place à la tactique, stratégie, aucun élément aléatoire ne viendra perturber votre plan, si ce n’est les mouvements des unités neutres sur le plateau.

Donc, pour en revenir au jeu, il y a un mode multi (pas vraiment peuplé), un mode solo (campagne, skirmish) qui vaut le coup, l’IA étant plutôt cohérente et efficace, particulièrement dans la campagne, je soupçonne d’ailleurs un peu de triche, j’ai été surpris par certaines décisions plutôt intelligente.

Je ne vais pas rentrer dans les détails, sachez que je trouve le jeu plutôt agréable, riche en possibilités tactiques et en comportements de putassiers.

Je préfère le design de gremlins inc ou le côté un peu aléatoire d’Armello et son excellente direction artistique. Une bonne pioche si vous êtes fan de jeu de société sur PC, à tester avec des amis si vous en avez et même si vous n'en avez pas, c'est un jeu très sympa à découvrir grâce à de nombreuses mécaniques de gameplay, un cotexte et une direction  artistique originaux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075373216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2724, 'last_played': 1523025187}
review:
I bought into first access  so I have been following and playing this game for a long time.

An interactive turn-based strategy board game. You play one on one vs a real or AI opponent. The entire map is fogged so you are unable to initially see what your opponent is doing. You start with a master thief. You use that thief to scout the map (remove the fog) and steal one of two resources (gold or lanterns) from buildings. Lanterns enable you to upgrade your thiefs abilities, with 3 talent trees to chose from, and unlock units. Gold allows you to purchase unlocked units. Units interact with the board in special ways to benefit you or hinder your opponent. There are special buildings on the map which once controlled, can generate resources, reduce unit costs and give other unit benefits. Ultimately the goal is to gain enough control of the board's special buildings to amass enough resources to earn 5/6 victory points. Vicotry points can be bribes (purchased with lanterns), contract kills (NPC's murdered by your master thief or another unit), blackmail (earned by gaining full control of a church (an aformentioned special building)), or through specialised map specific win conditions.

THE POSITIVES
- Has a single player campaign (4 hoursish) which does a good job of teaching the games mechanics and contains a decent story as well.
- Good voice acting and music.
- Great art style (I find it very Don't Starve).
- The game is well balanced.
- Different play styles are viable and the best players alter their strategy in game based on their opponents and RNG elements (NPC spawns, building spawns etc.)
- Has a number of different maps which varies gameplay.
- Options for live play (one constant game) or casual play (no turn timers, players can take their turn and log out while their opponent plays).
- A basic ranking system exists.
- Short wait times for games, never had to wait more than a couple of minutes.
- A very friendly development team that is active in the community.
- A charming game that you can tell was a labour of love.

Overall a game that is simple to understand and hard to master. After completing the campaign (4ish hours) most people should understand all the games mechanics. However, since the game has come to steam I have played 5 minute games against newer oppoents and hour long games against experienced opponents. The game contains lots of depth with each player trying to maximise turn efficiency and slight errors allowing the game to swing in an instant. 

THE NEGATIVES
- The ranking system is currently based on wins and nothing else, losses are not taken into account, hopefully will be changed in the future.
- The campaign isn't long enough to justify the price if mutliplayer does not interest you.
- Although rare, and good players will be able to adapt in most situations, there is the potential to get unfavourable RNG which can make winning more difficult. It won't cause you to flat out lose like in card games but it can certainly be a factor at times. 

CONCLUSION
If you are a fan of strategy games, board games, multiplayer games or any combination of those you will probably enjoy this game, as it is a well executed game that incorporates all of those aspects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367668617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1682527243}
review:
Gioco indie piacevole e accattivante, con una grafica simpatica e che ricorda a tratti Don't Starve.
Il gameplay è intuitivo, ma richiede una buona capacità strategica per pianificare la propria economia e i contrattacchi, cercando di prevenire contemporaneamente le mosse dell'avversario.
Questo rende alcuni match sorprendentemente facili da vincere e altri infinitamente ostici (come una partita a scacchi, dove devi pensare 5 mosse avanti all'avversario... oppure fregarlo subito con il barbiere se non se lo aspetta XD)

La campagna contro la AI sembra semplice in modalità normale, ma diventa un incubo quando la si prova in hard: solo i veri strateghi possono farcela, visto che ogni partita è diversa e l'AI non si ripete mai.

In breve: accattivante graficamente, con livelli di sfida proporzionati e molteplici possibilità di studiarsi una tattica di attacco, difesa e albero delle abilità.
Promosso!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028292142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1500195718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027954343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1500172207}
review:
I just cannot recommend this game.

Sure, the "Gangs of New York" + "Oliver Twist" theme is nice and the campaign provides 10 varied levels, BUT it's a problem of value for your money. If you can get it for 5$ or less, then yeah, maybe, but otherwise there are infinitely better strategy games out there.

I finished the campaign in 4 hours, and these 4 hours felt longer than they should have been. This is in part because the game's animations and sequence of events are artificially long, but mostly because [b]the gameplay severely lacks depth[/b]. After the first 3-4 levels (out of 10), I had enough mastery over the simple systems that finishing a level was just a matter of going through the motions and waiting for the predictible conclusion. It is quite easy to figure out what to do and which options are the best. There is not much granularity in gameplay, not a lot of small decisions that can make a difference down the line. I can't imagine different players using very different routes to victory. And you can feel that from the get-go, with a tutorial that does not allow the player to develop his style or experiment.

After finishing the campaign, the game wants you to play online versus real opponents, but frankly, I cannot see how online play might take off. The depth is just not there for a strategy game, and I don't know how most games will avoid degenerating into mirror matches with no obvious way out of the inevitable stalemate. I'm not bothering to find out, anyways.

Another unfortunate aspect of this game is the lack of thematic coherence. The promise of backstabbing, assassinating and blackmailing does not translate into anything at all. These are just words and images glued over game mechanics that have nothing to do with them. There is no stealth, no guild member management, no lies, no scheming ... nothing that you would expect from a game that sells a thieve's guild fantasy. Gameplay-wise, the game is an abstract resource management game with a very simple combat system, all rolled into a 1v1 turn-based strategy structure.  It feels like the art department wanted to do a thieves guild game, while the game design guys decided they wanted 30-minute strategy duels. Not to mention the music which absolutely does not fit the theme whatsoever (although it's a nice music if you like Pachelbel's Canon, which I think it is based on). What a mix ...

Now this game is not all bad. The art is competent, there are no noteworthy technical issues (in the off-line campaign at least), the devs put a very nice effort into varying the gameplay across levels, the learning curve is smooth. A shame that the pros get overshadowed by the cons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025516042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1528438040}
