author: {'steamid': '76561198255387141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1500843172}
review:
I really liked this game! It's not the sort of game that I'd typically play, but after watching an LP series on youtube for it, I was hooked.

The normal difficulty level is just right for me. I'm not the best at strategy & I have lost a few matches, but I am pretty comfortable with this game. I love how adaptive the gameplay is! 

Art and Graphics are very nice. The steampunky Victorian style and setting is also pretty cool. 

The single-player campaign is a bit short at the moment, but it is interesting and well-written. I hope the devs add onto this in the future. The game is still very much worth the $15 regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054043322', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1500142878}
review:
Alright. This is a board game for PC - nothing more, nothing less. 
I played through the singleplayer campaign in four hours on normal, then tried some multiplayer.
I love it cause it's a perfect weekend afternoon killer which I'll probably play casually ten times a month and enjoy it.
It's not trying to be more than it is, it's not overly complex or too simple -- it's just right.

I went in with the mindset that I probably won't like it (I ain't good at strategy games so I was scared), and that I could refund it after I see it's not for me.... 5 hours in one sitting :D

I'll probably get this on my tablet once the Android version comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997220044', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1640096509}
review:
Petit jeu aux allures de jeu de plateau très sympa aussi bien visuellement qu'avec son gameplay.
Les parties sont assez rapides et demandent un minimum de stratégie pour vaincre son adversaire (l'AI en difficulté élevée ne fait pas de cadeau).
Avec un mode online et des escarmouches contre l'ordi ou contre un autre joueur en local les joueurs sont servis.
Une petite campagne qui nous apprend progressivement les subtilités du jeu.

Ce que j'aimerais voir en plus:
- un mode à 3 ou 4 joueurs qui permettrait plus de confrontations voire la possibilité d'alliance?
- plus de pnj à acheter et d'autres compétences.

Bref un bon petit jeu déjà en l'état qui avec plus de contenu sera encore plus jouissif.
A acheter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056681931', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1564837499}
review:
Игра, в которой можно в качестве своего персонажа выбрать ТоталБисквита или Джесси Кокса (если знать специальные коды - фигурировали на записях их стримов и, может быть, где-то еще). Занятно, что когда я ее приобретал, я не знал об этом - такой вот был сюрприз. А теперь, о менее важных деталях...

Занимательная цифровая настолка, представляющая из себя непродолжительную пошаговую стретегическую дуэль двух игроков. Насколько я понимаю - порт с планшетов, и порой это заметно, хотя никаких особо вопиющих технических проблем у игры нет. Лично мне она немного напомнила концепцией старенькую "Чикаго: Дон Капоне", известную также как "Legal Crime" - только тут геймплей пошаговый, все чуть более камерное, а антураж представляет собой викторианский Лондон, а не Америку времен сухого закона. Ну и, справедливости ради, "Чикаго" помнят разве что за выдержанную стилистику, а вот Антигерой в целом демонстрирует достаточно приятный стратегический геймплей.

Здесь мы выступаем в роли главы воровской гильдии на улицах Лондона. Наша деятельность в качестве воровской гильдии напоминает не столько варианты из всевозможных фэнтезийных РПГ, сколько деятельность Фейгина из "Оливера Твиста" или мадам Осьминог из "Города потерянных детей". Хотя бы потому что, да, наша основная "рабочая лошадка" - это уличные беспризорники. Разумеется, под нашим началом имеется множество разнообразных бандюков - от обычных головорезов, до элитных убийц a-la Dishonored. Нет, разве что, только проституток - уж не знаю, к добру или к худу. Но основу нашей деятельности будут обеспечивать именно беспризорники. В основном мы внедряем их в те или иные разбросанные по карте здания, вроде торговых домов, банков или церквей. Предприятия, в которые мы таким образом внедрились будут каждый ход приносить нам определенный доход или давать некие преимущества. Ресурсов в игре всего два - деньги, которые нужны для найма подчиненных, и лампы, которые выполняют функцию "очков исследования", позволяя открывать всевозможные апгрейды и доступ к новым юнитам. В некоторых случаях внедрять своих беспризорников необходимо и для получения победных очков. Собственно, задача каждой партии - набрать нужное число победных очков любого типа, а типы у них бывают различные - в основном взятки (которые можно купить за лампы - этакая научная победа), успешно выполненные заказные убийства (цели периодически появляются на карте) и материал для шантажа (появляется путем внедрения максимального числа беспризорников в церковь... понимайте как хотите). Плюс, на разных картах имеются дополнительные способы заработать победные очки, этакие бонусные миссии.

Вообще, игра, не смотря на общую камерность, имеет некоторый уровень стратегической глубины. Для начала - здесь очень мало чего отдано на волю рандома - только, пожалуй что, карта района, где проходит партия, да и то, имеются и некоторые неизменные константы (начинаете вы всегда рядом с торговым домом, который необходим для получения ламп и, соответственно, прокачки своей гильдии). Далее, каждый тип наших юнитов (включая нашего собственного центрального персонажа, без предварительной разведки которого остальные бандиты не могут ничего делать) уникален, имеет свои специфические функции и правила применения: кто-то остается на карте все время, кто-то появляется только во время нашего хода, кто-то свободен в перемещениях по доске, кто-то - ограничен, кто-то способен прокачиваться по мере выполнения заданий, кто-то - одноразовый персонаж, исчезающий после использования. В этом плане стоит упомянуть обучение - оно проходит в первых миссиях одиночной кампании, и оно отнюдь не бесполезно, поскольку дает нам успешное представление об основах игровой механики, но... Все же очень много вопросов и нюансов игроку предстоит выяснить самостоятельно. В основном преимущественно потому, что правила для каждого отдельного юнита свои. В общем, обучение с базовой задачей справляется, но при этом оставляет без внимания кучу мелких, но, как выясняется, достаточно важных для игрового процесса вещей без внимания.

Что хорошо - это то, что одиночная кампания не ограничивается одним лишь обучением, не смотря на то, что игра явно рассчитана прежде всего на дуэли с живыми соперниками. Главы конкурирующих гильдий, с которыми мы поочередной сталкиваемся по мере продвижения по кампании, различаются в плане предпочитаемых тактик, плюс нас знакомят с различными игровыми "полями", на каждом из которых есть свои специфические правила, с бонусными целями. Продолжительной одиночную кампанию не назовешь, но совсем уж куцой - тоже. Сюжет, правда, наличествует чисто номинально - он есть, но предсказуем донельзя и подается максимально схематично. Общая суть в том, что мы - меньшее из зол в насквозь прогнившем Лондоне и потому методично устраняем наиболее отмороженных конкурентов.

Что до стилистики - она довольно-таки приятна. Рисовка весьма колоритная, многие вещи подаются с "юмором висельников", и в добавок игра содержит в себе приличное число отсылок к произведениям про викторианскую Англию и/или криминал.

Мультиплеер, кстати, предусматривает возможность хотсита, если для кого-то это важно. А так, что опять же примечательно, матч может проходить как в один короткий присест, так и продолжаться несколько дней - от игроков не требуется постоянно быть онлайн, они могут покинуть игру в любой момент, а когда они вернутся и сделают свой ход, противнику придет уведомление об этом на почту. Давненько я не видел подобной функции в цифровых настолках, признаться. Отчасти это радует, хотя, я подозреваю, не всем нравится подобный темп игры, напоминающий шахматы по переписке.

Вещь отнюдь не сногсшибательная, но все же очень приятная для своей ниши.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975577243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1499719924}
review: I played the game in it's beta phase and am glad to see it released. It's a fun little game where you can play against each other on a small field to outsmart each other. I really like the 'play-by-mail' feature such that you can have several games and do one turn a day. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069391437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1501468046}
review: Couple hours in and I didn't want to wait to leave this a positive review because I've been enjoying it so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989589295', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1504577868}
review:
Eight hours in I can safely say this is one of my favorite games of 2017 so far and a great surprise.  I love the fact that the maps are like boardgame boards, that the strategic options are meaningful and deep, that the setting seems fresh (i.e. no elves and orcs), that games can be played relatively quickly, that there is asynch MP, that the AI is strong, at least for me.

And also, it plays really well on my 5-year laptop, so a great travel game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031060209', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1500073986}
review: This game is far more fun than I thought it would be.  If you like strategy games or being a backstabbing thief this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014853241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1500352571}
review:
Unexpectedly good, the campaign mode is fun and challenging :)

In single player campaign mode, you played as a thief to survive plundering golds from buildings, art ,diamond from the riches, infltrate rich man's party for treasures... at the same time, face the challenge from rival thiefs who try to wrestle the town from you, outsmart you, trick you and outnumber you... 

3 tech tree allow you to invest your 'savings' into different abilities, moves, access to different allies or techniques... 

I recommend everyone who like RPG and Strategy to play this game... game can last from 10 mins to an hour depending on the challenge mode you select... online/multiplayer will varies but the map is so far limit to few so overtime you will want to play with AI or online with real players to have fun :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026988769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1500100569}
review: An important clue that a game is good? That it's fun even when you're losing at it. Antihero is so great, you'll have a ball even as you're learning the ropes and having skilled players (or savvy AI) kick your butt. Seriously - this is one of the most unique, fun, cool-looking games I've played in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311146049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1588725776}
review:
Overall I'd give the game 6/10, The Main issue is the single player mode truthfully is just an in depth tutorial, that explores each aspect of the game individually. The Game itself has it's own atmosphere which is a beautiful blend of dark and goofy, with the characters being very original with their own personalities, which are expressed very easily. Game-play by itself warrants a 9/10 playing the game felt smooth, and the mechanics are fresh and creative, the only caveat is i feel there is plenty of space for further growth into further forms of game-play, where exactly i am not entirely sure but based on how unique this game was i am sure the dev's are up to the task if it comes to that. I have played a few multiplayer games now and found a common theme, people that are playing the game at the current moment try to jump into multiplayer without knowing the intricacies of the varying strategies and being someone who has mostly mastered this game i feels unfair, and the opponent will often quit after realizing i am way ahead. The game is worth buying even if only to play multiplayer.

Quick Tips: your economy is the most important thing early game, the game always starts you right next to a source of lamps and you should spend as many actions as necessary to take it first thing. then attempt to find a source of gold, as an early source of income (such as an upgraded bank) can assure you victory.

Don't forget certain points can be fought over, like the bribe; it's worth getting early because then your opponent can't get the first one requiring a larger pool of resources to gain the 2nd one putting them farther behind.

Try to focus on two or three sources of income, because if you take the time to build them they are attractive weak points to attack wasting your resources to keep retaking them

author: {'steamid': '76561198002517043', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1500060755}
review:
[h1]TL; DR: Nice turn- based digital board game with fitting art style; 7.0 / 10[/h1]
[list]
[*]  Singleplayer:  
If you buy it for SP you might want to wait on a sale, as I do not think it is worth the price atm. (it serves as tutorial)
[*] Multiplayer:
MP can be fun with friends, but seems quite repetetive and in the long run, uninteresting to me. Has leaderboards.
FFA and 2v2 planned for the future.
[/list]

[b]Wait on steam christmas sale. It will be cheaper and more content rich by then.[/b]



[u]To give you an overview: [/u]

This game is basically a singleplayer / multiplayer turn- based board game with fog of war.
The graphics are charming, the art style consistent and sound and music fit the theme nicely. It supports 21:9,  though the UI does not make use of it much and some people complain about resolution proplems. Devs are looking into that atm of this review. 
If you play on multiple devices, be aware that the game has no cloud save. Your save files are hidden well in %appdata% under "com.timconkling.aciv"

[b]Single Player:[/b]
The single player campaign is an extended tutorial across 10 levels that tells a side story that you will not be able to remember in a week from now.
When you start the game, it seems that it has lots of depth and choices, but after 2 hours you have basically seen almost all the game has to offer.
Campaign is fun, but nothing breath taking. You need to be aware of your early game choices so you do not fall behind and from there build on your strategy. 

For me, there are not a lot of winning conditions, as most of your choices are quite connected: establish a well rounded economy and play aggressive. That's it.


[b]Multiplayer:[/b]
You can play games asynchronous, like in Frozen Synapse, where you do a turn and then your enemy does his, when he has time. You can receive a notification in order to see that your turn is up, which is nice. Or you play in a real time environment, where you have to watch your enemies moves, which I guess, might be a little tiresome after a while.

I can see this game as a substitute for playing board games with friends, when you all live apart. Or maybe you enjoy competing on leaderboards. Given the simple nature of the game and its indie origin, I doubt that many people will compete, though.

2v2 and FFA game modes are planned for the future, as well as new maps.

I can see the game get quite repetetive in the long run. 


[u][b]Conclusion:[/b][/u]
Wether or not this game is a recommendation for you, depends on how much you enjoy the multiplayer part. I will give it a recommendation, as I can see that the devs put a lot of love into it, but I would wait for a sale. Right now I would say, this game is above average but still not great.

Hope this helped you to have an overview.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392232053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1500343172}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971182724', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1500118450}
review:
"A rather superb single and multiplayer turn-based strategy game for the discerning gamer, in which you outsmart and out-steal your opponents. Indulge in a little bribery, blackmail, and assassination to rise to the top!" - With this, the game of Antihero is introduced on the website. Bribery, blackmail and assassination, combined with a wonderful art style, make this a must get, isn't it? Well, here is my impression!
 
Installation of the game over Steam goes swiftly and a few minutes after clicking the install button, the game is ready to play. It takes up about 125 megabytes of your storage - almost impossible to believe in days where a patch of your regular run-of-of-the-mill game can easily come at a gigabyte or two. Then again, this is not [i]just[/i] a game, is it?

Firing up the game, it presents itself in windowed mode, which is quickly changed in the setting to get the full-screen experience. The settings panel is very light - it allows you to set audio levels, graphics resolution and there is a full-screen toggle and that is about it. No complex key-mappings, controller support or other complex settings. Very minimalist, so I can quickly focus on the game itself.


Your goal in the game is to guide a master thief to achieve supremacy over a town by scoring victory points. There are various methods to earn those points: you may assassinate targets, blackmail city officials or use some other tactic. You are not the only master thief trying to do this, so there is a scoring system where you can see who has more points. Whoever reaches the required amount of victory points first, wins.

The game can be played in the single-user campaign, where you battle your way through various parts of the city, following an superbly narrated story line. The early missions, called chapters, are focused on teaching the game mechanics, with increasingly difficult tasks. The later chapters expect that you know what you are doing and give you access to more resources, while also increasing the complexity of the task at hand.


You start a chapter by scouting the city around you with your master thief. If the opportunity offers itself, you may visit a house or two and collect gold or lanterns, the two currencies in the game. Those currencies can be used to either upgrade the skills and abilities of your thieves guild, or to hire staff into your organization. The staff to hire consists of various types, ranging from urchins to assassins. Each has a different skill set, and a rising cost. Urchins are for example used to infiltrate buildings, giving you specific advantages. An assassin can take out most of the hostile characters in one turn, but disappears after that. Managing the two currencies in the game, coins and lanterns, is key to winning the game.

The game consists of various chapters with increasing difficulty, different objectives and a range of characters that you meet. While the early chapters tend to be finished after a few minutes, later chapters take increasingly more time. The difficulty setting is an obvious factor in the duration of the chapter.


With the description of the game done, we now turn our attention to our impressions of the various aspects of the game:
[list]
[*]Graphics: due to the nature of the game, you should not expect cutting-edge complex graphics where you have to fiddle around with settings like FXAA, tripple-buffering and v-synch and other complex things. Instead, you are greeted by a refreshing comic-like drawing style, which makes the game look very slick. The art style is used consistently throughout the game - as far as we have been playing it.
[*]Audio: the character sounds are suiting to the characters, and repeatedly clicking a character may bring up another sound. Maybe not like in the original Warcraft ("Don't you have a kingdom to run" - anyone remember that?), but good enough to offer some variety. The music track sets the mood of the game: I feel like I'm in Victorian England where I burgle my way around the city. That feeling is underlined even more by the narrative. It is a masterpiece in itself. I wish that I can have the whole story told to me in one go after I finish the game, so I can enjoy that part once more.
[*]Game play: even when not an expert at this kind of turn-based games, it was a very pleasant introduction into this genre. Through the combination of slick graphics, fitting sound, amazing narrative and the step-by-step increase in complexity, I felt at home very quickly. The style and atmosphere were very enjoyable, and I see this be a game that I will be playing from begin to end - a rare feat for someone with an 11% completion rate of his Steam library.

[b]Conclusion[/b]: Antihero is a very pleasant game where you can easily sink in several hours to complete the story line. After that, you can jump online to bribe and assassinate your way to the top. Solid game play, combined with excellent graphics and audio makes this highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052548415', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1500211416}
review:
Antihero is a really good game.
I only played the Single-Player, because I don't like playing such games against other players I don't know.
But the campaign is pretty fun!

The maps are made with a lot of love and the characters have a lot of details.
Every character looks different and has its own style.

All in all I would give the game 7/10, as the campaign is very short.

review: 简单有趣的小游戏。故事紧凑，只需几小时即可全部通关，适合闲暇时间来玩。期待推出更多新的地图和胜利模式。没有中文可能阻碍了不少中国玩家，也希望早日推出中文版本吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030893104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1499990067}
review:
Let me start out by saying that overall I like this game.  I love the artwork.  The gameplay is easy to understand yet wonderfully well made. 

However, there isn't enough diversity. There isn't enough content for single player.  Leveling up only matters in which order you do it in depending on what is happening on the board.  

This game was clearly made with multiplayer in mind and so the single player mode suffers heavily for it.  Certainly in a multiplayer game mode, everything being equal means that it will lead to a wonderful skirmish once the two sides meet. 

 https://youtu.be/THQpUHL7oBk

A guarded recommendation - this game is still good enough to purchase at a discount.  If you're not in it to play for multiplayer, then you'll finish the game easily within a few hours and move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035760379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1500005294}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127562758', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1517849469}
review:
Mi è piaciuto molto questo gioco, molto strategico. Contiene degli elementi randomici, ma sono pochi e non vanno a rovinare il gioco, rendendolo tutto basato sul caso, anzi, rendendo ogni partita diversa e più interessante.
A livello di gameplay quindi è molto bello, anche la grafica e le musiche sono carine.

Il problema di questo gioco secondo me sta nel fatto che sia un po' piatto. Mi spiego meglio, le partite online, sono solo partite online, non ci sono premi, non c'è una classifica, non c'è niente di niente ad eccezione del gioco stesso. 
Alla lunga quindi, diventa noioso.
Mi aspetto dai Dev che creino perlomeno un sistema di classifica o di elo nei prossimi aggiornamenti.

Purtroppo non mi sento più di consigliare questo gioco, avevo dato il pollice in su inizialmente, ma ho dovuto dare il voto negativo per il semplice fatto che non gioca nessuno, in media devo aspettare 12 minuti per trovare un singolo avversario, non esiste.
Peccato era un bel gioco, ma ci gica troppa poca gente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033177487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1666017831}
review:
TL:DR This is a great turn based strategy game with a flavorful setting. You're a thief running a thieves guild and trying to own the town! Feels like a board game but utilises nifty computer things like Fog of War to enhance the experience.

In Antihero you play as a thieves guild master trying to own the town. There are multiple gamemodes which will make you think twice about how to play the game. It is a turn based strategy game with multiple paths to victory. Will you kill your way to the top? Perhaps you will blackmail officials to be the master of the town....or will you bribe your way to victory?

In Antihero you go about this in several ways with several characters. Your master thief is the character you will be giving most orders. He will scout for you and burgle houses/estates for currency. Your street urchins will infiltrate buildings to give you more influence (mechanic wise it will give you more currencies to spend). In the game you have gold to hire characters and lanterns for upgrades. There are 3 different upgrade paths for you to choose to customise your playstyle.

Is this game any good? Currently there isn't a giant campaign but the 11 missions or so do a terrific job of explaibning the various gameplay mechanics of maps and different characters. There are multiple master thief skins for you to choose in online mode and the 4 different map modes will keep you on your toes in online matches.

The developers seem really active on the steam disccusion forum and there is a roadmap that shows they are exploring the ideas of more maps, more unique map mechanics, a 2v2 or Free for all mode (as there is currently only 1v1 for PvP). 

The game is great in its current state and it can only grow from here on out. My suggestion? Get it now! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044918812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1500040325}
review:
Really good game. The campaign is kinda short (will keep you busy like 3 or 4 hours probably), but the online mode is amazing. Games are relatively short for a turn based strategy game (about an hour) while not diminishing the strategic value at all. Asynchronous play is also available so you can just play every now and then to take 1 turn and then the other player goes, you get emailed (you can turn this off) when it's your turn. 
Amazing visuals, supportive devs that are still working on the game to push some more features!

This is a must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977000498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1499910016}
review: I'm just beginning to scratch the surface with Antihero gameplay strategy -- understanding the different characters and how to use them together, adapting my playing style depending on the map, etc. -- but already I think it's a great game. Everything about its presentation shows a unique style and attention to detail. I'm excited to delve deeper, complete the campaign, and play a lot more multiplayer. I'm not traditionally a 4X strategy player, but I love that you can complete a match "live" in about half an hour, or take your time to strategize if you're playing an opponent asynchronously. Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030812491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1501677828}
review:
An addicting game. It offers an online mode which you take turns with the other person. In Casual or Live They email you once its your turn. The game is really easy to learn. I spent most of my time playing online in first few minutes I bought it. 

 You can play several games at once than make a move once your rival has made a move. You are then allowed to take another turn. In Live Match you can both play online at the same time without taking a break. It offers both casual and harder mode. The cartoon graphics are polished. 

The game is really easy to get lost into it. I'll know more the longer I play it. 


 So far a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258829304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1499952142}
review:
Awesome turn-based strategy game.  I'm just getting started and already loving it.  This game will keep you on your feet - offensive and defensive strategy, several different ways to win, and some interesting choices to make around the skill tree.  Lots of depth to explore and room for personal playstyles.  This game game will delight your eyes and ears and make you use your brain.  If starcraft stresses you out, then turn-based is for you.  Well worth $15.

Also another reviewer nailed it in saying this is what's been missing from Steam.  Asynchronous multiplayer that's as casual (see the different game modes) or as deep as you want it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117399205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1500514507}
review:
Hi all, full disclosure: I'm a friend of the dev so take with a grain of salt, but I still think it's worth pointing out that this game is quirky, fun, and visually attractive.  The basics are simple enough to get down within a single game yet there are tons of ways to progress toward a win while blocking your opponent's efforts.  There are many potential win conditions so you can't ever quite be sure what your opponent is working toward (and vice versa).  A game that seems to be going nowhere can suddenly end with one skillful turn.  Good fun.  Like anything with a 4x bent, you need to stay on top of your economics, monopolize the map, and get those victory points before your opponent does.

Buy it.  Do it.  This game was clearly made with tons of love and I doubt you'll be disappointed.  Support indie awesomeness and buy this game! I sat down to play for 5 minutes last night and looked up an hour and a half later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993717768', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 6084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1686989575}
review:
Note: I played the First Access version through itch.io before it was available on Steam.

Some 100+ hours later, I'm still hooked on Antihero--and that's before tackling the single-player campaign.

I'm not here to explain the game's mechanics, but I am here to say that it's a tersely designed bite-sized turn-based strategy boardgame that's as devilishly simple and smart as it is deep and dapper. The multiplayer is worth the price of admission alone but the campaign is shaping up to be a great primer and a treat in itself.

It's also worth noting that you can play multiplayer games locally (hotseat) or online, live or asynchronously (meaning that you don't need to be online at the same time as your opponent; when they take their turn, you'll get a notification saying to login and take yours).

Async multiplayer is a really great way of squeezing in some quality gaming if you're strapped for time. Here you only have a limited number of actions per turn and each one is critical to your success so while you could take your turn in seconds, it pays to mull over your options!

Antihero will undoubtedly be one of my games of the year and I think it'd be a crime [i]not[/i] to snatch this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996889641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1579458888}
review:
TLDR - Great game. Some randomness, but it's in there for all the right reasons. Multiple routes to victory minimize late game slog and take great advantage of the aforementioned randomness. 

I don't know why TLDRs are always at the end of the wall of text. 

Looks like most of the negative reviews are due to the randomness in the game and some games reaching a stalemate. Both comments have some legitimacy, but neither remotely warrant a negative review of what I believe is a terrific game. 

Randomness - Yes, there is some asymmetry due to random locations and random NPCs. Yes, this can cost you a win every once in a while. However, the randomness is much less than many games, and you are given many ways to take advantage of the board you are on. Without this level of randomness, you would lose the exhilaration of adapting your strategy on the fly and sneak out a win from a desperate situation.

Stalemates - Yes, in part due to randomly generated boards, games can sometimes reach a "stalemate" situation, but these really should be the exception. I likely played 100 games before the release on Steam. Only a few reached any sort of stalemate. Generally, those were the ones where I was playing a less experienced player, and didn't get a great board layout. They should have won earlier, but they didn't see the win and the game got dragged out into something of a slog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053706354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1500320880}
review:
Great game to play. Challenging at times but a lot of fun non the less.

+ Great artwork
+ Nice music
+ Interesting story
+ Fun characters to use
+ Challenging at times

The game is all about strategy. I have only played the campaign so far but I'm having a lot of fun. There is a problem with 1 level, but the devs are going to look at it and tweak it were necesarry. The level is NOT BROKEN but just slightly to difficult on normal and hard.

Really looking forward to future expensions. Would love to see more story or the ability to choose different master thiefs while playing a story campaign.  

Just try it. If you don't like it you can always refund it. You can also watch playthroughs on Youtube. You will not be disapointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1499807040}
review:
I'm in the airport right now, trying to find an outlet so I can play more Antihero on my flight.
It's super easy to get into, difficulty ramps well, and I quickly rediscovered the "one more turn" feeling I remember from growing up playing Civilization.
I'm admittedly a casual gamer these days, and I've only been in campaign mode so far, but I've been having a great time.
Seems like it will translate seamlessly to mobile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009926281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1499928575}
review:
To keep it short for this game, It is the strategy game (turn-based) that you play as a leader of the thieves' guild, which you have to think and plan what to do, to kill , to steal each turn to make your way to the victory.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] Great and interest strategy game.
[*] Easy to understand and have great dept strategies in competitive play (you have to think and plan to go for economy, expand your view, upgrade your skills or simply rush for the win).
[*] That cartoon art style though :D
[*] There will be more update for this game.
[/list]
[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] The game tend to be much slower in late game. (the balance in late game is not that good as all the resource and paths are discover -> It will become staring challenge between you and your opponent  because both player have no resources to do anything, [the big heist help a little, but still not enough to make game flow properly].
[*] There is no comeback system or some thing to keep the game exciting after turn 15 (The match rely too much on early game progression (turn 1-10)) 
[*] The single player story is far too short (around 5-6 hours if you are not that bad).
[/list]

Lastly, My personal opinion -- > [u][b]BUY IT![/b][/u] If you want the [b]Good Strategy Game[/b] to play with your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077157970', 'num_games_owned': 2487, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1499837428}
review:
[h1] Antihero - Review [/h1] 

En conclusión, Antihero es una sorpresa para los juegos de estrategia por turnos, tiene unas características jugables accesibles y un estilo de juego muy dinámico que va cambiando en cada turno y lleva a plantearse nuevos interrogantes sobre como accionar en su encantador Londres victoriano. 
La duración de su campaña no excede las 4-5 horas de juego, pero hay que verlo como un tutorial prolongado con el que conocer más en detalle la jugabilidad para después ponerla a prueba en su modo Online, y este último se destaca principalmente por su versatilidad a la hora de encarar a los jugadores y la estabilidad que poseen sus sesiones en multijugador. Por último y no menos importante, la escaramuza también proporcionara una cantidad considerable de tiempo y podremos llevar al límite a la IA.  

Sin mucho más por agregar, Antihero es el juego de estrategia por excelencia para aquellos que busquen algo accesible y no tan complejo. 

[b]Para leer el analisis completo dirigirse al siguiente enlace:[/b]

[url=https://pcindiemrace.com/2017/07/12/antihero-review/] PC Indie Master Race [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197982999259', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1499231690}
review:
Antihero is a 1v1 strategy game with mechanics and presentation similar to that of a board game. You are a master thief, and it's your goal to drive your rival out of town. You do this by gathering bribes, blackmail, and assassination contracts which all translate to victory points. To accomplish this you utilize the two resources of gold and lanterns to research technology and hire urchins, thugs, gangs, and other ne'er do wells to do your dirty work. The main gameplay comes from the strategic deployment of your henchmen, their interaction with other henchmen, and how you utilize your master thief. Urchins, for example, are cheap and can infest structures to generate resources, but they are vulnerable to eviction from gangs and truant officers. These characters in turn are vulnerable to traps set by the saboteur, or straight up murder from an assassin or well armed thief. The actions of your master thief are also extremely important, as robbing buildings is a major source of income, but it's also the responsibility of your thief to scout. A major component of the game is the fog of (gang) war. Your thief must scout buildings and streets before your minions can utilize them. This is mechanically significant; watching where your opponent is scouting and tracking their footprints enables you to predict their future moves and react. Nonetheless, it can be very frustrating when your large gang of violent criminals can't make a critical move because there are some clouds in the street. Despite the game having some board game inspiration, it lacks the social aspect. The matches are only ever 1 on 1. There is a campaign mode worth several hours, but outside of that you'll be going head to head online or playing hotseat. Hotseat mode is slightly curious, considering the importance of subterfuge, secrecy, and obfuscation. Unless you and your friend take turns averting your eyes or leaving the room, half of the strategy is gone. If you're looking for a head to head strategy game, Antihero can get surprisingly complex, and comes with a charming aesthetic, similar to Don't Starve, and a decent enough soundtrack. If you were hoping to play it as a digital board game with several friends, you may be disappointed.



[url=https://youtu.be/BxnFJpmYhVk] Impressions [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030744532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1521149430}
review:
A good board game with some quality strategy!
What I love the most is the multiple ways of fulfilling goals by thievery, assassination, quest objectives etc..
The devs have managed to include much more maps in the game since the beginning.
Most of the time, given that the players are of the same lever the game would result in a stand-off, as each player hits on their opponent undoing their work.
While it sounds fun and competitive it can be somewhat tedious.
Last but not least, the AI is quite easy to beat unless you shoot for the Hard difficulty.
Is it good? Yes?
Overpriced? Sadly yes, still..
developer_response:
Thanks for checking it out, Theoloc!

Also, just a clarification for others reading: the campaign has 11 different maps, each one different (and each with a unique gameplay twist). Maps are remixed each time you play them, so no two playthroughs are identical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025044517', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1584132769}
review:
I'm really enjoying my time with this game. The art style is unique and suits the atmosphere and world that the game takes place in and the sound design compliments the atmosphere perfectly. The campaign, while not story heavy, sets up a nice context in addition to a charming and fun world which supports the mechanics used in the singleplayer and multiplayer. The gameplay is enjoyable and challenging, definitely setting the game up to be a thinking mans game.

There tends to be a slower pace to the game at the start of matches and sometimes nearing the end of particularly long ones where the players have made similar progress and get stuck racking up resources and trading units. However personally these slower moments raise the tension because you know that at any moment, your opponent could have an upper hand which they've been building towards for 10 rounds and you have to find a way to outsmart them and block them at every turn while simultaneously attempting to move forward yourself.

Also I'm hoping there will be more maps in the future, because the ones that are available currently are unique and have their own spins of the game and victory points and it would be nice to see more. Furthermore, I wish that the different player skins offered some sort of unique bonus which enhances a specific playstyle, it's a little disappointing that all they offer are visual variations to your avatar.

However regardless of it's flaws, I would definitely recommend this game if you enjoy board games and/or strategy games. Or if you enjoy using orphans as a unit.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007712873', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1499833018}
review: I wish I could recommend this game, but I can't. The game relies far too much on random chance. When you play against someone you have to choose one way to go and if it is wrong, mainly due to randomness, you have lost. For example the buildings are shrouded in fog until you scout the neighborhood, and you could get lucky and find a good building, or alternatively find a useless house or useless building. If your opponent has made a good guess then they will be at a huge adavantage that is pretty much insurmountable. There are other things like npc and loot spawns which don't follow a set pattern. This game needs to be balanced a whole lot more than it is now. There are good times where hard reads work towards your advantage but many times I find myself behind because of randomness not skill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180315319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1501016280}
review: Man ich liebe dieses Spiel. Es hat einen sehr schönen und witzigen Artstyle, sehr gute Musik und gutes Gameplay. Es ist ein rundenbasiertes Strategiespiel. Ziel ist es eine lukrative Diebesgilde aufzubauen, dabei helfen verschiedene Einheiten sowie ein Skillbaum, den man während der Runde immer weiter freischaltet, um der Konkurrenz immer einen Schritt voraus zu sein. Es hat dabei einige interessante taktische Aspekte, die Karte ist z.B. am Anfang voller Nebel und man muss einige schwierige Entscheidungen treffen. Einerseits ist das Scouten wichtig um Überblick zu verschaffen, das Ausrauben von Gebäuden bringt aber Geld. Und wehe man lässt seine Gang unbewacht stehen... gegen menschliche Gegner ist es umso interessanter, das Spiel bietet neben Kampagne und Skirmish-Mode einen Online-Modus, die KI ist leider nicht immer sehr clever. Insgesamt für aber 10 € aber ein wirklich gutes Spiel, an dem ich noch viel Freude haben werde. Für Strategieliebhaber bei dem Preis sicherlich mal einen Blick wert

author: {'steamid': '76561197998032388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1529788430}
review:
Not in a current state.
Not for a current price.


White Rabbit states:
[quote]
Antihero went through an extreeeemely extended playtesting period -- several years, in fact.
[/quote]


Or, as Myl_Erik states:
[quote]
however we have had 4 months of playtesting with over 500 players to figure out the balance and tweak it. 
[/quote]

Both are developers and I have no idea how they can, in right mind, brag about playtesting while at the same time readily admitting quality of life and balance issues with a game. And, oh boy, and are there issues.

A bit more detail:
-Soundtrack is just kinda is there. It is not horrible, it is not great. It just exists and I found that "barely audible" volume for it is most fitting setting.
-While most of the game is determenistic, where basicly anything is predictable - there is also some wild and untamed RNG there that can and will hurt you. Neutral mob and assassination targets are somewhat managable, but the game also uses RNG when drawing the map and if you have no natural income sources near you - sucks to be you. But on other hand, you can have two districts with situational high income. Or a little bit of lanterns, because type of loot and when it is available is RNG based too.
-Minor-to-medium quality life issues.
-Severe lack of singleplayer content.
-Frankly, quite shallow gameplay.

It is a neat idea, but, even if working properly, this execution is barely worth 2/3 of current price.
Also, yes it is a 1v1 virtual board game. Even if developers avoid mentioning it anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182014854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1518093598}
review:
Remek kis játék. Mindenkinek ajánlom, aki szereti a társasjátékokat (én magam nagyon, pihen is a polcomon több mint 250).

*Most hogy pár órát eltölöttem a játékkal, íme egy kicsit mélyebben. A játék nagyon élvezetes egyszemélyes kampányban. Csodás íven vezet rá a játék sava-borsára. Eleinte kicsit egysíkúnak tűnt, de kezdem már látni  a mélységét. Multiban nem próbáltam még, és egyenlőre nem is tervezem. Ugyanakkor látom benne a fantáziát, bár kicsit félő, hogy a játék vége felé azért belassulhat. De lehet tévedek. Próbáljátok ki, remek szórakozás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122972072', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1499758249}
review:
이 게임을 살까말까 고민하는 한국인들을 위한 평가 작성합니다.
7월11일에 사서 그날 7시간 넘게 했는데 전략게임 좋아하시는분들한테는 정말 추천합니다.
캠페인모드와 멀티모드가 있는데 캠페인모드는 말그대로 주어진스토리를 깨는거고 난이도는 별1~3개까지있습니다. 
깨고싶은걸 선택해서 하시면됩니다.
저는 멀티모드가 재밌더군요.
실제사람들과 하는 모드인데 실시간으로 하는 대전과 플레이를 하고싶은대로 하면서 시간날때 게임할수잇는 모드가 있습니다..
설명을 잘못하겠는데 해보시면 압니다.
순위도 있던데 승수로 등수를 가리는것같고 아직 초창기라 그렇게 높진않네요


장점보다는 단점?을 말해드릴게요. 

1. 한글화x - 한글화가 안되있어서 약간의 불편함은 있지만, 쉬운영어로 되어있어 어느정도 영어기본을 안다면 충분히 커버가능
                   또한 몇판하다보면 먼 기능인지 다알게되서 그렇게 상관은 없습니다.

2. 멀티모드의 지루함? - 한쿡인이라 그런지 상대가 늦게 턴을 종료하면 먼가 지루하고 짜증나더라고요. 이런부분은 개인마다 차이가있으니 참고하시면 좋을것같습니다.

3. 타임머신 - 시간진짜 빨리가더라고요... 혹시나 스케줄이 많으신분은 조심하셔야할것같네요


장점 안적은이유는 충분히 재미있고 설명안해도 해보시면 알거라 생각해서입니다.

고민하시는분들 이거 보시고 꼭 사셧으면 좋겟네요~(재미없으면 환불하면되니 속는셈치고 ㄱㄱ)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012983330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1499795066}
review:
I LOVE THIS GAME!

Finally something fresh in my library that had it all. Tuned, easy to learn mechanics. This game is a multiplayer style board game. You run a thieves guild vs opponents and try to take board control using a number of interesting unlocks.

The art style is similar to Don't Starve which I always loved that style.

The single player game is a lot of fun and there are serveral map variants in place to make the game not get repetitive (like freaking Armello..god. They could learn a thing or two from this developer).

So far I'm having a lot of fun and I've already gotten my value out of it. Pick it up if you want a fun, screw your friends, kind of board game experience

author: {'steamid': '76561197993537005', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1500478575}
review:
[b][u]See written review below[/u][/b] or watch it here: https://youtu.be/mEzD0QorMmo
[h1]TL;DR: SKIP TO CONCLUSION![/h1]

You play as a thief who’s battling against rival thieves and gangs to claim victory by taking control of the city. You need your wits to scout out the area, and strategize your moves each turn. The single player campaign has a bit of a story, and the objectives on each map play into it. 

In every match you’ll need to build and manage an economy. The currencies you earn are gold and lanterns. Lanterns allow you to purchase bribes for victory points, as well as purchase upgrades in your guild house. Once you unlock various skills such as urchins or gangs, you can then use gold you’ve earned to recruit more goons to use. You are limited to how many of each type of goon you can have, and some of them are only able useable once, like the assassin.

You will need to scout around the town with your master thief, and from there you can choose whether you want to blackmail the churches, burgal for jewels or gold, or fulfill assassination contracts to earn victory points. To win the game, you will need earn the required number of victory points before your opponent. You can also murder enemy gangs, and evict enemy urchins to seize control of their territory. There are sometimes mandatory objectives you’ll need to complete, while other times, the objectives are optional.

There are different maps available, and there are random factors in each game when it comes to building and enemy spawn locations. The different buildings each give unique bonuses, and having access to one type of building might make you alter your playstyle for that game slightly until you’re able to scout more and create a more diverse economy. For example, someone with an orphanage might try to expand quicker to make use of having  cheaper urchins, while someone with a tavern who can make cheaper thugs might work on buffing up their gang more.

As for the online multiplayer, there are two modes available. The first is a casual multiplayer mode. In this mode games can play out over several days, and you have as much time as you need to do each turn. In casual mode, players can choose to be notified by email when it’s their turn. 

The second multiplayer mode is a live mode. In this mode, both players are on a timer for each of their turns. Players need to think and act quickly to outwit their opponent. I do prefer the live games over the casual ones since I enjoy the faster style of gameplay, but I think the casual mode is great for keeping people coming back to the game. As for the time you are given, it feels like enough time to plan things out without it dragging on too much in between turns. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]fun, turn-based strategy gameplay with some economy management
[*]good faster-paced live multiplayer  that they can be completed in a single sitting (usually 30-45 minutes), instead of taking hours or even days like some other turn-based strategy games
[*]nice, slower-paced casual multiplayer where you can play 4 games simultaneously
[*]you can set up custom rulesets to play skirmishes against the AI, or PvP in local multiplayer
[*]the story for the main campaign is fine, and has a good narrative
[*]the graphics are great - the maps are nice looking, and the fog of war is implemented well; the characters and their animations are good, as well as adorable
[*]the voicing for the narrative is excellent, the soundtrack is superb, and the sound effects are all done well
[*]good replay value with the live, casual, and local multiplayer modes[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*](nitpick) no keybindings for the gameplay, or any form of mouse customization, and there is no controller support (all of the actions are done with only the mouse)
[*](nitpick) hardcore veterans of turn-based strategy games may want more difficulty or complexity[/list]

The game took me about 4.5 hours on normal difficulty. Normal mode isn’t too difficult; I’m not super awesome at strategy, but I only had trouble on a couple levels. There were a few times where the AI did some predictable things, but overall I can’t really complain about the AI. Hard mode would probably be recommended for those who are decent with strategy games though. While I haven’t had any issues finding matches so far, the size of playerbase isn’t that large, so it might be harder to find live matches in off-peak hours.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Overall, Antihero is a fun, and adorable turn-based strategy game. Whether you just want to play the single player campaign, practice against the AI, play locally, or delve into live or casual PvP, Antihero is a solid pick-up for those looking for an enjoyable turn-based game that isn't overly complex.

If you like my reviews, please feel free to join my Steam group, and follow my curations [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AzralynnReviews#curation]here.[/url]
You can also view this review on my website [url=http://www.azralynn.com/review-antihero-game/]here.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198057949660', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1561816946}
review: 似乎我是第一个中文评测，哈哈。这是一个结合大富翁的圈地赚钱和蘑菇战争靠人数占领资源点的回合制游戏。饥荒画风，很有特色。主角是一个管理盗贼工会的大盗，通过占领地图中的教堂、击杀目标npc、用酒贿赂等达到一定次数达到胜利。匪帮这个单位拿人头升级，设计的很有趣。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996459029', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1500615815}
review:
A solid experience so far. First hour has been an enjoyable dabble in discovering techniques and tactics.
New maps vary up the average match and force slightly different styles.

Games have been pretty quick for me lasting 10-15 turns, but I focus very heavily on tech which seems to give me an advantage. Haven't looked into a rush down strat yet, but still feels like there's a lot to dig into even while understanding all of the pieces in the game.

A big thumbs up currently. 
Cheap, enjoyable, and deep.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993240784', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1500044360}
review:
Краткость - сестра таланта? Так это или нет-вопрос...но с уверенностью можно сказать, за внешней простотой порой скрываются серьезные проекты.

[h1]Графика:[/h1]

Симпатичная стилизованная рисовка. Такое мы уже нираз видели.

[h1]Звук:[/h1]

Тоже простенький, но не раздражающий...ОСТ не напрягает, звуков эффектов не так чтобы много.

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

Внешняя простота действительно обманчива....Вот здесь к примеру, ты не ожидаешь, что за миловидным стилем скрыта жесткая пошаговая тактика, где малейшая ошибка может стоить победы во всем матче.

Итак...некий городок викторианской эпохи погряз в коррупции, убийствах и прочих прелестях беззакония...Вы-лидер воровской гильдии...человек явно не без греха, но хоть как-то выживающий в этом жестоком мире. 

Ресурсов всего два: золото и маслянные фонари (странно, не правда ли?). Первый нужен для найма юнитов, а второй используется сугубо для апгрейда возможностей гильдии.

Каждая игровая карта - определенный участок с домами и разного рода "предприятиями"...задача проста - собрать определенное количество очков победы, которые тут представлены заказными убийствами, взятками, шантажом и т.д...Ограничений нет, можете хоть весь матч заниматься вырезанием контрактов, можете "давать взятки"...главное-просто уложиться в количество очков победы.

Для этого у нас целый инструментарий воровской гильдии...главный вор занимается разведкой, кражами и может даже резануть кого-нибудь своими ножами...важно лишь следить за количеством его очков действий. Есть беспризорники...они используются "для контроля предприятий". Есть громилы, которых можно на пару ходов поставить для перекрытия пути вражеским наймитам...Есть ассасины - одноразовые убийцы, любую цель устраняющие, но после этого сваливающие куда подальше...Есть веселые дядьки, готовые почистить любое предприятие от беспризорников, путем направления оных в работные дома)

А дальше начинается собственно игра...Используя всех наймитов и улучшения - собираем нужное количество очков победы = побеждаем. Но вот незадача, каждый юнит (кроме главного вора) может лишь выполнить одно действие за ход...некоторые же вообще одноразовые...за свою огромную цену предлагают огромный буст на пути к выигрышу, а за фейл - почти что гарант проигрыша. Приходится много думать...где поставить громил, чтобы перекрыть пути подхода врага, куда лучше направить беспризорников, чтобы получать барыши и пассивные усиления, какое предприятие снабдить ловушкой, чтобы подловить "дядьку" или главного вора, как раскачать банду, какие улучшения в гильдии в первую очередь брать, пойти убить контрактную цель или заняться подготовкой "шантажа" и т.д.. Именно правильные и своевременные ответы на эти вопросы определяют успех в каждом конкретном матче. Но не забывайте, что Ваш оппонент всегда бдит и если не глуп - найдет контрдействие...Ваша задача - предугадать его ответ и самому достойно ответить.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Не обманитесь...за миловидной графикой скрывается прекрасная тактическая игра, заставляющая думать...и думать.
Здесь есть кампания, но она скорее выступает как большое обучение для онлайн игры (в ней однако же есть интересные повороты событий и особые условия победы).
К слову, в ПвП режиме есть возможность играть онлайново и асинхронно (делать по ходу, когда зашли...т.е. играть с кем-то хоть месяц).
Итог, ставлю 9 из 10. Отличная пошаговая тактика, требующая продумывать каждый свой шаг. Есть кампания, есть онлайновые режимы и hot seat. Что еще для счастья надо?!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974286821', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1499735289}
review: Defense is far more expensive than offense, and the game always feels like you don't have enough money, actions, or lamps. It always feels like you are struggling right up until the moment you win or lose, and it's hard to tell which will happen until it does.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991356390', 'num_games_owned': 4785, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1703251872}
review:
I really like the style, concept and many aspects of this game. Can't reccomend it though due to some really questionable mechanics. In online PvP, of course, since it's very limited if you plan to play SP only.

- Matches tend to drag a lot in the late game. You and your opponent often come to a stalemate, when neither of you can win or lose quickly. This leads to frustratingly boring exchange of units with nothing more to it, which feels more like a chore than intense confrontation. Late game needs A LOT of work to make it worthwhile.

- Even worse, sometimes you can lose (or win) by pure luck. In the late game special heists are practically the only source of income, since every coin on the map has been burglared already. So these special heists give you much needed extra money, but they're one-time use and respawn after several turns. And this mechanic is just plain broken, since you can't predict when they will become available. Moreso, these resources spawn at the start of players turn, and this player can get them immediately with absolutely no way of stopping them. So in late game, when two opponents have no resources at all, there are often situations when one of them gets lucky and have these heists spawn for them 2 or 3 turns in a row, meaning instant win, while their opponent has actually NO means to do anything about it. No skill, pure luck.

- Assassins need a nerf. They need to either become much more expensive, or toned down. For now they feel more like a legal cheat than balanced unit.

I'm really sad since I had high hopes for this one looking for my fix of strategic PvP. Base of the game is fine, but it looks like there was little to none balance testing before the launch. Or it was limited to a very small number of people. Right now: not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144430156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1502803046}
review:
Im a noob to board games I have pretty much only ever played a bit of armello which i really liked but i found the turns were a bit too long.

I think this game has not been marketed very strongly as not a lot of people seem to know about it and since its mainly geared towards multiplayer im putting up a very early first impression to help get as many people on board as possible as this type of game lives of dies based on its playerbase. So far there are a few hundred playing which is good but i think more people need to know about this game.

For me the game seems really fun and im enjoying it so far the art style is great and it seems to have depth and interesting gameplay. I dont know enough about boardgames to know how truly good this is but for a casual like myself it seems great and i hope to see it grow and get the attention it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107913110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1510475978}
review: Wow. A turn based strategy game with simple mechanics yet surprising tactical depth. Add to this the cool stylized graphics, great soundtrack, and variety of pass and play, asynch and live multiplayer. The game also rund well on my intel atom based win 10 tablet which is well below the game's stated minimum specs. A winner all around, just buy it you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992714877', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1635115722}
review:
I've been playing since early access.  Antihero's gamplay is very original, and provides a gameplay experience that you won't find anywhere else.  

Its strategy is deep, yet simple to understand.  The unique levels each add a little wrinkle to the standardard ruleset.  I can't wait to see what new levels they will come up with to shake thing up even more.
 
A very neat game that keeps me (and my kids!) coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004229402', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1499979732}
review:
Fun turn-based game which you can easily lose track of time when playing because it is so much fun and very addicting. The game does a wonderful job in their tutorial when played in campaign mode. The music is pleasant and the art style is fun which makes the game even more enjoyable. As for the gameplay, it may seem easy but definitely requires strategic planning if you would want to beat your opponents. 

I highly recommend the game. I look forward to more maps/content in compaign and multiplayer mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103493320', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1537266397}
review:

It's so intense and once you get the hang of it you really can't tell who's going to win unless you strategically plan your way to victory and even if you're losing, at any stage of the match... you can comeback in many different ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012557320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1563515240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009212065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1499742515}
review:
a cute idea... but overall the mechanics just... sucks in regards to multiplayer. its either too shallow or in certain situations where a player pushes aggression early on super tiny maps, a complete awful chore to play. 

the system overly favors the aggressor and makes this sort of absurd cat and mouse situation in a ton of games where whoever snipes the other thugs creates this massive trading process. theres not really a method for dodging this because of the way its setup, if you attempt to ignore the opponents agression, they can easily walk right into one of your buildings, evict your units and then setup shop. this was an issue on the earlier ich.io version too... and its not really fixed...

i dunno, its a mixed bag, this sort of dominate strategy that sees infinite trade wars favoring whoever makes the first move due to the inability to train multiple thugs early causes so many retarded issues its not funny.

i'd avoid personally, it wasn't worth the rebuy(for me specifically, and generally not worth the buy for most people) from my perspective and honestly i dont see anything here that really warrants the $15 price tag. there are better board game type games for a similar price with... more well thoughtout styles of play.

it reeks of a lack of play testing from a pvp standpoint, and as someone who owns way way too many boardgames, this is just unacceptable. this definitely feels like THAT GAME in your collection that you pickup thinking it would be really fun, play it once or twice, and never pick it back up because quite frankly theres nothing note worthy about the game, its just okay.
 
its just... too simple to be fun, and the short campaign forces you into online multiplayer fast to get your moneys worth and thats... i mean theres just not enough here to keep it going, and some of the current mechanics of small maps with close spawns creates a massive problem for actually trying a tactic beyond try to zerg down your opponent in infinte trade wars favoring your side.

if i had to give a major reason for not recommending this game though, i'd have to say that its just not really for ANYONE. if you are into complex boardgames with tons of thoughts, this is too simplistic to really get that out of. if you are into casual games, the 1v1 cutthroat nature isn't really going to sit well. and if you god forbid want the game for single player purposes, you aren't really going to get anything out of that either, and its rather short and the first few missions hardly even count as gameplay as they often end before really interacting with your opponent in a meaningful way.

beyond that this is much of the same game seen earlier. its shallow, repetitive and is sorta a halfbaked indie darling. at the end of the day the praise this game sees is much to do with its art style and theme, and less so to do with its gameplay, which is... not great. do yourself a favor and pickup one of the other numerous boardgame style games on steam, or simply buy a better 1v1 board game like battlecon or twilight struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088785198', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1513195476}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091002816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1500151102}
review:
Antihero is good.

I prefer to tell you what I think before I tell you why. Theres a reason this game got nominated for so many awards and that reason is solid gameplay and wonderful art and music. The story isn't important because it isn't important. If you're looking for a dark victorian thief game, play Thief. This game's story is just a theme for a fun (tabletop) game.

The art style is really interesting. It's not as 'gritty' as Don't Starve but Antihero's art immediately reminded me of it. The style allowed me to care about the characters and really emphasized their personalities. All the tropes are here. The bored rich girl, the edgy thief, and the thief girl all make an appearance. The presentation helps me forget the tropes because i'm too busy looking at how pretty it is. The music is nice sometimes. During cutscenes the building music just gets slightly annoying but that's the only problem I have with it. The art is half the game but the other half is the gameplay.

Antihero exists because Civ 5 and being a dick is fun. The game takes place on a little game board. You have street tiles and building tiles. On every map theres a couple districts that you can steal from. At the beginning of the game only the thieves guild and the street in front of it is explored. The main character can use their moves to explore streets or buildings. When you steal from a building in a hidden district the district building is revealed. The district buildings can give you special buffs or collect resources after you steal from them. To get these buffs and resources you need to send street urchins to infiltrate the building. Along with street urchins you can also build gangs, thugs, assassins, and other units to control as much of the map as you can while denying resources to enemies. There are two resources. Money and Lamps. Lamps are used to buy upgrades to get new units and abilities. Money is used to buy units. There are several assassination targets around the map as well. Along with their little guard guys they make up the npc faction in the game. If you kill any of the targets you get a victory point. You can also get blackmail points from certain buildings and you can buy bribes with lamps. If you get all the victory points before your opponent, you win. There are a couple game modes with different rulesets but thats the basic gist. The ai is pretty smart and is able to deny you resources and collect resources pretty well. It also thinks a couple steps ahead and tries to predict your moves. The ai faction with the assassination targets is pretty smart as well. As far as I can see they try to troll you by blocking passages and teleporting the target around. This is either a smart ai or i'm just unlucky. As for multiplayer capabilities you have a local hotseat and two online multiplayer modes. Asynchronous multiplayer and a live match. The hotseat mode isn't all that great. Since my friend could see what I was doing he didn't have to scout me to check. It was like stream ghosting but without the stream. The game is pretty fun for a couple of hours and definitely worth 15 bucks. The depth is a bit of an issue though since theres not that many units and upgrades. But im sure in high level play it's all about the mindgames instead of all about the units. The game seemed to miss that "one more turn" effect that Civ games have because the games are too short. This made me get kinda worn out after a couple levels because I got bored of setting up the same starting base over and over again.

Pros:

+ Fun gameplay
+ Beautiful art
+ Interesting Characters
+ Easy to learn

Cons:

- Music isn't all that good
- Hotseat doesnt work for this game
- Kind of Repetitive

I give it a good old 3/5
